text: Food was cold and didn't taste good then to top it off the manager was yelling at these two ladies and just being so rude when they went nicely up to him to inform him that they weren't satisfied with the food yeah after that I'm good I'd rather go to denny's
Ive only gotten buffet to go.  Good price but everything was so greasy i wish I'd chosen another restraining to get to go from

i was soo disappointed the second time i went.  The first time i went i thought it was great they had shrimp scampi, alfredo sauce, etc but the line was just horrendous. just went again for lunch and it was gross.  Y'know how your first bite is supposed to taste the best?  It already tasted bad.  The liver steak was disgusting; hard, overcooked, and just a peculiar taste in general.  The asian food was gross, mexican food was alright, and the southern style food was just too fried for me.  The only hot food i enjoyed was corn and the mini steakk burger with grilled onions.  However, i did enjoy the fresh salad bar and the ice cream bar.  All the cupcakes and cake had way too much icing on it, and i love icing!

oh my.. our second time here and this restaurant is always crowded, super dirty, and not sure why, but always full of obnoxious customers with potty mouths.  I have 2 little ones and couldn't eat comfortably.
I went during lunch and everything was fresh. however,  the restaurant was not very clean, the bathroom smelled and our table was sticky..

Always a great place to get filled up.  Food is prepared fresh and you can see them actually cooking and cutting up fruit, and baking.  The management seems to be very visable, which is always a good sign.  Large assortment of food.  The steak is usually very good, and love the flavor of the ham.

Food was good and lots of variety. Didn't like that they don't have a military discount.  There are a lot of military folks here that could benefit from it and feel appreciated at the same time. Also didn't like that the manager would not honor my sister's medical condition and allow her to take her plate of food home without charging  $5.99/lb. It was like double charging for her food. She could not eat the piece of chicken or the piece of steak that she put on her plate so instead of wasting the food she wanted to take it with her for later. Called the manager over to discuss and show her the medical certificate and the manager refused to let her take it without charging for it again. Otherwise it was good and deserved a higher star for food quality but for the reasons stated I will not be returning until they start to appreciate their military community and take better care of special needs customers.

Went to lunch today, had to wait in line for 30 minutes to get in. We were disappointed that they do not serve steak until supper, could not find their baby back ribs neither. However, their fry chichen was nice & crispy, popcorn shrimp were good, Asian food were ok; was not impressed with the dessert bar, the banana pudding & other desserts were not as good as the other locations we went to before; the staff were friendly & courteous. So glad this restaurant is finally here, hope they open up the other 2 locations soon!

Been here twice for dinner. Food is always hot. Despite the fact that there is a huge line to get in which is no surprise considering it's the first one in Vegas it's worth the wait. I don't know why but I'm always a fan of crappy buffet pizza. Their garlic bread is tasty. They have your typical types of comfort foods( fried chicken, mac & cheese). The main star is their chocolate (milk & white) and caramel waterfall. Tried their white chocolate one, wasn't too impressed. Good price for dinner if you don't mind waiting.

I drove by many times while it was being renovated. Heard it was pretty good. So, a couple of days after its Grand Opening, a group of us decided to give it a try. The line was wrapped around the building. It looked like such a long wait. But looks can be deceiving. It took only about a good 15 minutes to get in and be seated. Anyways, let's get to the food review. Food was plentiful and ongoing, never had to wait for them to bring it out. Quality was good, service wasn't bad. But...the downside was, most items were extremely salty! Would I go back? There's a good chance, but hopefully the food won't been too salty the second time around.

Not a Fan of the entrance, or Location. Food was tasty but they ran out. My family and I drive to the one in Arizona for dinner every now and then. And that location in Arizona is great. SAD I will still have to drive to Arizona to eat there. Because I will not be returning to this location. Tried it twice and was disappointed twice.

Worst place ever! Sitting here having my dinner and they shut down the hot bar which was fine but the dessert bar too?? I'm still eating my dinner... Confused I keep eating and see one of the kitchen members throwing old food from inside the hot boxes right on the floor in front of us while we finish. How disgusting!

Breakfast was terrible...how do you ruin breakfast.  It is like they are not even trying...I even complained, she pointed out they have made to order eggs and omelets.  That was almost edible...if I had started there maybe...so best tip I can give, "start there!"   It doesn't get better...

personally been there twice, never had a problem or saw any of the complaints others have mentioned blows away hometown buffet my only gripe is trying to get a large piece of steak instead of small ones but it's always been cooked med rare to my liking love the bread pudding

Saw Golden Corral commercial on TV for all you can eat ribs. Paid $15 to find out from the meat chef that they do not have ribs. Very disappointed. Other food wasn't very good. Sirloin steak was very tough and mostly grissle and no flavor. Golden Corral is much better than the food at Country Buffet. Better value to skip both and go to a non buffet. Try My Mother's Kitchen for American food non buffet. My Mother's Kitchen is awesome for less money than Golden Corral and the portions are really big.
One of the worst experiences ever at a restaurant! Floors and tables were filthy. Workers were grumpy. No baked potatoes available...do not go...yuck!!!
Disneyland-lines to get into a buffet? No thanks. The food tastes good, but it's not worth the wait.

My family was looking forward to a pleasant end of year lunch at Golden Corral.  We rarely eat here so we were not aware of the pricing.  Well, we did not realize that Sundays had dinner pricing all day.  My husband politely asked the cashier why the pricing was higher.  She condescendingly stated that Sundays had dinner pricing plus our drinks... then she even used God's name to emphasize her point.  Did she really have to do that?  She never smiled nor make us feel welcome when we got there.  Now we will really not go back there at all.  There are 2 other buffets around that are more welcoming.

Well I went last night! It was pretty full and we were in line for say 15 minutes but the food is always amazing! they make the steak to how you like it and they have a very big salad and topping bar. Our waiter did the best he could due to the huge crowd of people.      I also really like how they display the fresh food in the back!      there are hardly any food lines and they refill the trays very quickly. The only problem i had was how many people were there and how loud it was.

Love the breakfast buffet very clean place the staff was great as well clean plates and eating here one of my favorite places would recommend this place to all of my friends but I really love the breakfast buffet

I use to love this place everything was so fresh and full of flavor. I have no idea what happened they must not have the same people cooking because everything is bland and tasteless they use to have delicious Mac and cheese that was baked and gooey and cheesy now it taste like it came out of a box... So sad you use to be so good I don't think me and my family will be coming back its very sub par now.

I loved this Golden Corral! In my opinion, it is the best one in the Cleveland area. The servers were friendly and attentive. The bathroom was clean, and the food was great! I loved the catfish and hot wings! They were not typical "buffet" quality. They were well seasoned, and very tasty.  I added a lobster tail for $4.99, and the server gave me a carry out box to bring it home in, because I was too full to finish eating it! If you mention a carry out box in other buffet restaurants, the servers flip out--assuming that you want to take buffet items home.  Additionally, I enjoyed the Mac and Cheese, the fruit bar, the pork seasoned pinto beans, collard greens, fried okra, broccoli with cheese sauce, fried chicken, dinner rolls, and mashed potatoes with gravy.   For dessert, I sampled and enjoyed strawberries dipped in chocolate, hand packed butter pecan ice cream, vanilla soft served ice cream, chocolate chip and peanut butter cookies.  Everything was fantastic! Bring your appetite and enjoy!

In recent years, the quality of their food has gone down. I use to love coming here to eat, and I particularly loved their fried chicken. On my last visit here, the chicken didn't taste as good as it usually was. I don't know if they are using a different brand or not.  Although, I am not a steak lover, theirs is still acceptable. So is the carved turkey and ham. The side dishes are OK..I enjoyed the mashed potatoes and gravy, the corn, and green beans.   I never cared for the pizza, their salad bar ( dressings are too mayonnaisey) , or taco station. I hate their ice cream, and I am not fond of their dessert bar (especially the under baked cookies).   However, the chocolate fountain is great! You can make your own chocolate covered fruit desserts, coconut squares, Rice Crispy squares.

This place usually rocks but not the location in las vegas. The food is bland and redundant. The food is always cold. The cashier are upset and impatient and always have atttitudes. The waiter never comes after he serves drinks so there a re a pile of plates stacked on the table. I get up and put then in the bus bucket myself The price is way to expensive for shitty food and they went up. For the amount of money you pay you can go to any of the hundreds of buffets vegas has for a better food.

Golden Corral has been one of my regular stable when I get a craving for clam chowder or sirloin strips. Most regular customers would agree with me that it is one of their signature dishes. No buffets in the LV can come close to the distinct flavors they have created. Unfortunately my latest return to GC has been a disaster! The line was long with just one cashier. But she was quick n efficient. The wait wasn't that long as I might have imagined. But when I was given a table n set to eat. That is where the disaster begins. Trash were all over the serving area. Most of the popular dishes wasn't replenished fast enough. And no one had a clue about the new Scallop BBQ skewers that were suppose to served which advertised on their website n storefront. When I saw lots of people was leaving impatiently. It should have been a red flag for me. But I was just too royal to leave before getting a taste of what I came for. Sadly the hr I spent there was just eating the scrap other customers were left behind!

Ate dinner here and to my surprise it wasn't crowded! It was clean, spacious , and our waitress was attentive. Staff was friendly! The waitress even knew that I made my self an Arnold Palmer! She refilled me with a better version.   I'm rating this a 5 star because of the type of buffet it is. I'm not comparing it to Bachannal Buffet! For the type of food and quality....it was good!   My steak was cooked well, the fried fish, pot roast, veggies, sweet potato casserole, fried mushrooms, and dessert was good! Those yeast roles were on point!   We will be back!

Great value! $15 for adult dinner which includes a soda. Great quality of food. Definitely better than "buffet." Breakfast served all day with made to order omelets. Array of food not separate by ethnicity of food but by type of food. Made to order STEAKS! And chocolate fountain with marshmallows, strawberries and Rice Krispies for dipping!

You know I had to rate a four on this one, went for dinner and had their steak, tasted much better than the five star, celebrity chef restaurants that I visit on the strip. A lot of their items were garbage, but if you know how to eat a lot of the items were quite good and yummy. Desserts were quite disappointing, they need to work a little on those. All in all for $30 date night not overly disappointing.

When the Golden Corral first opened we were very excited to have one in our area but when we went the first time we were very disappointed with the way it is set up.  Everything is crowded and people are practically climbing over each other to get to the chocolate fountain.  Getting from one end of the food selection s to the other is almost like a balancing act trying to hang on to your plate while dodging people!  I figured it was still new and that's why it was so crowded so we waited a few months before trying it again.  Last nite was worse!  The restrooms were a mess, the floors were wet, there was no toilet seat covers in some of the stalls and again, it was so crowded you had to dodge people to get anywhere.  People were rude, kids were running around and yelling....  THIS time we didn't stay.....

Five stars for the waitstaff, despite the 2 for the restaurant itself.  They were all friendly and kept our glasses filled and our empty plates cleared away.  The food was hit or miss.  The salad bar, for me, was a bright point.  I made a salad out of romaine and it was fresh as were the toppings.    The floor in this place was absolutely filthy.  It's winter so you expect some dirt but there were plenty of food bits lined up along the carpet edge.  It took a long time for tables to get cleared away.  The dishes are all plastic and eating off of them was kind of weird.  Seeing the scratch marks from so many eaters prior to my own visit was a little off-putting.  My 15 year old had been here with her grandparents in the past and she tried to warn us away.  We will listen in the future.

This place sucks donkey dick! I don't know what some people are talking about when comparing this place to other buffets on the strip, there is No... Comparing this to other buffets. I could deal with a long line but this place is so fricken Ghetto! The food sucks so... Fucking bad. Just go through a dam drive thru seriously, how the hell do you charge 15 per person and the selection of food is complete shit. Plate size, portion for steaks, salty ass friend chicken watery mash potatos, watery chocolate fountain, warm drinks, and before anyone says anything I seen the fricken kitchen when the door was open and there was shit all over the floor. It was a fucken mess.  Seriously, if you are gone spend even 15 bucks per person just go to the strip or another buffet where it is clean, the staff know what their doing, your not having people breathing down your neck and you will get to eat at a real buffet where the steak is not the size of half a cookie. Don't waste your money and your time, it is not worth it. If you don't believe it then good luck going there cause this place SUCKS!

Perhaps the two star "Meh. I've experienced better" is the most accurate rating for the Brookpark Golden Corral. Now, the problem is that I've been once and there probably won't be a second chance to make a good first impression. When it comes to the other reviews about the messy buffets, at least that's understandable because that is the fellow diners making that mess (although hopefully the staff understands the need to pick up after them in a reasonable time frame) and there's not much you can do to clear a path around the kids there but with cotton candy as a buffet staple, the business point of view is clear... attracting families! The food choices and variety was halfway decent although "Meh. I've experienced better." The Golden Corral was on my bucket list but with that crossed off, it's time to check out other dining options.

I usually Love Golden Corral but after yesterday I will NEVER eat at any of these restaurants again. Within an hour of leaving this location after eating lunch yesterday  i felt very sick. I am pretty sure that it is food poisoning as i have not been able to be away from a restroom for very long. The rest of my family didnt get sick however i am the only one who bit into some extremely pink chicken. It is now the next morning and i still feel awful. I may need to go to the hospital.

The food was tasty and our waiter (Mike) was very attentive & professional. HOWEVER.... IF you're going to give away Comet goldfish to children as prizes for winning games, please make sure none of thim have ICK (white spots, mostly on fins) and that the parents know these fish get over a foot long. They're pond fish. Ours "Billy" & five others I looked at had several ICK spots.

I can't believe anyone is complaining about this place. I have lived here for 12 years and I can say this was a great buffet, I thought the price, service, and food were great for a buffet. I originally thought it was stupid to have a buffet right down the street from boulder station, Arizona Charlie's , etc... But it actually made sense to me today, I went there with a friend for lunch today and it was great, I didn't have to walllkkkkk thru a huge casino to have my 1/2 lunch, it was great we got there at 11:50 and thankfully there was no line, when we were leaving yes there was a line about 15 people. But it was great I would recommend to everybody. Only downside is I don't cook with salt and it seemed like the Asian food was really salty, it might just be me. And FYI the restrooms were super clean.

I use to love going here. there. about this last visit was sad. many food items were empty, workers didn't keep up, on re stocking. some items were warm, at best room temp. However the server was on top of her job. cleaned plates quickly, and kept pops filled without having to ask.
Been to golden corral several times day and night. 8 times out of 10 no waitress around to get us our drinks. Need better service there.

When you go into Golden Corral it feels alright because the crew makes you feel like you are at home. But this place is far from home. Though the crew is nice there are only a select few, some of the crew were nasty and horrible. The food on one hand was downright disgusting. The food was very fatty and high calorie. The meat was sometimes under cooked and after I ate I felt horrible. So in all this restaurant was terrible

Wish we had this choice in California. Good quality buffet, great variety, and much less expensive than the buffets we have here in southern California. Also, the price included beverage and dessert.  Yes, it can get noisy; however, that is to be expected in this type of facility.

Great service tonight, even though they were very busy. Erik,our server, was so polite and constantly refilling drinks. William, the grill master, said "thank you for coming in tonight" every time he served us a steak. Got to love good food and polite old fashioned service. Thanks for a happy experience!

Food was okay.  The lady at the register had a smile but had a stupid look on her face like she had something stupid to say.  Some tall black guy that was probably the chef started following me around like I might eat too much at the buffet.  Also one of the bust boys kept hanging around my table and starring at my women like he might of wanted to say something to her.  Which would have made my day!  I felt uncomfortable there I wouldn't recommend eating there again.  The atmosphere is dramatic.
DeMarlo was a good waitor.. but would have preferred not to have my first bite of bourbon chicken have a jagged bone in it.. jammed into the roof of my mouth..  so I spent lunch barely able to eat..

Went to this place last week with my wife, baby & mother in law for dinner. A couple of days later my baby started throwing up before bedtime & was sick for 3 days. I got sick right about the time she was getting better now my mother in law is sick too & my wife is starting to feel it. Instead of a nice meal from this horrible place. We went home with a doggybag full of the Norovirus. As most of the other reviews stated. The place is a filthy mess. Most of the supposedly clean plates & silverware still have food residue on them from the previous customer. I had to go through a stack before I could find a clean one. So if you want your whole family to get sick then this is your place. The health department should shut them down.

The workers were nice I guess, the food wasnt very good. Everything about the place just seemed so damn old the wallpaper plates, ceiling, and decor. You dont expect much from a buffet, I would like to feel a little cleaner while I eat. I typically dont eat buffets, but we dont have these in Minnesota and I thought we would try it.

I love coming here for the rolls & honey butter alone...Delish :) I totally have a food-gasm from eating them!!! This buffet wins hands down over any other. The last time I went to a buffet my sister (unfortunately) wanted to go to Old Country & it sucked hard-core. Dry food, unappetizing flavors, crappy choices, etc.  If you're wanting to stuff yourself silly go here...great selection of food to choose from. I especially like the sweet potatoes, Bourbon Street Chicken with rice, and meatloaf. Skip the mac 'n' cheese...very bland...blech.   The wait staff is ok, no one particulary friendly or fast, but I doubt anyone expects exemplary service from a buffet. This location is a bit better/cleaner than the other one at Stapley/Cooper.

Worst. Restaurant. Ever.  I saw long lines here ever since they opened, so I finally decided to check them out. The building is nice and the decor was what you would expect of a newer restaurant. However, the food was very mediocre and not edible. I left the restaurant feeling a little sick to my stomach, and as I'm writing this, I'm still wondering what I even ate there. There were also ants hidden in between the napkins on the table.  I still don't get why there are long lines here, and I probably won't ever be back here again. Go eat somewhere else - your body will thank you later!

Been wanting to try GG ever since I visited Texas. Most people who live there say it's an ok buffet, I guess I am just a sucker for anything new.  The problem with his location is the wait. Unless you have a tactical deployment plan with your friends to help secure a place in line, wait until they open another location or you can catch a window of opportunity.  We showed up around 2pm on a Friday, and there was about a 30 min wait.  The weekend prior was roughly about 2 hour wait.   Once you're actually inside, the line moves quickly.  They also seat you rather quickly as well.   Typical buffet fare, I think the highlight would be the Grill area and anything that comes out of there. Also the desserts are quite plentiful with various options like Cotton Candy.  I would come back, but not until the hype settles down.

Ok I have been here many times now. I love the salad bar. Steak cooked to order. Cabbage and Meat Loaf. All food is excellent and price is great too. Also the weekend breakfast is very good and includes your beverage for about $8.50. Give it a try.

i consider this the best buffet in town compared to old country & hometown. there is a large selection of all types of food. there is no skimping when it comes to food selection. they have a large dessert bar also with sugar free desserts. the desserts are awesome, not just the standard boring kinds like hometown. all the food has been really good. the lunch price is about $8. this does not include your drink. drinks are another $1.80.  dinner is about $10, not including your drink. service has always been good. the food is always great.

Meh. For the price, it isn't bad. I'm full, but I don't think I'll find myself ever craving to be here.   Foods I liked: The pork steak is pretty good but really salty. There is something called the fish...pasa?? Next to some guacamole and pico de gallo. It was good with both. Mashed potatoes and poultry gravy was good, but if you go wrong with mashed potatoes, you might as well quit now. Cookies and cream ice cream!  Foods I didn't like: I stopped eating the orange chicken a few bites in, as well as the lo mein. Their strawberries for the fondue machine weren't very fresh nor big. I was going to put the buffalo wings in the precious category, but they didn't make the cut. I got three pieces because I love wings, but only ate two, and the second was more because I wanted I give it another try instead of wanting to eat more. It tasted a little sour (might be because of the sauce??) and was not warm. Or hot. Little colder than lukewarm. Not cute. Their coffee is mediocre - not good, not bad - but not good enough to make it into the "likes."  The tables are pretty cramped, and the soda machine is in the entrance where very one waits to get in. This is pretty inconvenient for people who want refills, but sometimes the servers will stop by and ask if you want one. I just make my brother get refills for me c: they also have a cotton candy machine (not self serve) and a chocolate fondue machine with skewers, marshmallows, cookies, strawberries and Rice Krispies if they haven't run out yet. Feel free to help yourself, but be warned that the chocolate is kind of runny so make sure you're not dripping on the way back to your table.  Basically, the food isn't terrible, but if I want to stop eating while I'm eating...that's pretty bad, especially because I'm not a picky eater.

Watch out if you think GC has healthy food.  If you go in and eat only the vegetables, they are soaking in MARGARINE made with hydrogenated soybean oil.  Soy is genetically modified and an endocrine disrupter.  For real butter, you have to ask your server - the "butter" they have out is actually margarine.  They use soybean oil for their deep fat frying (but this is not unusual.   I thought it was a good place to go, but the brussel sprouts/carrots/green beans, etc. are all swimming in margarine - which they determined years ago to have massive trans fats and to be worse than butter. It's good to know that GC will save a few bucks at the cost of their customer's health....
Very good food.  Better than Hometown.  BBQ Chicken is excellent. Cotton candy is a must.  Price is reasonable. Expect a lengthy wait in line.
Waitress was very nice and responsive. A lot of hot food items were actually way under temp, potential for people to get sick. Very low quality food for the amount of money we paid.

My husband and I stopped by Golden Corral for lunch on April 30, 2014 1:30pm...I advise you to keep driving, don't stop. Why? 1. The front of the restaurant had a lot of trash...and it wasn't a windy day...first impression. 2. As you walk in you pick up a plastic tumbler for your beverage they are brown and not the color of the plastic brown...stained. They should just buy the brown ones. And the plates should go also...presentation goes along way. 3. No one greeted us and since it was our first time (last) visiting it would have been helpful to be informed of Golden Corrals process. Normally you pay before you get your drink...weird. 4. As we were looking for somewhere to sit...that was difficult because the floor was dirty, rolls stuck in the leg of chair and crumbs at more than one table and around the serving stations (it wasn't too crowded to do a quick sweep)...no one had a roller broom (Wal-Mart is across the street).  5. Then we had to find someone to wipe off a table, she didn't touch the seat that had crumbs, did it myself. 6. The DEAL BREAKER...we went to the back section by the waitress beverage station to visit with friends. We were HIT with that sour SMELL when a restaurant hasn't changed the water they are using to wiping the tables with for some time...Golden Corral please put a cap full of bleach or   hydrogen peroxide in your water if you aren't going to change it! That smell makes it hard to enjoy your food, our friends has sinus problems that day...lucky for you! 7. Before we could get out of the parking lot we were both feeling sick to our stomachs. Yes we should have ran at the front door, but we were trying to support the community.   If you are brave we give the food a 2  1/2 out of 5. Good luck!

Okay, so this was our first time here and I would never return. Everything was filthy! Including cups, plates, silverware. None of the food looked appetizing. We did come at 7 pm but that really should be no excuse. We complained to the supposed manager Kathy and she was very rude and could care less about what we had to say. What a great manager! So, on top of the crappy food the customer service is terrible! No wonder this place is the way it is. My family really wanted to enjoy this place but we couldnt.

A basic buffet style restaurant, Golden Corral offers a lot for a relatively low price. Does this mean the restaurant is good? Not necessarily. Read on...  (Scales are 1-5, same as Yelp ratings)  Atmosphere: 1  During peak hours for breakfast, lunch and dinner, the place is jam packed with seniors and families. Fortunately, the restaurant has a decent amount of seating, but you'll still feel like you're packed into a sardine can. Additionally, the food is REALLY close to the seating, making eating very uncomfortable as people pass by you to get seconds (or thirds, fourths...).   Service: 3  I can't really complain too much about the service since a buffet is naturally self serve. But, the employees at the cash register were prompt and the waitress serving drinks was relatively attentive. I gave the service a 3 largely because I found that the food servers failed to refill food bins on a timely basis. Additionally, the deserts area was a mess. A lot of the pastries and cakes had to be taken by hand. The area was generally dirty given chocolate stains and ice cream droppings. Reminded me a lot of my days in the dorm dining halls in college.  Food: 2  Ever been to an average Las Vegas buffet? This, for the most part, mimics it. Largely American based foods, with Americanized ethnic foods (orange chicken, burritos). The food is kept hot. And, I admit, the food can be tasty. There are vegetarian offerings. The desert section is limited, especially for those with diabetes.   Cost: 3.5  You can't beat the cost of a buffet if you eat a lot. So, quantity will typically match cost. If you are a senior or a child, there is a nice reduction.   Pros: Decent cost. Certain dishes are tasty.  Cons: During peak hours, jam packed and very uncomfortable. Buffet offers basic American or Americanized foods. Desert section is lacking and disorganized.  In sum, avoid this place like the plague during peak hours. Go here only if you want quantity. If you want a real Buffet, go to Vegas.  Sample Size: I have eaten here once in the last year.
Awful. Just disgusting. Cold food. Not going back. Yuck!!! But at least they finally got rid of that chocolate germ fountain!

My son and I ate Dinner there on a Saturday night and we found the dining experience to be entirely satisfactory.  The food looked and tasted great, the restaurant was clean and tidy, the wait staff was both efficient and friendly.   I especially enjoyed the Southern Fried Catfish, it was crisp, flakey, and very tasty. The best I've had in Pennsylvania.  I will go back again, but I think I'll make it on another weekend night vs a weekday.

Went a little late in the day.  Service was excellent, the food Hot and Cold as needed.  The food I selected was tasty.   The place was clean.   Everytime we eat here we always are very satisfied with everything.
Overpriced for what they serve, bad service, and not a nice place. For a buffet, Red Rock is a best option for the same price.
Prices are too high, especially on Sunday. The atmosphere is not inviting. The restrooms are messy. I doubt the level of cleanliness in the kitchen. Not worth the price. Look elsewhere!

I get pist off when a buffet charges for beverages. The beverage is not included in the food price. The place is super crowded. They serve pork steaks instead of beef steaks. The food was too salty and the price was high.

I really enjoyed golden corral .. It was surprisingly clean and service was amazing .. The food was piping hot Friday November 20 around 12 in the afternoon . Alicia was my server very helpful she litteraly stopped by my table 6/7 times to ask if I needed anything . food workers were helpful when I didn't no what the food consist of . overall I had a amazing experience food was delicious service was great . the price was ok as well I just hated the drink is sold seperately . I will be back soon

Let  me start by saying that my husband and I have been coming here since our dating years lol (about 5-6 years ago) and we come really often, like 3 sundays out of the month, and we still love it! Now we come with our 2 boys and guess what? They love it too!!  Pros-pretty much everything, specially their pot roast ?(^?^)? Cons-staff is great, except for this one girl that I always forget her name, we have seen her over the years grow from a server, to a cashier and I guess she is like an assistant manager now but she is so rude!! I will get her name and post it next time we go!  Get her fired and then this place gets a 5 star!! Lol

The only reason why I'm even giving it one star is because you have to in order to write a review.I love food and I'm pretty easy going it's not really much that I won't eat or don't enjoy eating so for my birthday it was decided we would just go to Golden Corral to enjoy a buffet style dinner, to my surprise and shock there wasn't really a lot to choose from and everything that was out did not look that enticing the one thing that was pretty decent was the pot roast and when I got ready to go back for a second helping they had already put the new pot roast out but for some odd reason it didn't taste as good as the first one, the only other thing that was good was the cotton candy but of course they seemed either stingy or too lazy to fill the bag up completely,my boyfriend and stepfather even complain that the ice cream had no taste,how in the world can you possibly mess up ice cream he also wrote his own review,in both our opinion and my family unfortunately we will never return to this Golden Corral we may try the one on Brookpark and if that's not good then it just looks like there is no golden corrals in Ohio

Lines are WAY too long for overly salty foods. I guess people only come here for the cheap prices. For some reason, I prefer Hometown Buffet more but I am the only one haha. Although the chocolate dipped strawberries are kinda fun!
Def cleaned up since the last time I was here AND they have fried green tomatoes & chicken livers?!?! OH YEAH!

Voted best buffet in mesa for a reason.  breakfast costs about $7.00 and comes with a complimentry drink or coffie.  Breakfast includes all you can eat steak, eggs, bacon, made to order omlettes, and much much more.  For Lunch they do not have steak but they have a new special everyday. My favorite is the fish fridays.  the pot roast is amazing.  For dinner they have a new theme every month or so.  Right now it is seafood including an amazing newberg, coconut shrimp,  and an amazing clam chowder or cheese and brocley soup.  The restaraunt is set up so there are 4 main dining rooms and a banquet room which is perfect for big family events or buissness afairs.  this golden corral in Mesa has one of the best management teams i have ever met.  These are people that you can tell truly care about what the guest thinks about the golden corral.  If you go to one restaurant this year, go to golden corral!  well worth every doller.

Well first of all if I'm going to pay $17 for a buffet I expect quality service. Unfortunately this did not happen. The young girl who was supposed to be my server greeted me after I was there for 10 minutes then I never saw her again. After finishing my salad my tea was empty... so I moved to another section and they young guy (server) was awesome. I asked to speak to a manager. The manager came out and spoke to me and apologized and said he would talk to the other server. Unfortunately speaking to someone now days doesn't get the job done... oh this will be the last time I visit this Golden Corral!!!!

We came here for lunch today.  It was my first and LAST time!  Atmosphere:  When I opened the door, it smelled like a bathroom that needs to be bleached!  OK, so ignore the smell, maybe its just the wonderful fresh air is playing with my senses.   However, half way through our meal, the waitress was pouring hot water from a coffee pot onto the carpet and scrubbing the floor with her broom, then sweep it into a dustpan.  Did someone just puke there?  or was it a food mess?  but why pour water onto carpet that people are walking on, its not going to dry!    Took a good look at the carpet, it looks like its been there for 20 years and never cleaned.  Service:  The waiter got us water and came back once to ask if we were OK.  He walked by several times to service the table next to us (they had 8 people, we had 5) but didn't bother picking up our plates.  We ended up putting our plates on a nearby table so we can get the table clear.    Food:  Decent.  Some items were bland.  Some were good.  Some were over cooked.  I really like the multigrain bread roll.  Clam chowder was ok.  Chocolate fondue was the best part of the meal.  But were are never going back to this location again.  Eating while the place smells like the bathroom is not very appetizing.

The food is okay. Not great. Just okay. They use too much pepper in their fried foods, perhaps because they don't have much flavor on their own. The fries are mushy. Good selection of other foods.  Nachos are great.  The chocolate fountains are a draw for kids but are really kind of scary if you watch what goes on at them. With 3 different fountains in 3 different flavors you get people sticking stuff in one after the other so all 3 are mixed since the stuff recycles and there are food particles all around them. The items they serve to dip are horrendously dried out or wilted. I really don't know why the fountains are so popular with any adult.  The one real complaint I have is that you have to rely on wait staff to get drink refills. By wait I mean waaaait... we were there nearly a half hour before our server breezed by our table. The one refill we got was because I got up and went to the register myself. I've been to Golden Corral before and this is par for the course.
I went there with my family food was horrible took like 10 mins for the waitress to get me a refill then for desert I got angle food cake it was hard as a rock.

I have eaten at this Golden Corral for over 12 years. It was one of the greatest Buffets over the years. BUT... this location in Concord is old and despite several renovations it has a major problem with infestations of roaches. I personally have brought it to the local management at this location ..the management at at one of this franchises other location and to a CORPORATE Quality Control Team  did not seem to see there was a problem. Either myself or my wife have seen roaches on the salad bar or desert bar no less than 4 out of five visits. The last visit was when the "Quality Control Team was in the store. I will never cross the threshold again. The Tyvola Rd location in the University area is in the same franchise and we enjoy dining there often.

If you're not picky the food is good. Salad bar is good. Dessert bar is wonderful. Chicken enchiladas look good but were like rubber. Ham was ok. Meat loaf was barely ok. Chinese wasn't good.  Service on the floor was nonexistent. Won't be back.

Okay so here's a review for this place:  First off I see a lot of people complaining about the level of children in this place, and to all those defending the kids, yes I totally understand this is a family buffet and there's a lot food aimed towards children, but even as a young adult myself, I also kinda have to side with the complainers here. I didn't have a problem with the level of children, but I DID have a problem with how some of them acted around there, it wasn't even the smallest kids, but kids around 6-10 years old that were the most irritating. I cannot tell you how many times they would just cut in randomly and take food, or touch food and not take it. The worst was when I was about to pick up the utensils to grab the last garlic bread some kid came up and took it with her bare hands! I mean uh parents of these kids can you at least take a little effort in how your kids act when going out? Yes their kids, yes they don't care about others but COME ON, I REALLY don't want your kids touching food I'm about to eat thanks, and I'd also like to grab the food I waited in line to get next, but whatever, it didn't bother me that much to a point where I wouldn't come back solely because of that.  BUT minus the kids, which really isn't too much of a big deal, I really liked this place. They have a really great varieties of food, and most importantly, they know how to do it right! Nothing tasted off or anything you'd expect from a typical buffet. And yes, they do have steaks at this buffet! They aren't the best steaks, but they're still better than most places. I honestly don't think there wasn't one thing I got here that I did not like.   The best thing about this place for me, which totally made this place ever better was their dessert section! One of the BEST casual buffet dessert places I've been to. The flagship dessert item here is their large chocolate fondue fountain! It is amazing in every way you can dip rice crispy, marshmallows, sugar cookies, and also strawberries! They also have real ice cream besides your typical frozen dairy sludge that melts in seconds, and also which totally took me by surprise, they make cotton candy freshly made!   Overall, I really enjoyed this place, its so much better than Hometown in every way, the food was excellent, and that's why it deserves 4 stars. The only other problem besides the level of kids, which regardless still won't keep me away from coming back, is their setup when you first walk in, you get your cup and drink before you pay and then you kinda have to stand at the register with a soda that will probably be half finished before you even reach your table. The line wasn't too bad when I got there, about 10 -15 minutes, and for the record, you WANT their to be a wait especially for a buffet! Why? Because that means people are constantly getting food meaning things will be replaced more often and therefore fresh food that hasn't been sitting there under a heat lamp.  Will defiantly be coming back!

I do love this place!! The only problem is, some people (mostly children) are really messy and sometimes different foods will get mixed in with other foods which could cause an issue if someone had a food allergy or something. I've really never had a bad meal here; the food is good, hot and fresh. The servers could use a little work on their customer service skills although most are nice for the most part. You definitely get what you pay for. The only real problem is crowding and it's a pain if you get seated next to a huge group with a bunch of screaming kids running around. That happened to my husband and myself once; we simply asked to be moved to another table and the server was very cool about it :)  One of the best buffets around!!

Not impressed!!!  I intentionally waited awhile after they opened to avoid the craziness... FAIL!!! The line was crazy long which is fine, you finally get inside to be greeted by a soda fountain but OOPS!!! Out of everything except diet crap!!!  15 minutes later upon FINALLY reaching the register, $15 a person??? OUCH!!! After waiting behind a pack of screeching children to finally be seated, I make my way to the food and no big surprise...  more empty platters and disappointment!!! They didn't even have two of three Chocolate Fountain flavors!!! I'll stick to Stations Feast thank you very much!!!

We went tonight for the annual Military Appreciation Dinner.  The line was around the building, but they were moving people in and out pretty fast.  The servers and staff along with the JROTC that were volunteers for the evening were very organized and were able to seat people rather quickly.  The food was good, they were maintaining the buffet regularly, and everything was very good.  Thank you Golden Corral for supporting the military

Well it was Easter Sunday when we went in and man were they busy. So I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say that maybe on not so busy days they keep it together a little better? The food was mediocre for the price ($35 for two- yikes) and the fact that we can't get our own drinks and have to wait for a waiter to refill our drinks is ridiculous it's a buffet hello. The waiter was sooo nice and he was doing his best to keep up but it was just so busy.

The GC...  Me and my g/f would come here once in a while if we have no idea what we are craving but want some variety. I try to stay away from any of the carbs or starches since it can be a hit or miss with them. The salad bar is pretty decent and same goes with the foods being grilled.   The service is always good every time we've gone. The waitress are always very nice and fairly prompt.   The chocolate fountain is a nice addition to the desert menu  Overall, the GC is decent buffet place. Not my top choice but sometimes it's my last resort choice.

Stopped there 6 weeks ago for breakfast.  Great. Till the cantaloupe tasted like fuel. Called a manager and he took a sample to the older blond overweight boss. She came to my table and denied that hers tasted the same. A lady seated nearby spoke up and said the day before it did too. Manager type cranky woman all but called us liars. Fast forward to yesterday. Now the cantaloupe tasted like dirt. Left it on my plate. Someone recently told me there was a problem with cantaloupe tasting like fuel last summer. I wanted to throw it at the same cranky lady sitting stuffing her mouth 2 tables away.  Talk about  rude. No other complaints except they peel potatoes in a loud grinder in the salad area that should be done away from those trying to speak to one another.  I have worked in restaurants. That is kitchen work, not when 500 people can hear it. Otherwise...good food. Clean.  Needs replacing blond cranky lady.
Love this place! The only Golden Corral Location I'll eat at, and I live in Mecklenburg!

We chose this restaurant after leaving the hard rock casino in northfield. The restaurant was extremely busy this Sunday evening. It was a seat yourself tonight. There was so many tables that were not cleaned leaving the seating selection very limited. Our server did not come around very often to refill drinks until we found the general manager. The restaurant was kinda dirty due to all employees just choosing to not take pride in cleaning up. The food was good as to expect from here as we have eaten at golden coral in the past. Before we left the general manager provided us with passes to come back again on them. I think it would have been a 4 star experience is they had not been so busy.

I ate here last night with my family and was very pleased with the place.  We went right at dinner time and they weren't very busy at all.  We had no problems finding a table to accomidate my family of 5.  The plates and silverware were stacked at the front and was easily accessed.   The food was something else.  I had some Louisiana chicken and rice that was really good and I also had some Beef Pot Roast that was loscious and tender, and some mashed potatoes and gravy that reminded me of the comfort food of my mothers.  My wife did have a slice of their meatloaf and it was very dry and neutral on the taste.  Probably because of how dry it was.  The desserts were the average kind of desserts and were tasty but not out of this world.  The waitress was very attentive and did a wonderful job with my three young children and all their demands.  The place was very clean and organized.   We will come to this location again even though there is one closer to our home.

My husband and I were very impressed with the wide variety of food available at this buffet.  The quality of the food was quite wonderful as well.  The service, however, was horrible.  The server asked me 3 different times what I was drinking before she finally brought it to me 20 minutes later!  She never cleared the plates off of our very small table, and wasn't very friendly either.  I am sure we will return and try to steer clear of the horrible waitress.

This place is packed on certain holidays. I think it smells horrible. If you go near closing time, there is a big difference starting about an hour before they close. The guy grilling steaks, who you would think loves his job, seems inconvenienced anytime he is asked for one. The chinese stir fry is not even as good as panda's in my opinion. The pizza is worse than some frozen types. I even like waffle houses chili more than the chili they serve here. This is a good place to just load up on as much crap as you can eat before puking, if you don't care about your health enough to eat somewhere that has better quality food.

I called three times to assure the restaurant had sugar free desserts and all three time jazmin would hang the phone on me little did she know I was going to take 103 federal employees. I will take my business elsewhere.
Buffet was decent. I recommend trying the fried chicken. Too much food for me though. Service was so so, took a minute for my drinks .

went to eat here this evening with my baby sister for 4th of July! I was actually starving this time! Lol- the food was actually not that bad today! I ate 2 plates! The rolls are to die for! As for the dessert buffet is too! You can't get enough!     I don't like that the bathrooms are always stinking and the floors are disgusting - not sure why they can't use bathroom cleaner and a air freshener! Also I think it's a lil pricey for the food you eat cause sometimes it's not that great! My server Kim was awesome though she kept my Tea at tip top! She was really nice as well! Other then that it's ok I guess!!!

I will tell you, the commercials for this place is definately misleading. The food is mediocre at best. Cleanliness is not there. This place is disgusting. Bathrooms are filthy and the "clean" plates were covered in food. Way overpriced for what you get and to top it off is in the GHETTO. I will never come back here and hope that those of you who read reviews don't either.
I'm not a fan of buffets, and this one doesn't make an exception!! But i guess when you hungry anything is good

You know what out of all the buffets I been to I can honestly say I loved this place. The food was actually good.  Didnt taste old or dry like some other places I have been too. The food actually tasted fresh when I went. The prices weren't to bad. I paid 46 bucks for 4 people. And they all enjoyed the food.   Amazing staff. Always refilling our drink, and clearing our tables.   The desserts were amazingly good.  Will come back for sure.

None of the food is too extravagant. All basic foods and there's a big variety but after eating I began to feel sick because of the food. Thought it was just an isolated incident but after reading others' reviews I see I wasn't the only one.

Great staff always busy but always willing to help. Love the sirloin steak and the deserts are wonderful. I would recommend going for breakfast. Omelette chef is happy and makes a great omelette. Prices are good for amount and quality of food.

I did not like the food at all. Maybe it was because we arrived an hour before they closed I don't know. The food was not presented in a clean manner. There was food mixed up with other foods and I thought it was safe to try the Pot Roast but it was dry. The desert table was a mess. There was cake frosting everywhere and pie and brownie crumbs in the jello. I skipped on desert and skipped on a second helping. The service was nice and attentive it was not helping my appetite. I it just could have been a bad day, but being a lover of buffets. I do not think I will be back. My search continues for a good buffet.I hear they are open for breakfast. Maybe that would be better. It would be hard to mess up a scramble egg.

Found 2 long nice pieces of hair in my salad. Not to happy about that. I'm a big fan of this chain of restaurant always have been they never really let me down at all. So I was surprised to find two pieces of hair in my food. the lady who gives you your refills was super friendly and attentive. And the rest of the food was good like it usually is. Some of the workers at this location though back behind in the kitchen on the salad bar side where I found my hair don't look too happy and I did see a couple of them practice some unsanitary techniques by on the salad bar side. I don't know but the manager needs to check out the lady who preps the salad area.

Cucumbers were frozen, waited and waited while the cook for the steaks helped everyone that spoke Spanish and everyone of color but wouldn't take my order as in white felt very discriminated against spoke with the manger about this all she offered was to get me the steaks which at that point it took so long that I had gotten other food cause I was hungry, rest of salad bar was good very tasty, chow mien noodles where nasty, the burden chicken was very good. The carrot cake was dry as was the fudge and brownie cake, the tarts area said flirt tart but it was a coconut cream tart and some chocolate cream tart both of which was nasty but the cotton candy was good. The employees were very rude the place was disorganized and at one point it they lost power. Can say we will never return which is too bad cause the one in rapid city South Dakota kicks this places butt sorry but you guys need a lot of work might want to look at management  as a former food and beverage supervisor this never would have happen and near did.

Went on a Friday night at 7.  The line wasn't that long. Got in within 10 minutes.  After seeing all the commercials I decided to give this place a try.  The selection looked ok.  I tried the fried chicken which was nothing special. The pot roast was lacking flavor. The sirloin steak was very tough to chew and overcooked. I asked for rare and was given medium. The teriyaki steak was also overcooked. The sauce was ok. The bourbon chicken was tasty and was the clam chowder.  Their salad bar was ok but the tomatoes and onions should have been diced. The side order of lobster tail was a 3 oz tail. This was the best thing on the menu.  Overeall not better than your average casino buffet.

This place is seriously overrated. The line was out the door and packed inside. Waited a while and food not at all that great. Station casinos have MUCH better buffets for almost have the price. It seemed like I was in a cafeteria or soup kitchen. It was unorganized and people all over the place. Really messy dessert station.

Only on my second plate but i cant be more happy to say when i forst arrived my soda was flat the owner changed the syrup and brought me 2 sodas... much better i can tell the staff work very well together and i work in customer service so i know the drama in the work place i over hear convos from workers and only hear positive things which is great becuase when you go to a resturant you only usually hear all the negative stuff ...Great food totally worth it ...i always enjoy coming here but i will say today i am very impressed!!!

I have been waiting for a Vegas location forever. After seeing all of the commercials on tv, it was getting irritating that there was not one here. I am glad they finally opened. There was about a 30 minute wait to get inside, but well worth it. The food was high quality and my son loved the dessert area. My only gripe would be the chaos that goes along with any buffet. Only this is in a smaller area, so it was more noticeable. The service was fantastic! I will definitely be back again. They should open a couple more locations. AND THE PRICE WAS AMAZING!!!!!!!

So I was reading through the reviews of this place and I see that they are a bit dated so im going to update a few things for you guys! They now let you get your own utensils and plates instead of giving them to you when you pay.Yes it is crowded but hey its good and cheap come on now! And yes there are alot of kids running around but I dont really mind it all that much since I have two kids of my own.....now dont think that im letting my kids run around this place because Im a better parent that that! The food is good,I really dont see a problem with it at all! I really dont care where things are located on the buffet line as along as they are there im happy and I dont mind walking a few feet to get my salad! The rolls are amazing with the honey butter and I cant get enough of them. And a tip....wear something warm,they crank up the ac so its freezing in there....pretty sure they do it to make people leave quicker! I have had one bad waitress here and we told the manager about it,they ended up giving us a whole box of fresh buns and honey butter to go! yum! so as long as the food is good and they dont have flies in their food which happened to me last week at souper salad then im a fan!

...it's been a long while since i had the chance to hit up Golden Corral (May 2008) because they were not located in SoCal.  This visit was not bad for what I would have expected from a buffet.  I appreciated the selection although I was not able to take advantage of it.  my company did though.  they enjoyed, enjoyed, and then enjoyed the food (some more).  The wait was outside of the front doors but it moved.  the staff was friendly and prompt with updates on the wait, seating, etc.  the food looked very fresh (on numerous times I saw the cooks bring out new stuff).  i also managed to visit the facilities and they were clean despite the place being packed.  there was a line for the lady's room though.  i'm not big on buffets so this would not be my first choice to visit when i'm up in the rowland of heights (i'd prolly do korean) but it was great when traveling with company who would not be open to food outside of american.  thanks for the memory, see you again in 5 years...

My family and I had been wanting to check this place out ever since we had seen the commercials, and I'm guessing many people are on the same boat.   In all honesty I'm glad I got to check it out, but I won't be back and I would not recommend it. It was super crowded and when we got there the end of the line was outside the building.  The food is edible but nothing great and for the same price I could go eat at a station casino and get better quality food. But I'm giving them three stars because their staff provided good service and was friendly:)

My hubby and I have eaten at Golden Corral for years. It feels like we've been to tons of them between southern California to Florida, and now here in Gastonia.    This one in Gastonia was very busy and crowded...nothing unusual, there.  Actually, if they WEREN'T busy and crowded, I'd think something was wrong with the food.  Lol.      The staff stayed busy cleaning tables, sweeping up food and trash from the carpeting, mopping up spills, refilling food buffet areas, bringing out clean dishes and silverware, getting things for customers (like high chairs, replacement silverware, etc,) and still smiling and being helpful and polite.    It did seem that the staffing could be a little better since sometimes a server would be doing two or three things at once, and not always able to refill a drink or clean an empty table right away.  For this, I don't blame the servers one bit as not even one of them was just standing around, doing nothing.  Instead, it's the Manager's responsibility to make sure there's adequate staffing instead of simply having servers do the work of two or three people...something that Golden Corral, in general, sadly seems to be 'famous' for.  (This is one chain I would not work for!)   The food was the usual fare that this chain provides, and was good at this location.  Hot food was hot, cold food was cold, and the salad fixings were fresh.  Empty buffet trays were replaced with fresh trays in a timely manner, and even the dressings, sauces, sour cream and butter/margarine were kept filled.   Loved the flavor of the New England Clam Chowder even though it was more 'milky' than 'creamy'.  (What can I say...I'm a spoiled New Englander. Lol).  The Broccoli/cheese soup was very good!  Sadly, the chocolate and caramel fountains were just as 'thinned out' as in other GC places that we've been to.  (sigh)  I know...it's expensive.    The meatloaf, itself, was great but a bit overpowered by all the ketchup on top of it.  I scraped off most of it and still had a good 'ketchup' taste.   (I have this hope that someday GC everywhere will start using gravy on the meatloaf or at least cut the ketchup quantity in half.)   I loved the tuna salad...tasted fresh and had no relish or pickles in it.  Just chunk light tuna and mayo to which I added some scallions, diced hard cooked egg, jalapenos, black olives and cut up tomatoes.  YUMMM!  (Plus a bit more mayo which it definitely needed after I got done with it.)     I love fried chicken but theirs was a bit overdone and dry so I passed on it.    The Sweet Potato Casserole with mini marshmallows was delicious, the baked potato was just okay, and the instant mashed potatoes were fine...especially since it's kind of hard to screw instant potatoes up!    The veggies were the usual...nothing special to write home about since half of them come from cans anyway and nothing extra is done to them.  (I do love the canned carrots, though.  Guess I've developed a taste for them. Lol.)  The canned collard greens are cut up but were a bit tough and a little bitter...should have been seasoned with some ham, bacon, salt pork or smoked pork hocks.  Anything to give it some flavor!  The brussel sprouts, broccolli and cauliflower had to be cut with a knife.  Very chewy.  Maybe they're healthier this way but I, for one, don't like them hard.  Even HALF cooked would be an improvement IMO.  The Pot Roast in gravy was tender, seasoned just right, and wonderful.  This pan emptied fast, too!  While I love seafood, the battered shrimp was just a little too 'battered' for my liking so I took most of the batter off of each shrimp before eating them...still tasted good!  The broiled white fish was pretty good, and the salmon was great.  I loved the Mac 'N Cheese as usual. (Hey, not everything that comes from a can tastes bad.)...and it tasted even better once grated cheese was put on top!  Yummm.   While I didn't get any food cooked specifically for me, like steak, other people seemed happy with what they were receiving.    The Prime Rib piece that the Carver cut off for my hubby wasn't a slice but a chunk...very tough to eat and not enjoyable at all.  My husband tried to eat it but gave up after a few tries.  True, he could have gone up with another clean plate and requested a real slice this time but he just didn't want the hassle of waiting...requesting...and maybe even then not getting what he wanted.      All in all, if you've eaten at one Golden Corral, you've eaten at all of them.  The selection stays pretty uniform, and you know ahead of time that the food will be decent, no matter what state you're in.  There's really no surprises with them...including this one in Gastonia.  The only thing that seems to change is the price which is up to about $20 per person, here.  (Hint: The Passion Grill in Gastonia...another buffet you might want to look at.)

No stars should be given I had to give a star just to post  absolutely horrible.....even the ice cream was terrible....how do you mess up ice cream.....the one good thing was the cotton candy but they were stingy with that only filling the bag up a little....we will never go back

I don't normally like giving chains the thumbs-up but I have to give it to this one.  I first was introduced to Golden Corrals years ago in the South  ( maybe North Carolina )  and well in luv with the endless choices of meats, veggies, sides and the ding-ding of the bell which means fresh baked goods like bread and muffins.  Everything from steak to chicken to pulled-pork to shrimp to pasta, etc. is available and a huge area just with desserts will also make you smile.  Come one, come all and bring your appetite!

Food....normally a good experience, excellent for buffet food. Steak is actually tasty, there are several shrimp choices, and the desserts are plentiful. I have seven children so satisfying everyone can be daunting at times but not here. Everyone leaves satisfied here.  Ambiance...ummm, I should probably use the word setting. Not always the cleanest place. The restrooms have a lot to be desired. (Teach your kids to open restroom doors with paper towels). This did not affect my rating but the restaurant draws a clientele that is often dirty and rude. We have been here on numerous occasions and I always feel crowded.  Staff....over worked and under paid. I have had good waitresses and bad ones. It's just luck of the draw.  Verdict...if you are hungry then this is a good choice. Almost everyone can find something they enjoy here but I would not take out of town guests here as the ambiance is lacking.
Great food and friendly waitresses. Favorite Golden Corral in Phoenix.

Yeah, ok, got there just before a hugh line started for lunch.  Dinner is impossible.  Sorry not willing to wait an hours for dinner.  So as far as the food goes, it a little better than Hometown, and the price for lunch $8. and some change was not too bad. I did notice that breakfast is slightly higher by about .50 cents but still under $9.  Not sure why.  But here's the review on the food.  The steak, which everyone is  supposedly coming here for is a chuck steak, generally about $1.99 per pound in the market, generally we (butchers) make ground beef from this and sell it at $3.99 per pound.  So its tough and chewy.  So when I initially saw it, I was surprised they would be charbroiling it.  I love charbroil, instead of pan or griddle fried.  But not to be disappointed, they threw the cooked steak onto the flat griddle to continue cooking and cutting the steak into smaller strips. Not only does this double cook the steak to well done, but also make it drier and more tough.  Total waste of meat.  I liked the hamburger sliders, but too much bread for such a small piece of meat (another filler).  The sausage looks good, but tasted like cardboard filler inside,  I didn't like the texture, it didn't taste like a sausage. The meatball in the spaghetti tasted better than the sausage.  The meat lasagna was also good, but any pasta is again fillers.  Can't go bad with the Fried chicken, but the fried shrimp was more breading than shrimp.  As Chinese food is concern, I wouldn't touch it.  Looks and taste worst than Panda.   Mexican food, look like something from Del Taco, the Carnitas looks extremely fat and greasy.  Too many good and cheap Mexican restaurant in the area to want to go here for mexican foods.  Same with Chinese food too. Not into salad, if I wanted rabbit food, I would go to Soup Plantation down the street, its cheaper.   Drinks is expensive as far as soda and selections.  Hometown you can get your own whenever and whatever you want.  Here's it is more limited.  After your initial selection, your waiter/waitress gets your refills.  They are always around but it harder to change your mind since you don't see the machines and the selections. Dessert is not bad, cookies, cakes, chocolate fountain, fruits, but unlike other buffets which general has only softserve ice cream, GC also serves real scooped ice cream which I prefer.  They also have cotton candy which the kids definitely love.  Would I go back? Yeah, probably once a year.  Its not our my list of favorites.  Just like Hometown.   Just keep your expectations low, and you won't be disappointed.

I am disappointed because the quality control dude must have gotten laid off. Last couple of times the seafood salad was warm, no deviled eggs, and the pot roast was dry as a bone. I asked the girl behind the counter to at least spruce up the pot roast...she said they make it the night before and its been under heat lamp all day, so what do I expect...really??  I expect my $12 to feed me since its a buffet! Unfortunately, if the food is inedible I will walk away hungry and pull into McDonald's on the way home.   Please clean it up over there...it use to be really good!!! And I love the seniors packing it in at before 3:59!!! It assures me food rotation! That's why it's always been so good over there because the food was always fresh!
I absolutely love it here! The food is great the people are nice, and the food is somewhat great. Sometimes the food isn't always right but overall it is such a great place to spend with family

Okay so, the food is passable and you will leave with a full belly, and if you approach the buffet with an appetite the check will seem worth the cost.  However, the staff looks like they were recently released from prison, and the place smells like a corpse is rotting in the air conditioner ducts! Still better than Il Forno Italian bistro by a long shot. Where you leave still hungry and feeling guilty about blowing $16.00 on a plate of SpaghettiOs.
OMG. Hands down to today's steak chef. Excellent tenderness, juicieness (if there was such word)

Ok. I've loved Golden Corral forever but this one here just brought all my hopes down. It was insanely packed. Tons of people come here after church and you better be prepared to wait. We paid $41 for 2 adults and 2 children so we thought we better get our foods worth. My husband thought the sodas tasted watered down. If you need condiments the server will help you with that... Luckily.  I got a plate with meatloaf, Mac n cheese, cabbage, mashed potatoes and cornbread and was ok. Had to add some salt pepper and ketchup for meatloaf. Desserts was slim... I thought they would have more desserts. The kids didn't like the ice cream but the loved the chocolate fountain. I also went to the fruit and salad section and was bummed there wasn't more fruit. Only sliced oranges and melon was available. Skip the sesame chicken. It was waaaaaay salty.

I recently visited Golden corral 2641 in Las Vegas Nevada for breakfast with Dad.The place was nice and clean however the  customer service was horrible. I was ignored several minutes while standing at the  omelette station by the employee  Eva that was in charge of it . The Manager (Tomas) was also behind the counter  so I asked him, did they make fresh eggs? He replied yes, so I stood there waiting patiently for Eva to ask me what I would like . The entire time of me standing there, she never looked up and gave me any eye contact even after me trying to say good morning and addressing her by name. The next thing I know another employee whom I assume was on their lunch break walked up to the counter. She immediately acknowledged him, start speaking in Spanish and started making  his omelette. Still giving her the benefit of the doubt. I thought maybe she didn't see me so I stood directly beside him. She completed his omelette gave it to him and turned around and walked away.  At this point I realize I was being blatantly ignored, so I turned to look for the manager that I initially saw behind the counter. Before I could say one word  planning just to ask him if Eva spoke English he goes into a rant saying "we're working here ,working here" This is a new promotion...I guess referring to the omelette station that I didn't had no idea was new or old . I was in such shock the next thing he said to me was so what kind of eggs do you want? At that point my appetite was ruined I felt disrespected. I looked for my dad who was just about to sit down to eat his food and told him to leave it. Then asked the manager immediately for refund. After realizing his mistake he tried to apologize but was too late. I then name and he just gave me a card with no response I asked his name again and then he blurted out "Tomas" this is no was to handle A Dissatisfied customer. The problem would've easily been resolved had he said the station was not open, when I asked him did they make fresh eggs. Eva or Tomas could've simply said the station wasn't ready.

LOVE THAT THEY ARE BACK!  Great place with awesome food.  The staff is great and pay attention to details.  ALL YOU CAN EAT STEAK how can it be any better?  Great prices 2 adults and 2 kids eat for under $40.....AWESOME.  Only drawback is there are long lines, BUT SO WORTH THE WAIT.

The Food really starting to get better, And that chef on the grill with the glasses is amazing best thing going ever since I been coming to golden corral , his presentation for his food, and them steaks speechless keep up the Good work#proud customer

THE GOOD: - AYCE for a cheap price - lots of different desserts! (ice cream, soft serve, cotton candy, pastries, cookies, fruits, chocolate fountain)  - Staff is nice  THE BAD: - LONG LINES. OMG.  - The food is just okay. Don't come here expecting some gourmet stuff. - Dude working the grill is such a NOOB!!!!!!!! Kept burning steaks, and doesn't know how to cut meat. You can't have someone who's terribly inefficient working the most popular part of the place!!!!!!!! - Their chinese food makes Panda Express suited for royal emperors

It's not what I had in mind. The food was pretty disappointing, didn't look so appetizing. The dessert wasn't even pleasing. I pretty much picked on all my plates. Although I will say our server Pablo was quite the charmer and made the visit pleasant. Overall not worth the sixteen bucks.
Food was great and our waiter was the best I have had in a long time!  Ask for Arcadio when you come here, he was great!

Stopped here after church with my 4 little ones. I paid and got our drinks no problem. Everyone got their first plates of food and we sat down to eat. My youngest son started fussing and out of no where threw up. I was trying to clean up what I could (heres where it goes very badly). "Waitress" was notified of what happened, she not once offered to move the people around us (there was puke on the floor). In fact she said well someone will come clean it up. I was trying to get the kids out the door. As we got to the front I ask a girl to get me a manager. I wanted to let them know so that the people could move (it's carpet, not quick easy clean up). I explain what happened and to my shock he says "We'll I'm not cleaning it up it's your responsibility". Not concerned about the others eating or my son. I said well it's on the floor and people are trying to eat and we didn't eat anything.  Not once did this MANAGER offer anything but rude and snarky comments! I won't be going back to this place anytime soon!

It was a wonderful day.when l arrived at golden corral, l smelt all kind of food. I love that place because of the different kind of food. I had shrimps, fish, hushpuppies. They are people friendly. I just enjoyed myself.

Went there for the first time today with my Dad. I had been to similar buffets before and wasn't expecting much. Some of the items were great...some, not so much. My Dad had a piece of bacon that he thought was spoiled. I was trying to decide between the sirloin and prime rib. Tried the prime rib. Mistake! It was the driest and toughest prime rib ever. So, I went back for a piece of sirloin, and it was heavenly. The dinner rolls were a little chewy but the salad fixings were fresh. Tons of desserts to choose from. My Dad had carrot cake and was very happy with that, saying it was flavorful and moist. I opted for the macaroons dipped in the chocolate fountain. All in all, it wasn't bad. If you come hungry, you feel like you got your money's worth. But, if you come wanting some really delicious food, it's hit or miss.

Food was okay, but the steak was a little too dry and undercooked. My waitress was very rude and would attempt to get my boyfriend an I to sing a birthday song to her. Who does that? Very busy and staff was impolite. I don't recommend coming here if you are looking for good steak and friendly service. (Cotton candy was good, though!)

Entering the restaurant, you are greeeted warmly. Once seated, you are almost immediately forgotten. We have to go up the front counter to get refills. Our table fills with plates as the waitress walks past. The food is hit or miss. Mostly over cooked or really bland. A few items are really good....the roast is awesome. The shrimp would be spectacular if it wasn't over cooked. The steak is Pretty good but somewhat gristly. None of it is worth $16 per person.  Our waitress tonight earned a $3 tip.  I came in with $10 to offer(20%). Good service =Good tip.

This is by far the worst Golden Corral I have ever been to-- and I've been to a lot. For $12.99 for dinner, I'd expect the buffet bars to be fully stocked and then replenished on a regular basis. I'd also expect staff to clean the bars regularly, especially of stray food that lands in another dish. Neither of these occurred.  The restaurant appeared sorely short-staffed, and those who do work here didn't appear particularly enthused about their work. Between the constant announcements of "Code 200" and "Your children will be burned by the 165-degree bar if unaccompanied," it was an unbearable atmosphere. Go to a nice sit-down restaurant instead where you will certainly get a better value and atmosphere.
Don't waste your money on the filth. Disgusting and dirty and I personally watched food workers not wear gloves when working with food. Nasty
The food was amazing and the staff was so friendly. The lines were pretty long but hey it's thanksgiving so I can't complain. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.

Felt like cattle as we were forced to wait in a long line to get in, and even longer lines to get food.. All the servers and cashiers were very unfriendly, in a hurry to go to their own lunch breaks , and kept forgetting to bring the refills we asked for, not mention they never picked up all the piling plates on our table as well as the others around us. Even though they have more food selection than hometown buffet, it's not worth it for such shitty service and long lines.. And to top it off, we found hair in our foods twice on the same visit!!! Eeewww!!
As long as a buffet has a variety of different foods, I would like to come in again and again. It's worth spending the money instead of Station Casinos in North Las Vegas.

My husband and I decided to try the Elyria Oh Golden Corral one more time after having a bad experience there before. Nothing has changed. Food cold. Shrimp on a skewer raw. Steak could be used for shoe leather.  Breaded chicken over cooked and dry. 15 people were waiting for the cook to give them steak when I asked for shrimp which the cook had to get some from the freezer to  grill.  One person cooking steak and shrimp. One piece of meat was supposed to be prime rib that had been sitting there  ten minutes while I was waited for some shrimp to get cooked which was still raw when I bit into one.
