Vegetables, mash potatoes cold.  The deserts are the only thing I would admit to that are good. How can you ruin cake. Cleanliness????? very bad. Food on the floor.

So we went to Golden Corral for lunch, fail. It was $24 for me and my husband and 1 drink, to me it wasn't worth it. The salad bar had no lettuce in it, the chicken was so salted that I couldn't even eat it and I'm the kind of person that even if I dont like it I will eat it anyway because I dont like to waste stuff. The macaroni and cheese was over cooked so it was pretty much just mush, the potatoes where good tho. Then I stood waiting for ice cream for 5 minutes0 because first they had nothing to put it in then the lady that was supposed to be getting it for me got distracted rolling dough, I finally got so fed up with the people wanting to socialize with each other more than wanting to work that I just walked off. And the poor guy that was supposed ot be "taking care" of our table was so lost and confused we asked for refills of our drinks and he took them all one by one instead of taking 2 at a time so he wouldn't have to make so many trips. It was like when they opened they gave a uniform to whom ever walked in and said "you're hired!" They had everything any regular buffet would of had except for the chocolate foutains, which I didnt use either. So, in conclusion, over priced, pathetic service and not worth the drive all the way over there.
This particular location is filthy,disgusting and horrible. If you don't mind these things you'll have a great time.

I have been to this location many times in the past, and it is usually pretty good. My son and I visited on a Friday night at 7pm on 11/30/2012. The line to get in was not too long, but it took almost 20 minutes to get through because everyone had to wait to be seated. Eventually we were shown to a seat by the manager.   First off, the place was absolutely filthy! Food, silverware and napkins littered the floor everywhere.  As I looked around, every table is my section had tons of plates stacked all over them. It was obvious that there was no server taking care of them.   A good majority of the food items were out every time I went up to the buffet. What was there had been picked over pretty good, with just small pieces or crumbs left behind. What I did manage to find was pretty good though, as the food here usually is decent.  We were there for nearly an hour, and never once did anyone come over to check on us or refill our drinks. Like every other table, ours had stacks of dirty plates that no one bothered to collect.  As we were leaving, I pulled the manager aside and told him of our experience. He simply stared blankly at me. I told him that perhaps he should be running the restaurant instead of seating people on such a busy night. Again, no response.  I may try them again in the future, but definitely not on a busy night, it seems that they can't handle being busy.

Love the smiley faces at the entrance. Also the food variety. If you had to choose foods between this and Old Country I'd go with this. Both good though. LOVED the desert placr and the chocolate fountain.

Gluttony gone wild,will not be going back EVER!  Carpet in the Buffet room....really?Dirty dishes,piles of food on plates,overworked food servers(that poor woman,I thought she was going to have a heart attck she was working so hard)serving ,cleaning ,making tea and washing the dishes ,Good Greif! First time there and no one even pretended like they cared if we knew where to sit or get drinks or anything ,poor experience.

I wrote to The Website over the Presidents Day weekend to report that it had erroneously dumped the City of Industry location's reviews onto the newly opened Las Vegas branch's page, and then deleted the Industry location from its business listings. http://www.yelp.com/biz/golden-corral-las-vegas-3#hrid:Ry3JAbjA2qRYVNY6jB7jhg  As it now stands, the Lamb Boulevard GC that opened two months ago (Dec. 19) has 362 reviews under its belt--just one actually written about that restaurant--and an established, vital business at 17635 Castleton St., Industry, went "poof." http://www.reviewjournal.com/business/golden-corral-opening-las-vegas-207-new-workers  The following Tuesday, the page was revived, and at this writing has two reviews, total.  LVGC, the real one, has its own page (you're on it now)--the heading's only difference is that it contains a phone number--with 38 reviews.  Incredibly, what might have caused the original error was a picture posted on 4/22/12 of GC Industry, somehow slugged "Golden Corral, Las Vegas, NV," unaccompanied by a review.  I'm guessing some Dudley Do-Right, Capt. Peter "Wrongway" Peachfuzz or a logarithm, decided to straighten things out.   I'm not asking for votes or comps here.  I want you sit down in your chairs, power up your online devices, open the window, stick your head out--flag this review--and yell, and say:  "I'M FED UP AS HECK, AND I CAN'T STOMACH THIS ANY MORE!"

The food was great prices are reasonable,  however; there is no order to the line waiting out the door the closer you get to the front the longer the line becomes,  because groups of 5 seem to multiply to groups of 15 to 20.. No joke. Sorry people but if your party isn't all there you shouldn't be allowed to have them keep cutting infront of everybody else! Plus watch your kids people, seriously, dirty fingers touching everything and running under people's feet not cool!
Always a great experience eating at Golden Corral the food is always fresh hot & delicious place food , always impeccably clean staff is wonderful especially the manager

FOOD POISONING. Ate the bourbon Chicken and an Iced Tea.   I was visiting my hometown (Cleveland), and my group decided to go here.   I told them that it was not a clean buffet.  I tried to give this restaurant a second chance.  Next morning, horrible food poisoning symptoms.    The silverware and plates are not clean and the cups have dried up food particles stuck to the inside of them.  The price was 11.99 (May 2014).  The server was excellent.  They were open on Memorial Day.  Don't waste your money.

This specific restaurant was horrendous. They didn't have a lot of food choices. The floor and food counters were dirty. I love the one out in Robinson and never been disappointed. We came to this location because it was near the emergency vet hospital. I will never, ever, ever come to this one again. Please be warned!

Always great food! Always packed, reminds me of good 'ole Furrs days! You'll remember that place if you've been in Vegas long enough!   Valentina is my favorite server here, she's sooo attentive & sweet!

This should of been a ZERO for the person seating guests on 04/14/17 @6:35PM. JERRY is his name and I highly suggest he gets more training perhaps in customer service. Rude and disrespectful at its finest! I simply asked if there was any closer seating by the food area since my mother inlaw uses a walker. His reply "What do you want to do? You either sit on that side, or the other side!" seriously?!!!! **JERRY YOU SUCK!

Word of advise, do not go there on the weekend unless u like waiting outside in line in the sun for at least an hour.  The line stretches back to the parking lot.  They even have these water mist sprayers so you can cool off while you wait.  Line kind of reminds me of being in an amusement park (Disneyland, Six Flags).   There is only one other nearby location in all LA/IE/OC area in Hesperia so I can see why this place gets packed like sardines.   Place is packed with people and is a zoo.  Other than that they have a variety of different food. I personally digged the boneless buffalo wings, they taste like the ones from Chillis.
This place is horrible, they need to clean up me and my younger brother got food poison I'll never go back.
Not a fan of buffets, but chose to eat here because it was my father's favorite place.  Noticed that none of the cooks were wearing hair restraints.  That's a terrible practice for food service.

First time here at golden corral. My bf was excited to come here but was a complete disappointment. The bill was 40, i get it it's a buffet no big deal but the food and service was awful. Our waiter didn't bring us refills or pre buss our table and the food was dry. definitely not coming here again and it certainly was not worth 40$.

Went here on a Saturday afternoon and the buffet was wiped out of all of their breakfast and salad selections did not see any employees trying to keep it stocked other than the cooks trying to keep up at the carving station dessert selection was very empty as well
About what you'd expect from an all you can eat buffet. But, as mentioned in other reviews, the steak guy was obnoxious enough for us never to return to this location.

It's been nearly a decade since I was in a Golden Corral.  I was happy to hear of the first opening in the Vegas Valley.  First off... The have one of the largest selection of any buffet in the area.  We went on a Monday which is their Shrimp and Seafood special day.  They had 6 different fish dishes in addition to the usual buffet favorites.  But SURPRISE they also offer grilled to order sirloin steaks!  Prices are a might higher than usual with adults at $11.89. Seniors over 60 at $10.99 (Seniors Monday thru Friday 1 pm to 3 on are $7.49).  If you have kids, Tuesdays are for you.  Kids on Tuesday are just $2.99!  So.. If you are looking for a different place to go... check out Golden Corral.  I can't end a review without mentioning our server.  Meghan was right there answering questions, clearing the 'debris' of our feeding frenzy, or just checking on us... always with a smile.  THANKS MEGHAN!

we have been waiting an extremely long time for Golden Corral to arrive in Las Vegas it has been open for a few months now and we finally got a chance to go across town and visit when we got there line was outside of the door and into the parking lot it took us a full 30 minutes to get through the line into the building and then from the front door to the cashier took us another 20 minutes     excluding how busy it was and how behind they were the food was extremely fresh and amazing it was well worth the wait and one of the biggest and most delicious dessert counters I've ever seen and I have lived in Las Vegas my whole life

I love this buffet. They have lots of great food. The food is really really good and they have a very wide variety to chose from. They also have many great deserts. The only thing I wasn't too happy about was the price because it is a bit pricey and they don't offer any type of promotions or coupons.

My family and I go to Golden Corral every Sunday after church. I saw the commercial for the lobster add on and my son and I wanted to try it. Wow!  Not only was it a great value it was also delicious.  We can't wait until next week so we can have lobster again.

They have literally EVERYTHING like every single thing I craved they had! Brocoli cheddar soup, shrimp, grilled cheese! Everything, EVEN COOKIES & CREAM ice cream. Waiter was consistent! Loved it here!!!!!!

Long line, decent food. Highlight of the buffet is definitely their chocolate fountain and cotton candy machine. Also, they have really nice waiters.   If the line wasn't so long, I would come back. It's not worth the wait though.
Wonder Service The lady working behind the Bakery was wonderful Beautiful Smile and very Pleasant Her name was Marion
So very crowded. This is my first time at an American buffet. Food selection is good. Good steak.

I love this place so much go here all the time with my family after a basketball game or if we are celebrating something. The things i like about it is they have all kinds of good foods and their drinks are good. The servers sometimes may not be the best but most of the time i go they are on point when they see a empty cup they will go and fill it quick. They always come up ask how we are doing and its just great!!  When you walk into the restaurant you really feel welcomed they have a little arcade for the kids when the lines are long, They normally don't have you wait for a long time and they always seem to put me in the best seats. The bathrooms are clean and don't stink, when you walk out you cant get tooth picks just in case you might be there with a girl. The restaurant is usually clean food here and there but you definitely want to watch your step.   I think the best thing to get there is the steak, it's so juicy and good. But overall this is the best place to go when you are trying to impress or celebrate even just food. All the deserts are good they have a chocolate fountain and ice cream. The best thing about it is theirs no limit so keep going until your full easy as that.

First off the staff here are amazing and surprisingly patient.  They definitely get four stars. They answered questions and did the best they could to accomdate our group during the dinner rush.  However, the food wasn't that appetizing and the bathroom was pretty disgusting. I don't think I will be repeating this dining experience.

WOW!! cold food the wings was ice cold the steak was like rubber.  Wish now I took my family some where else.  Most items was out or looked old.  I love chicken livers but those was burnt and hard are rocks the dessert stuff was picked though and the bread was not all the way cooked.
This place is a mad house BUT the food is better than decent and they have a large variety. Everything seems to be made fresh in house and the service people are responsive.

My friends & family really enjoyed it in the beginning. Now what the hell 3 choclate fountains & no more jumbo fried shrimp? whats up instead providing good healthy food first then maybe little desert, now switch to fat sugary desert as their priority. We want good food not fat sugery dersert.. Thats bad business tried to save money on shrimp and switching with 3 OverWeight Fat Ass Fountains.. WHERE IS THE PRIME RIB? STOP SWITCHING FROM GOOD TO BAD!

If you've been to a Vegas buffet this is nothing near it. First impression when I came in on a Tuesday night-- wow ghettttooooo! I've been to many buffets, but the food didn't look appetizing at all. I went for a plate and there were a piece of chocolate cake still stuck on it. Im not normally a germaphobe but that made me check twice on the cutlery. It was soooo busy and packed, it seemed like a refugee camps' cafeteria where people haven't eaten before.   Good:  - good variety for what u pay for - cotton candy - Chocolate fondue  Would I recommend waiting in a long ass line? No way. But again, good value for the money: steak (dry medium rare), ribs(dry), ham (dry), spinach n salad bar fresh. Dessert omg super sweet.

-The place smelled like homeless people (urine and dirty mop water)  -The cashier was rude (There was a group of 10 and we there were some stragglers, so one came in and told the lady he will be right back to pay he wanted to see if everyone was still eating. Well 2 minutes later the cashier walks to our area and yell across 15 tables "Sir you need to come pay")  That is poor customer service. She could have walked over to our table and told him that. When requested to see the manager she said it was protocol.   -There was a lot of children running around wild touching food and putting it back. They need to enforce parents to tend to their children when at the food bar.  WILL NEVER GO BACK!!

we went last night for the first time, it was just okay.  the food was mediocre at best.  the only bright part of our dinner  was our server Sabrina.  She was friendly and attentive, always kept our drinks refreshed...we'll probably come back because we have boys and they thought it was great!

First time here and it was ghetto!  People in line were so ghetto.  This little boy, about 8, was getting ice, spilled the ice cause he got too much and then got more ice.  What a waste and where was the parent?  Not watching him that's for sure.  FYI it wasn't an Asian kid.  Food was ok.  Killed my curiosity, will not come again due to the type of people who frequent here.

The food here is always hot, tasty, and lots of it.  My son loves the Pot Roast dinner, and my wife says the salad is always fresh with lots of great toppings and dressings.  I love the fresh made omelets on Sunday mornings. The steaks they serve are a real let down.  They are always tough, with too much fat and gristle on them.  But then this is not a steak house restaurant.  I've never had a bad experience with any of the servers,  and for the most part the bathrooms are always clean.  With the changing of food choices and new dishes, l most likely will stop back on occasion.
The food sucks too much it was very salty over  cooked and bad quality  ..the enviroment stinks ..very disappointed ..not reccomanded

I love this place! The good was very good. A few of my favorites were the pot roast and the sweet potato casserole. Nice variety of meats and vegetables. They have chocolate cheese pie that is AMAZING!! Our server Alicia was the best. She was very attentive and super fast and friendly. I recommend this place for a great variety of food to chose from and great service. My husband and I enjoyed our experience there. Will definitely be returning

I loved the Golden Corral in Lake Havasu City and would go a few times a week. After moving to Vegas I was excited to learn Golden Corral was opening here, and not far from my new home. So I went on the opening day - big mistake. The food was simply awful, the service was inept, the restaurant not properly laid out to handle a big crowd! Took me over an hour on line just to get to the cashier.   I waited about 2 months and went back for lunch. Time to get to the cashier was now reduced to 40 minutes, not much improvement in food or service.  After another 4 months I was ready to try again. No line whatsoever at noon - went right to cashier. Food quality is now average (a tremendous improvement), and while service was mostly inadequate I had one server who was quite good. With Vegas being a buffet city Golden Corral is more for locals - I think I can now safely recommend you won't be disappointed - as long as you don't have high expectations. The best part of Golden Corral is that you can choose to eat healthy here - salads, vegetables, etc.  If you want a better Golden Corral (of comparable size) experience, drive down to Lake Havasu City, where there's always an franchise owner on the job - schmoozing with the customers, overseeing operations, and making sure the food is hot, fresh and plentiful.

Place is decent came in about lunch time 1140-12pm not packed at all on a Monday  Food was decent I would recommend this place for people who like buffets it's clean and employees and cooks are nice and respectful
Food is hit or miss. Good luck
Me and my Wife wanted to try this place once, It was Too Crowded, food was Just OK not GRREAT just OK, well we wont be going back. Been there Done That.
Ridiculously long line for just an "average" buffet. Price was ok, food was nothing to brag about. Would not come back.

I already get my haircut at the Cuttin Coral....  Exactly as I expected..... Food was mediocre but edible.... I guess $11 is fair for what you get.  Couldn't believe I was behind a wedding party....hoodtastic !!

This Place is a cross between Hometown &  soup plantation but with better food & much more choices & I like the food stations there very clean & hot and they serve you flame broiled steak just the way you like it, a salad bar twice the size of the others real ice cream a must try if you don't mind the space mountain type line to get in. How ever note to management the beverage counter at you entrance needs to go away if you can't keep it clean nobody is manning this station.

Don't expect the Bellagio buffet but for $7.49 for lunch not a bad deal. Decided to see what the hype was all about. I always see the long lines while driving on the 60 Frwy. I paid a visit on Tuesday afternoon, there was no line but busy inside. I was pleasantly surprised, for the amount paid I got a good deal. Golden Corral is not a Bellagio nor Rio Buffet but it doesn't cost $30 either..  I can't believe some of the reviews for the amount it costs I guess people were expecting the Caesars Palace buffet. The chocolate fountain w/strawberrys, cotton candy and real ice cream was a nice touch.  Give it a shot, it is better than Hometown. The server told me on Sat & Sun there is a 2 hour wait

Absolutely loved it!!! Great food, great price, great everything!! The steak was to die for. The mashed potatoes were perfect. The deserts were delectable:) the staff was great too, very friendly. I recommend going there, and I will be back soon!!

Went to the Corral for dinner. Two men(20 y.o.) were in the food area with there jeans down below their butt. One was walking around with his hand on his Johnson. Totally unacceptable for an eating establishment. I understand it is not against the law in Nevada but your establishment should watch for vulgar thing and ask them to conform or leave.

I am not happy at all with this place.....went to spend my money and celebrate my sons 10 th baday ...and in order to use bday coupon u hv to print...ok fine i understand....but then when i ask to hv them sing happy birthday to my son.....the waitress comes with a plate with happy birthday and a cupcake on it....and of course said here we made this we didnt hv time to sing! This was the worst experience ever there.....not including we did even get refills by the waitress  my sons went to the machines to refill for us! The only good thing was the cashier was friendly as well with the steak cook!

Won't eat here ever again... in life. I'm not a huge fan of buffet dining as it is, but this just plain grossed me out.   The buffet didn't have as many offerings as I previously remembered. Additionally, there wasn't anything too spectacular about the taste/quality of the food.  After I brought my plate to the table, I noticed we had an uninvited guest. There was a roach crawling on the wall heading for our table. I went to speak to the manager and informed him of the situation. He stated, "Was he dead or alive?" I said "alive and moving." He then said, "Well, he should be dead. The exterminator just left two days ago." Needless to say I was done. I got my $$ back and left.   Dine at your own risk.

The typical adventure watching the hordes bellying up to the trough. The experience would be fine except for the other customers who had no regard for hygiene portion control or courtesy.  Served the purpose, got more than a full meal at a reasonable cost.

You have to have low standards and be the type of person who likes a filled and unpleasant cafeteria food environment to like this one .The one in st george is actually really good but this one was just disappointing,  for the price just go to a casino buffett instead.
I really like the food, there's so much to choose from.  The food is well prepared and alot of it, all you can eat.  The service is good also.  Go and see for yourself.

Not at all impressed...our server was not very happy to be there...food was very sub-par and it was way to crowded. Not the good kind I crowded where you feel like "wow this is great it must be busy because the food is so great.." But the type of crowded where you feel a fight may break out. Also, if the chocolate fountain is their golden gem...why is it ok for people to dip the strawberry,lick off the chocolate and re dip it right then and there...absolutely disgusting! I Waited almost 10 minutes to dip...saw that and was immediately turned away...just saying...Never again!

needless to say I think they need a good manager for the past three visits the food was not that great I have been eating here for years about 7 or more I have always liked the food but this manager sucks. I have owned three restaurants that I sold and no they were doing great when I sold them I just got too old.  last time there the ribs were cold, nothing like cold lard to make you gag.  The chicken wings were nothing to write home about and most of them were not even put out. I was serving myself to some wings the manager grabs the tray from me so I had to wait on him for the ribs it was 10 past 4pm and he kept telling the cooks not put the ribs out until some of the lunch crowd left.  The other time he was entertaining some guys that seemed to be pushing drugs or something from the corner table but they kept going up to people and talking to the manager been there done that so I knew what they were doing.  Anywho the last few times just had the melon and soup this place has started to suck.

We went to this restaurant during lunch time Sunday but the price is $12 per person. If drink is ordered together, it will be $14~15. It is very expensive. And we do feel strongly that it doesn't worth the price.  The fried chicken is typical southern soul food and they are supposed to be the expert of doing it but it is so dry and inedible. I am not the type of person who would waste food. I have no choice but to put it away. It is really bad.   Nothing is special in this restaurant. The food is so so. We will never go back again. I just don't know why the line is so long. It doesn't worth the wait. May be it is because this is the first Golden Coral restaurant opened in Southern California. People would want to try something new.

Food was great. However, the place was sooooo filthy. It's a pretty big turn off considering their business deals with food  The place is obviously did not have enough employees to keep the place clean.  Seeing how untidy the place is, you'd have second thoughts about trying the food. We were just famished that's why we did.
Thank you so much for the free veterans dinner today. Selection was amazing, food was great, service was outstanding. You made me feel very special. Means more than I can describe.

It's nothing but hype, not worth the wait, especially in the burning sun. It's hardly a "buffet" as you have to stand in line to be served the steak, etc.  Even when they serve you, they make sure you get the smallest piece, I guess people don't want to get in line again as saying it 's chaotic is an understatement!!   It's noisy, crowded, just not a pleasant dining experience.  I'm a regular customer of Hometown, but just wanted to see the difference, this place sucks!  The food was bland, desserts blah and the worst part of it is you can't refill your own drink. The food at HTB is far superior especially since Terry Golding took over as GM.  He makes us feel so welcome, the atmosphere is so friendly, we feel at home.  In talking to my friends who are regulars like me, they all said that they too had tried GC and once was more than enough.  I've been told that they're going to remodel and it's going to be even better, can't wait!

I prefer this location to others in the valley.  Except for afternoon rush hour.  Dont go there between 3 and 6.  Unless youre a senior citizen, then its ok.  Youll fit right in.  I went for dinner and cant complain.  its your basic buffet, it seems like it has a larger selection than Ryans or JBs and the food quality is way better than both of those.  The brisket and beef tips were great, the only problem i had with the place was the wal mart environment (crying kids, way crowded, people acting like THAT steak was the last one ever made, etc) and i did make the mistake of going during grandma social hour, but aside from that, ill go back when Im craving 10 different things at once, which happens often :)  Dinner buffet for 2 runs a little under 30 bucks with drinks.

I've been wanting to eat here for over a month.  Everytime I would go, the line was out the door, so I'd pass. Finally got to eat there today.  When entering, it can be a little confusing because they have seats right near the door.  There was a group there, but they were waiting for more people and told me and my mother to go ahead of them.  I've never seen this before, but you get your drink while you are in line.......before you pay.  Thought that was odd.  We were looking for somewhere to sit.  The downfall for them is they were not clearing off the tables fast enough.  There were so many tables that needed to be cleared off.  After a while, I guess the evening shift checked in and they got to work on the tables.  So many selections for food.  The food that I picked was good, seasoned very well.  During dinner hours, I can understand how it would get so confusing & congested with the lines.  I also noticed they had an allergy alert sign for people who are allergic to nuts.  That was good because that applies to me.  I find I always have to ask when it comes to certain foods.  All in all, it was a good outing.  Just have to be aware of what time of the day to go.  Don't think I'll be trying it on the weekend.  But, it's worth checking out.
Horrible place. Very dirty, cold food, food was not cooked well. I love golden corral but this restaurant was the worst I've ever been in ever.

So I'm at Golden Corral right now , thee moment I walk in , my first impressions were that it looked ghetto . Thee ppl that were eating there , thee location it's in . It's absolutely disgusting . And to top it off , I watched a guy standing at thee food just eating straight from thee trays instead of putting it on a plate ! And there was some white shit inside of thee cocktail sauce ! Gross ! It's safe to say I will NEVER be coming back here again . Even thee most ghetto of buffets were better than this . I had expectations . This was horrible .
My grandkids and I love the way the staff changes the food trays and keeps foods fresh and I love the prime rib.  I love all there foods  5 stars and for the price

If you want to eat and just be full and not have too much expectations and pay only $12 for lunch, Golden Corral is the place for you. The price is great but the food was mediocre. The fried/butterfly shrimp was so small it was mostly battered shirmp. Mash potatoes were good, asian food there wasn't so great. The pot roast was dry.  Overall....just come here to be full but if you expect something better than Hometown Buffet....LEAVE!
Food not very good but people are nice. Some woman threw up on my wife's shoe while in line.

I find the food flavorless. Dirty eating utensils. My cup was dirty and the second cup was also dirty so I was grossed out and I just asked for a disposable children's cup. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

My wife and I have been wanting to go here but every time we drive by there is a long line going out the door and around the corner. We finally decided to come on a Wednesday and sure there was no line going out the door but we still had to wait about 30 mins to be seated. Finally, we were seated and started filling up our plates.  The food was definitely better than Home Town Buffet but not what I call GREAT. With all the hype, we had high expectations like many other people.  Overall the food was good and the dessert selection was good too. We would come here again.  I forgot to mention that they need to keep up with the food demand bc a few times we tried getting up to go get some of the stuff we haven't tried and every time we went the platters were empty, so we gave up and just had repeats.

So i finally gave in to the hype and decided to wait in line for this place on a Friday evening (probably one of the worst times to come). I ended up waiting an hour and by the time i got to the food i was starving. I tried a good amount of the food and to be honest this was extremely disappointing. The food here was very sub par and certainly does not justify the ridiculous wait time. Food was either bland, salty, or not cooked properly. I do give them credit for having great service, but unfortunately i came in for the food...not the waiters.

Four stars?!  Seriously - FOUR stars?!    I'm beginning to wonder about some of the people, who post reviews on Yelp.  I admit to often being a pretentious horse's ass, who thinks he's better than most people and says it out loud.  Golden Corral offers you lots of substandard food at reasonable --- not great:  reasonable --- prices and that's about all there is to say.  You won't find any of the chefs, who cook here to have passed audition for Hell's Kitchen or Master Chef  (though Chef Ramsey MIGHT have allowed them to clean his restaurants' bathrooms).  This is not to fault them or other people, who work at this location in Goodyear:  they're attentive, friendly, quick to serve and overall excellent employees.  But the food is just nasssssty.  Not "nasty":  nassssssty.  If you meet someone on a date you think you might want to get to know better and they say they like this place, it's time for you to hit Craigslist again.  Most of the food here is oversalted and of questionable quality.  Enough grease is produced in this place to qualify it as an automotive lube center during off hours.  And thank God Morton's Salt has found a place in the Valley to unload its excess salt packages ... unfortunately, the packages have been pre-opened and dumped in anything which might look like food.  I'm sorry, but when workers from Domino's and Waffle House laugh at a place, you know there's something seriously wrong; hit Black Bear Diner up the road instead

I hate buffets! But this is beyond a buffet!!!! They make food fresh, so its never just sitting around. Steak and seafood cooked in front of you. Staff constantly walking around so no kid has the option to even attempt touching items with their fingers.   Staff is friendly. Restaurant is clean. Great selection of food!

If I could write a review with NEGATIVE STARS I would. We went here to celebrate a couple of family birthdays here on July 10th , 2015 .This place is now Dirty and the food is DISGUSTING!!!! This Golden Corral used to be a clean and wonderful place to enjoy delicious, fresh food. But unfortunately it is dirty and the food is dry, processed  and salty. It is NOT WORTH the money at all!!!!! They let children run amuk and touch and lick the food and the ice cream machines. They do not insist that children be accompanied up to the buffet with an adult. Not that the adults there act any better. It is a shame. We used to celebrate our happy occasions here But we are never going there again!!!!! Save your money and your appetite. The Golden Corral on Brookpark Rd. should be closed!

What a disappointment...there was NO MELTED cheese for the tacos...you gotta have the cheese... there wasn't many choices for food..but the dessert was the bomb.com...it wasn't worth my money at all!! I wouldn't come back.

After reading several not so nice reviews, I kept putting off eating here. Until one day when I decided what the heck, let's try it. And boy am I glad I did! This place is actually really good! People who judge it too harshly probably shouldn't be eating buffet style then. I love eating at buffets with my little kids because they can graze and try new things without it breaking the bank. The food was fresh, REAL, and the place was fairly clean for how many people go through there. And the coolest part?! The DESSERT bar! They have a chocolate fountain, cotton candy (yes like fair style!) pies, etc. I was very happy with the service and the prices. All in all, great place for the price and food being served!
Good food for a good price. The high chairs aren't the greatest. Happy to finally have a Golden Corral in vegas :)

The food here is never hot unless you get it fresh off the grill which will be overcooked or raw.  Everytime I eat here whether it is breakfast, lunch, or dinner I am stuck in the bathroom for hours.  I will never eat here again.  I wish the State board of Health would check into this place

First time here with the family for a birthday, wasn't expecting too much considering its a buffet. Service could've been better, our server only served us one at a time for drinks (I was left alone completely) but it was busy so a tad bit understandable. Food was sub par but again it's a buffet so what can you do. Would only recommened if you're not picky about not receiving quality service or food.

Like many of you, I was initially turned off to trying this place out because of the ridiculous line that stretches out to the parking lot. FYI that line continues once you reach the inside of the establishment for another 15 minutes at peak hours.  So what's this place have? All sorts of meat. They also have a salad section, but the workers there look pretty lonely because who craves salad at a meat buffet? The dessert section is also pretty nice. I appreciated the scoop of mint and chip ice cream, and many people partake in the cotton candy post meal.   Getting down to the nitty gritty: I'm a rib guy, but the ribs were just average here. When an entree is great, you are already planning on getting your next portion while eating your current portion. No such feelings here.   The steak and the shrimp are in my opinion the best entrees at GC. One thing about the steak though:    I don't know if the steak chef is color blind, or if he simply does not give a flying caboodle. On three different occasions I asked for well done or medium well, and all three times I got the bloodiest piece of meat on my plate. I could swear my plate was mooing back at me.  Also, if you aren't familiar with buffet culture...the clientele can be a little eccentric. If you generally don't see strange people in public, that's because they are all here at GC.   Yes the quality was better than Hometown. No the quality was not better than a Vegas buffet/Morongo buffet. For the price of entry, I'd say you come out a little bit ahead if you plan your meal right. I'm not a buffet fan, so I'd come here 1-2 times a year maximum.

How do I begin...  Amazingly overcrowded, loud, sketchy clientele, rude and flustered employees.....     Food is bottom of the barrel and when the place is crowded, darn near impossible to get anything  except the very bottom of the pan, which is almost inedible.      The only thing positive was I got a cooked to order steak- rare- that wasn't half-bad.   I wish I could score it higher, but, no.   I was an overall nightmarish experience.

I've heard a lot about this place and decided to take a visit with my boyfriend. The price is good but the food... I honestly think Hometown Buffet across the street is better.   I don't think I would wait in line that long to eat here again. Maybe if the lines were shorter and I had no idea where to go eat, I'll come back.  Nothing really special about this place, except for the cotton candy.

I'll be the first to admit I was not expecting much from this place. I was wrong, I am surprised how really good it was. The steak was very very good, it was tender well seasoned and perfectly cooked and when I say perfect I mean it. I asked for 'medium rare' and the cook looked over the 10 or so steaks he had cooking and snapped one up and said "here ya go, medium rare'  and sure enough it was.  The creamed spinach and sauted mushrooms went well with the steak and were delicious as were the mashed potatoes and dark gravy. Our server was right on top of things clearing off plates and refilling the drinks. The one thing that I didn't like was making my way through the crowds and around the kids without spilling my plate. But I what could I say it is a buffet after all.  I saw other reviews that talked about cold food and rude people, I'm happy to say that was not my experience and I'd happily go back any time.

If you want to feel like you are in a prison cafeteria, then come here. If you want to get diabetes or a heart attack, then come here. It is the most depressing environment and the quality of the food is terrible.

We went there for Thanksgiving and you had three choices of how you wanted your food over cooked under cooked or not cooked right. $12.99 for all you can eat  isn't bad at all. If you just want to eat their dessert even that had no taste at all. Save some money go to McDonalds instead that place is pure crap. Way over packed and too many kids put their fingers and all the desserts very poor management
Let's say all the hype of the line is not worth the food and the small atmosphere as well as the cramped seating area it is not worth the time at all. Save the money and go somewhere else

Very good food and nice staff. Good selection of salads and main dishes, side dishes and desserts. One of the few places around here with a good salad bar. Reasonably priced. HOWEVER...happened to look up today and noticed the ceiling fans, overhead pipes and beams are so gross dusty I'm afraid crud will fall in my food. This place really needs to hire some heavy duty cleaning crew to rectify this current issue and then keep up with it! I'll go back when that happens.

My favorite buffet in Arizona! my family and i go here on thanksgiving when we don't feel like cooking and i recently went here for my birthday! they have a full buffet with steak, pot roast and chicken. their desert bar is awesome. I only wish they did birthday discounts

I came here for the first time with my Girlfriend last night for the sake of trying the place out since I'm generally a buffet whore, and I see the Golden Corral commercials on television all the time so I just had to partake, and see what the big fuss was all about.  Right when I came in, I was pumped, everything looked brightly lit, enticing and delicious.  There were so many stations ranging from breads, to ethnic foods and even a grill station with fresh steaks.  Reason is I was so stoked and amazed when doing a quick survey of what was available was probably because I was comparing it to Hometown Buffet, of which I am a regular patron, and the selection here was certain more extensive.  All I can say is that even though there was a lot of variety, no one thing really blew me away.  Things that stood out was the carved Turkey, Calm chowder, fried Catfish, Bourbon chicken and the steak, which was a hit and miss cause it was usually over cooked and tough.  Other than that, everything was pretty average, but what do you expect for $11.99 a person?  If there was one near me, and I was in a I don't care what I eat mood, I may go pay them my patronage from time to time, but unfortunately there isn't one around me so Hometown Buffet and the regular run of the mill Asia/Chinese will suffice for the time being.

My 6yr old loved it , we went for an early dinner Sunday night. The food was fresh lots of selections. It was nice to see the food being cooked and replenished as needed.  My 6 yr when we first sat down said he was going to eat all his dinner just so he could have cotton candy he was disappointed when he was told the machine was broken. I had a taco salad and was suprised at how tasty the meat was unlike other buffets I have been to. Good place when you want to please the child in your life on occasion.

Seriously?!?!?  This place is revolting.    They have lots of items.  I say items because very few of them look like anything that resembles legitimate food.    Having gone here with some family friends one night, my boyfriend and I paid at the front. (umm.. $25 for a buffet-could go to an actual restaurant and pay a couple bucks more and get real food with a real server... but i digress) We paid and were told to wait in line to be seated (what is this Disneyland.. why am I waiting in line at a buffet?) We were sat in the "dining area" it was awkwardly close to the food area, so it was a little sketchy for me to put my purse anywhere besides between my feet.  The food, like I said earlier, there are a lot of item options.  90% of which are overcooked, under seasoned, or just plain unidentifiable.  Overall, we left feeling ripped off and still hungry.  What a waste of calories.  Now mind you, I must note that I am not against the buffet.  I have been to some over the years that have mastered the concept well.  Golden Corral, despite their creative yet obnoxious television ads-has not!

I really wish I could give this place less than one star. It is terrible. The breakfast buffet was sub par to say the least. There really wasn't one thing I tried that tasted like actual food. Not once did anyone refill my drink or take the plates off our table. I recommend anywhere but here.

Please disregard my review if you're perfectly OK with all-you-can-eat crappy food, because I know that some people are.   The service is fine, our drinks were always full, and the cashier was friendly.   I had heard so much hype about them opening in Vegas that I was honestly looking forward to trying this location out. There selection was not as big as I expected, and what really bothered us was the fact that 1/3rd of the food had NO label.   The best food I had was the steak. You see them grilling It right there and they ask how you want it done. All of the other food was pretty bland. Except the cotton candy, it's hard to have nasty cotton candy ;)

Positive, the waitress was very polite and always asked if we needed anything. If I was reviewing her the place would get 5 stars.   Negative, me, my wife and 2 kids came for dinner on a Friday at 5:30.  The place was under staffed, half the food items were missing and a staff person was working on the chocolate fountain with bare hands touching the chocolate.  It should of been taken apart and sanitized.  My 8 year old wanted an ice cream cone but it was empty at 5:45pm on Friday.  This place is starting to resemble a lot of the ponderosa restaurants before they went out of business. If the golden Coral in Macedonia Ohio doesn't change it will be out of business soon. I'm not going back.

Husband and I had Sunday dinner here on 5/6/18..The food wasn't as good as it was when they first opened & be prepared to get rolled eyes and an attitude when you ask for a well done steak from the female chef... Very unprofessional and rude

I don't understand why so many people go to this place... about 18.50 for 2 Saturday breakfast..without drinks    the food is worse than the nearest hometown buffet (half mile away)  i mean food is not THAT bad...is edible but...18.50 for 2 ...breakfast ?  this thing feel like one of those 4.99 buffets in las vegas    I don't understand......every buffet I went to is better than this s..t

Well I know why the parking lot was pretty empty. The price of a dinner now is $14.99 per person. This is ridiculous. It wasn't even worth that price. The only thing that made it worthwhile was the nice man who was our waiter. I can think of a lot of other places to eat at.

The only reason I am giving them a star is because some of the food tasted good. The honey sesame chicken was hard to eat, the carrot cake wasn't that good, & not to mention, the atmosphere was horrible. They closed at 9:30, and we got there at about 8:30. An hour until they close, and they were already trying to close. My boyfriend and I had constant eyes on us, as if they were just waiting for us to leave. Every few minutes a guy in a blue shirt would "nonchalantly" walk past the dining room we were in, and every time I would make eye contact with him. He looked like a manager. There was a younger girl server there too that was yelling across the dining room about some drama going on. At almost $15 a person, I would expect a more comfortable, relaxing atmosphere.

Okay so first time here now the food is great well not all of it the hand dipped ice cream is more hand dipped milkshake the chicken is not fully cooked the customer service is horrible the guy who rings people up has an attitude to everyone who walks in the buffet he lacks hospitality, the waitresses dont smile or acknowldege you when you arrive to your table since you sit yourselfves no1 said hi to me at all not even welcome to golden corral so for the first vegas and neveda location its 1 star they make money $$$$$ but they dont make that happy memorable service.

This is my boyfriend's family favorite breakfast place. I know it's a buffet but that means...CHOICES!  We are here almost every Sunday for breakfast (sometimes early dinner) with the family. Ron, who is our main go to server that we always to get, does excellent service.  They have so many choices, especially the evening, with steak, ham, pasta, chicken, salad bar, taco bar, etc.  We came here on Thanksgiving and it was PACKED. We waited a long time but it was worth it. We had 16 people and surprisingly, we were seated within 5 mins (well thanks to a big group of 16 leaving :P). They had your whole Thanksgiving dinner right there and you didn't have to make it at home.  Anyway, we will be back, probably next Sunday. Check this place out.

What in the world?  I felt like I was waiting for a ride at Disneyland with the long and ridiculous line.  Leonard W and I always see commercials for Golden Corral and even thought about stopping by Victorville next time we head to Vegas, but what do you know, a Golden Corral opens in 626!  We got there around 11:20am and we were greeted with this loooong line out the door.  Turns out this place also serves breakfast so there's a crowd since morning.  The outside portion took a good 20 minutes before we got into the door, thinking that we are getting closer to food, but reality slaps us in the face and the line actually curls a few times like at Disneyland before you head towards the register to pay!  Finally, after a total of 40-50minutes of waiting, we were seated and we began to explore the buffet.  There's a salad station, Mexican, Chinese, Southern, grill station, small seafood section, and a big dessert section.  The standouts for us was definitely the Mandarin Chicken and the fried chicken!  We loved the Mandarin Chicken because it isn't drenched in sauce and they actually stir fry it with Chinese fermented black soybeans!  It adds a different flavor to your normal orange chicken and we ate a ton of those.    Now, the fried chicken was ridiculously juicy.  Good seasoning on the outside and we thought that only the dark meat was gonna be juicy, but even the breast meat was awesome.  After those two items though, we didn't care too much about the others.  They had pork chops for lunch instead of sirloin steaks.  They also had sliders but a little inconsistent.  Our first sliders were great, but sliders after were all overcooked.  Pizzas, pot roast, chicken fajita, cajun fish, and fried catfish were a few items that I tried and they were all alright.  The weirdest thing on the menu was fried chicken gizzards.  That was... interesting.  Didn't try much of the dessert, but the cookies were extremely buttery (yum) and they got some legit legit mint chocolate chip ice cream!  Of course, there was the famous chocolate fountain but kids were hogging up that area so I didn't bother with it.  Service was a standout.  Our server had this Southern hospitality-quality to him and just from watching him interact with other tables, I can tell this guy is gonna get a lot of tips!  For $8.29, it's not bad at all for buffet.  It doesn't include a drink, so if you add a drink, it costs about the same or a little more than Hometown, and I gotta say, Golden Corral is waaaay better than Hometown.
The lady at the front was so sweet. Honestly the only one who had a smile on their face. Food was unappetizing and almost everything was undercooked. How can you even undercook bacon?

Been to other Golden Corrals...this one...eehh not so good.  Bathrooms were a wreck, I noticed they were in the middle of remodeling but that doesn't mean they shouldn't be clean.  Tables were left covered with dishes after people left and not wiped down.  Garbage all over the floors while the waitstaff sat at a table. I seen a cook come out of the bathroom with an apron on,  a bit unsanitary.  Does anyone take pride in their work anymore?

There was a variety of food surely to please the vast majority.   They restocked the food almost constantly and therefore all was fairly fresh.  All the food our party had was good and hot.    You definitely need to come there hungry or with a empty stomach to get your money's worth.
Great service! Great food! Lots of selection at the buffet. Bbq chicken is excellent. First night opened. (for businesses in area.)

The service was great! I was getting refills and plates were being cleared with such a great frequency. The food was okay and nothing to really "weite home" about. Where the poor ratings come from are the bathrooms. The bathroom was disgusting. Besides the trash on the floor, there were human feces in the corners around the toilet. I'm also attaching a picture.

First time here in a year. Wanted to give it another chance...mistake. no management present. Rude staff...food was terrible...thanks for the raw chicken. It's a shame golden corral in other cities is great. Need to rethink your franchisee in vegas
Short, and to the point.....the service is good.  Friendly, and courteous staff.  But.....the food is not good at all.    I felt like i was in a prison buffet of some sort.

Let's start with the cons. 1) the chicken was undercooked  2) Mac and cheese had no flavor or color  3) mash potatoes didn't taste right 4) men's bathroom was nasty with tp on the floor and other things  5) pricing for 2 people $30  Now with that said the pros great waitress working tonight was super nice and that's pretty much it as for if I would come back I don't think I will sadly

We went to this location because it was closer to our hotel. We went to the one in Surprise, AZ yesterday and that one was great. This one however is the exact opposite of what the one in Surprise was. It started right away. We ordered drinks and a chocolate milk for my 2yr old and were told you'll get it at your table. Then we were told they didn't sell chocolate milk. Then they argued about it and we're rude to my wife about it. The majority of the food appeared to be inedible. Now I'll say they got one star cuz the steak was good and so was pot roast and the banana pudding was excellent. Our waitress was very kind and courteous and kept our drinks filled and table cleared even though being very pregnant. Now let me tell you about the filth!!! They're lucky and so are you I can't post pictures because they are appalling. From the food stations, the wall surrounding our table and OMFG they restroom. Please do yourself a favor and do not eat here.

Whoa... A couple years ago this place was amazing. Now they've really gone downhill. I've decided to come back and they aren't the Golden Corral I went to a couple years ago. This one was really getting cheap now. Back then their food was just beautiful and amazing but now it tastes all bland and plain.

Had a senior lunch on 3/18/18. $15.30 for one person. I ate about $6.00 worth. Something odd at the salad bar. Perhaps tomatoes or the mushrooms(had a dirt flavor) Here I am 15 hours later with the bathroom effects. (as not to be too graphic) I am so disappointed.

Gross.  This place is dirty.  Every surface and utensil feels crusted and sticky.  I left feeling disgusted that I actually ate the food and fed it to my children.  While there is a wide variety of dishes, none actually looked appetizing and most tasted worse than they looked.  Salad bar items were frozen blocks.  Pumpkin pie was oddly translucent.
Great place for breakfast lunch or dinner.   I won't be getting tired of this place for a long time.  Good food.

I took my mom to this place last week.  We decided to go on a Tuesday for lunch being that we went there on Sunday, and the wait was going to be at least 1 hour.    The food = 3.5 stars - lots of variety, but overall, only the mashed potatoes and gravy were tasty.  I also had the popcorn shrimp, which was okay.  The steamed fish was just salty, but pretty bland.  Service = 1 star.  We had Stephanie as our lousy waitress.  I watched her refill drinks and offer water to other tables, but not to us.  I asked her for 2 glasses of water and she took forever to get them to us.    I won't be back for a long time.

The place is literally a combat zone in the evenings.  So packed with people it's impossible to keep clean.  A steamy, dishroom atmosphere pervades the place.  Most of the help are of questionable US citizenship.  The food reminds me of a USMC chow hall on a bad day.  I'll give this place 2 stars for one reason:  They give vets a free meal on Veterans Day.

Dirty, food was cold, way too many people and no one is regulating to make sure food isn't handled incorrectly. Kids were going up to the ice cream machine and then dipping their ice cream cones into the chocolate syrup dispenser spout after licking their cone. Three waitresses and kitchen workers witnessed this and nothing was done. Won't be coming back! Disgusting!

I came here for the first time ever on Mother's Day. They were packed ,the line was out the door and down the path. Still they managed to get everyone seated and quickly attended to. We were a party of 10  our server was so great and i am sorry to say i do not remember her name. She had all 10 drinks refilled continuously. Brought us lemons and cleared the table with amazing speed, as well as taking care of a completely full restaurant packed with Children that were running under foot.   The only down part was that they had plastic dishes but, with all those people what are your choices. I loved the food. I had shrimp and fish and vegetables.  Nothing fried.       The best part for me was the Chocolate fondu!!  Although there were many different choices. You could never say that you did not like what they were serving.  have seen a million adverts for this place and i am happy that i finally got to go.

Horrible cold food!   Kitchen staff was standing around, not putting any food out.  Everything was cold, rolls were hard, nothing was refilled.  The food that was available was very old.  The best part was our waitress!  She was great!  Update - Didn't make it 5 miles down the road. We had to make an emergency stop to use the bathroom.  Everyone was throwing up and diarrhea.

Well the price was good but I was expecting more... Not to many options and I didn't like the food it had no taste to it. The waiter took for ever to serve us refills and I really thought the place was amazing but in reality it let me down.. :(
Food wasn't that great, the cooks were on their phones. Probably had 6 different plates because I only took 2 bites (If that) out of everything, definitely will not be going back to that location..
Golden corral breakfast is great. Make sure you sit in Milli's section as she is the best server they got.

We just ate here last week and we came back again for dinner. They still have that "meatlovers madness" going on. The sirloin steak was just right, bummer wasnt able to take a pic. i like their boneless beef ribs too and the chicken barbeque was so good!  Our server Samantha was very accommodating and smiling all the time. It seems that she loves what she does unlike the last server we had. Samantha's side is by the salad bar part. This is the second time we had her as our server.

I would honestly give this place a zero rating if I could. Went there for the first and only time. Was total chaos on a Sunday afternoon at 1pm, which normally we would be fine, but the staff wasn't accommodating at all. Fruit flies all around the food on all buffet stations, server was more occupied with talking to friends/maybe good tipping customers than to rest of section, no pre bussing of dishes (and our table was small for the size of our table to begin with) and forget about refills. 3 day old cold ramen noodles would be a better meal choice. Everyone in my party agreed that was the worst

They have a white chocolate, chocolate and caramel fountain! !! Great for desert fanatics like me  :] Overall  this is an buffet with lots of fresh food and awesome dessert choices for kids of any age. Ever since this location opened, I have not step back to hometown buffet. For the price and quality HT does not compare. Only draw back, the quality has been slipping from they first opened but still very tasty. The average wait time is bearable now and so far service has been excellent there.

We go here way too often, the foods great (except the Chinese food they offer... Yuck!). The chicken is moist, the favors are good!  I will say they are not too good at grilling steaks. They will put a stick stating its med well when in fact it's super rare! Sometimes you do get lucky with the steaks, but not often enough.

Well I'm happy to say that our 'free' dinner was pretty darn good. I don't know her name but the lady manager with the long blondish hair remembered us and she was so nice. Happy to report a positive review. Thank you, I really appreciate the follow-up and we will definitely be back! :)

This location sucks!!!! I would normally give Golden Corral a 3 or 4 star. We just moved here and have been to golden corral many times In Colorado. But we were very disappointed the night we were here, We went an hour before closing on a Friday night, food was not fresh, no steak ready. They dont have near the food selection that were used to.I asked the manager for a refund for my food, I had lost my appetite and Im not that picky. Server was good, but I probably wont return.

Holy shit. This is my first time at Golden Corral and I was already a little sceptical because of their reviews, but I wanted to try it myself. Well, all I can say is they're lucky the servers were so kind because if they weren't they'd have one star. I got a slice of pizza just because it's tradition for me to get it at buffets and wow! It was completely uncooked? The dough was slimy and was not cooked at all! I was disgusted! Okay, fine. Bad pizza. Not surprising with buffets. So, I go to get some shrimp and bite down on something that feels like a rock. The lettuce was pretty gross and old, so that wasn't very good either. The soups tasted old and everything else wasn't any better. Finally, I got dessert and blegh. Again, everything was stale and old. Very sad. I won't be coming back, but props to the great service! Everyone was so nice and helpful. None of this is their fault, so I didn't blame them or got upset at them.

I still think everything is still good I just don't understand why the price has to be higher on mother's day & they had the same food as all the rest of the times I went there I think that part was a rip but still love the food

You will not go home hungry. This restaurant has the best buffet in town. This also is a place that makes you feel like family. Must try the mini cheeseburgers at lunch. If it is out at the bar they will bring it to you when it comes out. I can't say enough about this place. They have so much to choose from it is unbelievable from meats to the salad bar, pizza, soups / chili , veggies and don't forget the deserts. If you don't like lunch or dinner go to the breakfast buffet they have everything, Fresh omelets and fried eggs, meats ,waffles and casseroles. Free juice and milk at the salad bar WOW. Thanks to everyone at the concord golden corral .J & P. THE FOOD DUDE

You know,  I don't know why more people don't frequent this place.  Seriously...I converse with coworkers and it's as if I am admitting to eating at a cookout in a trailer park or something.  Is this what we have become?  Put aside the negative perception of all-you-can-eat places just this once.  You don't have to tell your coworkers.  Let them continue to frequent $40 a plate eating establishments while you join us peasants for some real eatin'.   It's not fine dining, for sure, but I am always amazed at the quality of the food. The staff is definitely on the ball as far as keeping it fresh and available.  Bottom line: It's tasty!    Still, I would be remiss if I didn't let you know that, yeah, it attracts a salt-of-the-earth crowd.  If you can get over this hang-up, I promise you will leave with your belly full.  Be sure to try the Jack Daniel's Bourbon Chicken.

Clearly this restaurant has lack of communication between their employees. I called in the morning to make sure the 2 for $20 was going on and they said yes it was. Then we got here and it wasn't. Yes I know it is only a $5 difference, but the point is I called and checked and they didn't know. Then they split our party of 6 up because they didn't have a table and they saw no problem with it. Won't come here again because of bad customer service

So, I haven't been here since I was a kid. My daughter wanted to go here for her birthday. Reluctant we said yes, It was her birthday.   Positives - The soda was good  Negative - Food was horrible! Not enough room for anyone to eat. Packed in like dogs. Service was horrible. Ice cream was frozen water.   Will never go back unless I have to. Forced too!

This buffet is awesome if you are craving to stuff your face and do not want to go to hometown or those other buffet places. This buffet has everything that you want. It has a grilling station for steaks, which is not bad by buffet standards (you still need to put A1 sauce on it), a station for Chinese food, salads, breads and biscuits, a huge selection of desserts which also includes a ice cream scoop station, cotton candy station, and a chocolate fountain where you can dip almost anything in melted chocolate. The prices here are pretty good. I think for the same amount for hometown you can go here instead or it might be a buck more or so, but its worth it if you are super hungry. Service was also awesome and very nice. If you are coming, come early and expect to wait in line for a while because this place just opened.

These 5 stars are for Niky the best most attentive waitress!  I have had her twice and normally wouldn't notice if I had the same server twice.....mostly because I'm tending to my busy busy kids!  Niky, even though she has a new hairstyle since last time,  stood right out the second I got to my table.  Man, she is sooooo nice and sincere.  I just wanted to give a shout out to her!  She wont know me, I don't go often but I'd like to know she made our experience great!  Thanks for helping me with the cotton candy today hahahaha.
Not a bad place to get the family together and just have good food and laughs. The dessert area seems to always be a mess but besides that I enjoy going.

Two words: Absolutely Not.  This place is complete junk. The meat is pure rubber. I would give this place zero stars if I could. Golden Corral prides itself on being fresh, but we all know that's not true. Remember the 2013 scandal?   Please don't come here.

First up i hate when ppl say some place or ppl are ghetto, its like what does that mean. O MY GOD if you want to know what ghetto is this place is it. It was about 1:00 so we figured kids in school so shouldnt h to crowded. The worst dining experience we've had. From the time we walked thru the door, we hadnt even poured our sodas. First thing we hear is  Jada a waitress or something cursing up a storm talking about someone, man talk about your first impressions, we should have turned around and left but  we didnt. There was only one person in front of us place was about half full. Got our drinks paid $8.99 for lunch and $1.99 for drinks, we've been to other Golden Corrals so we're no amateurs. Proceded to find a table almost every available table was filthy, found one in the back. So many families and really small children. Now u cant fault a restaurant by the way patrons act, rude adults piling up plates like the food police r going to come & cut them off, u can go back for seconds its a buffet people,and bad ass kids tearing shit up running around, but i can fault u on cleanliness. Food everywhere on the floors. Everystation was dirty containers half full or empty nothing was fresh, sliders were premade and cold. All i came for was a salad, seriously i had been craving a huge salad, even the cold food for salads looked horrible. Nothing we had tasted like they bothered to season it we salt & peppered everything it really didnt help. This location does not represent all Golden Corrals trust me

I love this place! the food is always good, such a big variety, and prices are reasonable. I love the fact that you dont have to walk thru a big casino to go to a buffet. My favorite is the bbq and fried chicken here. The only bad thing it can get very busy at times.

been waiting to try this place since they always have long line for the past 2 months.Got my chance to try it after my costco trip.the line move quicky ,but i think the food in my gut moved faster.This place is a hit and miss on the food, corn bread was bad,but the chicken was good, steaks where ok,but the pudding was better.My taste buds where like..WTF ? GIVE ME SOMETHING TO WORK WITH HERE !.Im giving this place a 2 star just because they had something they called food and a place to sit.I suggest going to woodgrill in norwalk or sizzler

This place one of the worst Golden Corrals I've ever been to. The food is decent but the management is horrible and unhelpful. They treat their staff and guests horrible. Mediocre attitude and unprofessional customer service by management!

not a fan. the overall experience was not something im happy about. the price for coming here was definitely not worth it. the food, not to good and the plates were dirty. the only real enjoyable thing for me was the chocolate fountain. other then that nothing. also the employees were nice but I still dont find myself coming here again.

I've read other reviews for this location and I think I may just have a skewed view of things. This place is always clean, the food is hot and has a good flavor. To some it may be over spiced but for me, it's good eat in'!  The drinks are not included, but I feel the price is fair considering its an all you care to eat buffet and they serve steak and other items which you don't usually find in the usual buffet.   The variety is good. Soup and salad bar; entrees like baked chicken or fish and hot sides; grill with steaks and ribs; Chinese and Mexican dishes; dessert and breads.  Love their cheesy broccoli soup and the salad bar is well stocked.

Ok so this is probably the nastiest, worst restaurant I've ever been to in my life. The staff was not friendly or helpful. The food was definitely frozen and either really over salted or under salted. I would never come back ever in my entire life.

Alright guys you guys are being to harsh in GC sure the food and stuff might not be the best in the world. But think about it what do you expect from a 10 dollar buffet? So overall I was satisfied not as bad as people say because it is indeed a cheap buffet but yeh not the best thus the 4 star.

Stopped by for Friday lunch. Cheap buffet. We saw the lines there but the wait time wasn't that bad. Had some corns, veggies, chicken wings, fruits. It was like party food.  Ice cream was good though.  Overall not bad for the price.
avoid waiting in line by being the early bird! Line is ridiculously long, but worth the wait.

After taking the 40 minute drive from Southern Highlands passing all of the wonderful buffets we have here in Las Vegas we decided to give the one low cost option a shot. Pricing online is incorrect manager didn't want to hear anything about that told me it was corporate called we already driven so far we decided to give it a try. The best thing they've got going or is there a custom grilled steaks made to order that part is pretty bomb other than that vegetables are watery and unflavored.. side dishes I wanted a baked potato but there was no butter or chives in sight even though I asked they just shrug their shoulders like they didn't know what I was talking about. Dessert options were kind of boring the only highlight was that we got cotton candy at the end have to say I think the cotton candy was the best thing about this place.
I had high expectations but this restraunt is in drastic need to be remodeled.  Our server was good but the meats were dry and the options were limited.  The restraunt as a whole looked dirty.

First time there.  Not bad for a buffet.  Lots of choices.  Fresh vegetables, the shrimp was wonderful!  The desserts left much to be desired, though the peanut butter cookies were good.  We will be back again sometime.

It's my little ones graduation today we decided to go to Golden Corral which is her favorite we get in there and start eating in about 20 minutes later we see a roach on the table I told the server AND SHE killed it then a couple minutes later we see another one I CALLED the waiter and she stated oh we've been spraying so they wOnt come back anyhow the kids were discussed  and I was too so we were ready to go as I was walking towards the door I seen the store manager who is Jeff I said to him this is disgusting AND may I please have a refund he snatched my receipt and said I was here for over 45 minutes and now I can't have a refund I said TO JEFF who is your supervisor or manager are you corporate or are you franchise he  really got offended and started talking crazy, I told him that he has horrible management skills then he stated he was going to call the police and have me arrested so I called the police and waited and when the officers arrived I ask the officer please ask the manager if  I CAN have a refund the officer asked him he said the same thing because I was over 30 minutes the officer laughed at him and said the roaches waited 30 minutes to come out I believe  he still refused and actED belligerent this is the worst experience I've ever seen at Golden Corral please don't ever take your kids there .

OMG this place is horrible. I wouldn't not wait in line to come eat here. I had maybe one thing that tasted good. A roll :/ everything else was kind of bland. People don't like to take care of there kids here. Only thing ok bout this place is the chocolate fountain and the red velvet cupcake. Will not be coming back

Okay I know I never write reviews about chain restaurants but for Golden Corral, I'll make an exception.  I am writing this review for 3 reasons:  1.  Southern California does have any Golden Corrals, so this is an entirely new experience. 2.  Every time I drove by, there is a line out the door - so it must be good right? 3.  I love buffets.  First off, the wait on a Wednesday night was 45 minutes at 8pm. Talk about a wait.  People are all pushy and stuff in line too. I think people we're all headed the same place, why be rude?    It's around $12 per person, which is a good price.  So we finally get in and the place is filled to capacity.  I scanned all the offerings and I gotta say there wasn't much.  They had an extensive dessert area but I was more interested in what I was having for dinner.  Off the top of my head, here is what I saw:  1.  Popcorn shrimp 2.  Fried Fish 3.  Steak fries 4.  Pizza 5.  Meatloaf  6.  Pasta 7.  Ribs 8.  Ham 9.  Salad bar  It was okay quality. The popular stuff was often left empty.  I tried some of the things I listed and it was okay tasting after having to fight with rude folks cutting in line or just hogging everything.  I guess what people really like here is that they offer steak and its supposedly cooked to your desired temperature [which it wasn't].  The portions given were about 1 inch by 3 inch rectangular piece.  I know it's hard to satisfy the masses but having to get up multiple times to piece together a steak got annoying.  The staff was actually really nice. I really don't know how they deal with the crazy, rude and greedy clientele. I think I'd have a headache each and every day I worked there.  All in all, it wasn't worth the wait. It's similar to Hometown buffet.  I'd rather just go to some cheap Chinese buffet locally.

It's Golden Corral. The food is neither great nor bad. It's Golden Corral. The server was around as was appropriate. Refilling our drinks. It's Golden Corral. We all know what to expect. I fully believe that all Golden Corrals are Meccas for carnies. Or at least, aspiring carnies. It's Golden Corral, get it? It's a little pricey for buffet fare, but you get so many options. The food is as plentiful as the clientele is porcine.   Seriously though, get the mac and cheese.  And the mashed potatoes.   On the same plate.  Do it.

Have dined here for a weekday lunch and a weekend dinner and for the price, I have little complaints about Golden Corral!   I've been spoiled with Asian-themed buffets here in Vegas so it was a nice change to dine eating various types of food. I love the variation from BBQ pulled pork to mashed potatoes to cheeseburgers sliders and so on.   But my favorite thing to eat.. what I have multiple plates of would be... Their yeast rolls. Yessir, YEAST ROLLS. The softest, fluffiest pillows of bread heaven.. paired with their whipped honey butter. I would pay $8 just to get unlimited amounts of that bread.   Everything else though is A-OK. Nothing special but like I said, a good change from what I am used to. For the price, you can't go wrong. Especially if you end your meal with a big cloud of cotton candy.   What can I say? I'm easily amused. :)

The food is terrible.  I went here for breakfast and they couldn't even get that right.  I mean how do you screw up bacon and eggs?  I dislike this place so much that when my in laws came down they insisted we go there, I faked being sick so I wouldn't have to go.

The food is terrible.  I went here for breakfast and they couldn't even get that right.  I mean how do you screw up bacon and eggs?  I dislike this place so much that when my in laws came down they insisted we go there, I faked being sick so I wouldn't have to go.

This location is a joke. I paid $30 and there was literally nothing in half the pans. The waitress ignored me and my girlfriend with getting us drinks. Perhaps because we are tattooed and pierced she passed bias on us (which is discrimination btw.) and felt she didn't need to serve us. I was willing to let it all go because I kept telling myself I'll just pig out on dessert, sadly no. The dessert bar was the biggest disappointment ever. I got vanilla ice cream thinking I'm gonna load it with sprinkles and oreo bit but all they had was three containers of gummy bears and nuts, nothing else. The floors were filthy, the wait staff unpleasant, and the food lousy. I'm so glad I just wasted 30 dollars to go eat in a third world country.

This is the best buffet outside of Vegas. I can see why the obesity rate is increasing every year with all you can eat food like this! They have a pretty good variety of food, all decent quality. People can be a bit pushy at times, but isn't that the charm of a buffet? I wear my hockey gear on steak night because NOBODY comes between me and my prime rib!

Ok so here we go. Being from TX Golden Corral is not a popular choice for me because of all the other great buffets such as Furrs and Ryans. Golden Corral is a big chain and all over the place but with that being said I tried it because there are no Furrs or Ryans in CA and I heard this place just opened. Everything here is typical of what they do in TX  except 1. the long lines (unheard of), 2. They don't bring rolls to your table, 3. The service is not good at all. I hardley ever tip and service must be awful for me not to (my tip for the waiter--smile and act like you want me to be happy) The food selection is as I expected not much of  choice compared to a Furrs. This is cool if you have some time to spend and chat with friends and family but I caution you on the long lines.   Tip: If you plan on going for dinner, take some chairs, blanket, books and pack a lunch! The lines are horrible and I have never seen such long lines at a Golden Corral ever!
