This was my FOOD EXPERIANCE @ GC...  PEOPLE , JUST KEEP DRIVING !!!! I never liked Hometown Buffet and i cant stand Golden Corral. Sizzler is ok..  Ok so heres the boring stuff if you care to continue reading my review.  The waitress came to our table and  ask "hows everything " and i spoke up and told her that this was NOT what we had expected she could seen that look in my face and said, i cant do anything about it but i will get the manager... The manager comes to our table and gives us his "song and dance" about "US"  being the first customers EVER to COMPLAIN about HIS food. (obviously he had his guard up before he came to our table) he bragged about how HIS customers have complimented him on HIS food. Hes sooooo surprised that our palate was different from others  ( HUHHHH really dude)  but hes absolutely right about that WE KNOW THE QUALITY OF GOOD FOOD !   This place is for people that dont care about Real Flavor in their food and for the most part i cant help but to think that people that like this slop " DONT KNOW HOW TO COOK"   I cant comment on the other foods only because we didn't dare  go back for another SLAP TO THE PALATE !   We were in and out of their so quickly , it was like being on an episode of  THE TWILIGHT ZONE.. It was indeed a frighting experience.   Its taken me longer to write this review than the actually time we were their .   The manager gave us a refund, but its not posting as of yet  in our bank account.  TWO THUMBS "DOWN" WAY, WAY ,WAY DOWN !

This place used to have really reliably good buffet food. However in the last two years it has really dropped off and the food is only mediocre. The dishes are still dirty so you have to look for a clean plate, the floors are filthy, and even the employees uniforms are dirty. The entire restaurant has dropped in quality and is not worth the price anymore.

I shouldn't have gone here on Mother's day for my first time.  My review I am sure would be different if it was not such a mad house.    On the note of Mad House... this must mean other people really like it a lot cause it was super packed and just elbow to elbow.    The food to me was very generic, instant mashed potatoes, canned corn, over cooked rice ect.  The food did not bring a wow factor to me.  I did enjoy the chocolate fountain and the fresh fruit.   The salad bar was nice also.    It was extremely busy and hard to get in to the food. It was a little scary to walk with a plate of food because everyone was bumping into each other.  I did not see a drink soda fountain which was a down fall because you have to wait for the poor over welmed waitress that was loosing her mind with so many people to try to get to.    The floors where messy due to it being so packed and it made the place look nasty.    I will have to go when it is not a holiday to get a true opinion but my opinion when it is packed is that they should limit the people they seat on these days because it was horrible to try to eat there.  They do not hold up while with high volume unfortunately.
I love this golden corral , the food they have is very fresh and tasty . The staff is very friendly as well . when I eat I am never disappointed.

Two star rating because the server Carole was friendly and attentive. Food was very salty, steak was burnt and dry, buffet bar was dirty and I was there for an hour and never saw dinner rolls available. Ladies room had toilet paper everywhere on the floor and two employees used the restroom without attempting to clean it up. I wouldnt recommend, especially at the cost of $11.69 a person.

hello   my friends im  taking a dear friend of mine today here for a  Christmas  lunch  we  have been there before always get our  fill of food  save room for the sweets aswell well I wish everyon a happy holidays and a happy new years too
Service is awesome but the food is not good at all, for the price the station casinos are million times better and cheaper. Will not recommended this place and will never go back.

DISGUSTING and UNSANITARY!!!  Is it possible to give a restaurant NO STARS?  I've gone to this restaurant a few times since inception at the Puente Hills Mall location and the more I come to eat, the worse the customer base becomes and the more disgusted I get.  While people were standing in line to be seated, they have already started eating with their hands - that means that bacteria they have on their hands will transfer to the serving spoons when to go for their seconds, thirds, fourths....  Then there's these people who are so happily thinking how cool it is to hold their strawberries before sticking them to the chocolate fountain... AGAIN, it's called "spreading germs, people."  The staff sees these issues and don't correct or replace the food.  I will never go to this place again.  Manuel R. is correct, their name should be changed to GHETTO CORRAL.
Just terrible food. Service was okay but i couldnt eat one thing in that place. Stay away.
It's ok. The quality has gone down since it open. I'll rather go to a casinos buffet it's cheaper and free drink!
Delicious ! Very crowded but the food is worth it. Very friendly staff except for one girl who forgot my sprite. The chicken is juicy and I tried all types of it. Try to come when it's not as busy.

Worst service ever! We were sitting next to a large family that knew everyone in the restaurant.  Our waiter was very attentive to them, but I had to mad dog him just to get rolls. Then he doesn't bring us butter or anything.  When my drink was empty he came over and asked do you want a refill or not? What??? Really. .it stinks in there and the food was sub par. Needless to say, he did NOT get a tip and I won't be going back anytime soon. Very disappointing.  The bathroom was disgusting!! They say you can judge the cleanliness of a kitchen by the restroom...I certainly hope this isn't the case!!

We've been to this buffet a number of times since it opened and it's always been pretty decent. We hadn't been here for for quite some time and decided to go yesterday. I was pleasantly surprised.  I usually get the same things and they're always good. This time I found that there were a greater variety of items and I didn't have the same thing twice. In fact, after trying a little of this and a little of that I was too full to make it to the dessert area.  Everything was hot, fresh, juicy and tasted great. The ONLY thing I tried that was bland and flavorless was the white gravy. Which was too bad since the pork it was paired with was awesome.

The food is not good for the price you pay. The best thing about this place is the salad bar. The lines are long and the place is too small. The neighborhood is horrible and there are weird people lurking around the parking lot. I hope they build another one in a better neighborhood soon.

Bread rolls were puffy clouds of deliciousness.  The steak was well seasoned although some parts were a bit too gristly, but tasty still. Love their dessert bar.  Although you can place an order of grilled seafood, it takes about 20 minutes. But Mon-Thursdays for a limited time, two adults are $20. excluding beverages.  Worth it because kids have a variety.

My husband wanted to go here for his birthday lunch on May 1. Went to the register to pay and cashier said "2 seniors?". I said yes. We ordered drinks too and the cashier never mentioned the $6.95 deal. Just dreadful depressing personality of the cashier. It wasn't busy at all , she couldn't even muster a thankyou. She shouldn't be in front of customers. Didn't find out about the $6.95 deal til we sat down and her response was "well, you said you were seniors. I hope her birthday is as pleasant as she made my husbands. Never again.

Lots of variety in their foods.but mostly American themed. Tried this great mandarin shrimp loved it. Great salad bar and lots of deserts!!! You must try the chocolate chip cookies with vanilla ice cream.
It's a buffet with lots of people, with lots of hands and arms reaching over food that you're eventually going to eat if you go here.. Food is so-so. I'll pass on buffets from now on.
Oh I heard these amazing things about the chocolate fountain!! Ehh im never coming back again...people are rude here...Cursing and talking loud around kids..ya no thanks!

This rating is based only on cheap buffets.  This is the first time I've been to a Golden Corral.  I like the variety.  It definitely has more than Hometown Buffet does.  My husband was not with me, but he would love the fact that there is tons of meat and deep fried stuff. haha.  We had an excellent busser who always refilled our drinks and gave us the best sweet bread.    The place could be a little cleaner, but of course you can't always expect that at a buffet during the dinner hours.  Wish there was one close to me.

Food was so bad my daughter threw up and we all have the runs, the chicken served was more than just pink, not only that but it was ALL very blan. I have had MUCH better... So don't believe all the hype, and so not worth the 1 1/2 hour wait..... This place should be called the stable, because all of the mess and pigs that go there and eat the slop. It was very uncomfortable sitting under the bright lights and witness the mess.... What a disappointment !!!!!!

Whew, what is it possibly to say adverse to a well-maintained Golden Corral with more than adequate selection and quantity of the days specials your own hand, temperature appropriately prepared and ready for your enjoyment.  How I began the night was with a healthy serving of BBQ ribs, a cut of grilled steak, a baked sweet potato, well garnished with butter and cinnamon and a vegetable combination of green beans, Lima beans, corn that was simply out of this world.  Needless to say that greedy sit in and I did have a second plate of some of these some of my favorites. I was able to top off this excellent eating Adventure with my signature chocolate and vanilla swirl cone and I was out the door running before Temptation led me to a third plate.  See you soon @GoldenCorral
Have been here 3 times. All 3 times resturant was filthy.  Food is not as good as other golden corrals.

To Serve or Not Serve   Hello Yelpers   Recently, I had a experience at a Golden Corral Restaurant that concerned me enough to write to their corporate office not once but twice. After receiving "no response" I thought I might as well add this to my " Yelp" reviews". I believe it's incumbent upon management to put things right for any and all concerns a guest may have while dining at their establishment. I have never experienced Management at a corporate level fail to respond in a timely manner when a guest addressed a concern. With the vast amount of establishments to dine at one would think that the last thing management at any restaurant would want is to have a guest leave unhappy or, in my case to never come back again. Rather then writing a strategic rant, I have decided to attach the letter I sent to corporate headquarters.    September 23, 2013   Corporate Office of Golden Corral   I am writing this letter to discuss a recent experience I had at your Golden Corral restaurant located at 420 N Dysart Rd, Goodyear, Arizona (623) 925-9075. I have visited this location many times and have always enjoyed the quality of food and superior service. However, my latest visit to Golden Corral has me very concerned as a guest.    On Saturday, September 21 around 1130 A.M. I visited your restaurant to purchase a dozen rolls for a BBQ I was having later that day. When I returned home and opened the box of rolls I noticed that the rolls were hard and somewhat overcooked. I realize this has happened to us all at one time or another. Each of us has ordered food at a restaurant and gotten something that differs from our expectations to some degree. I appreciate that restaurant work is a very challenging business, and sometimes cooks and chefs can get caught up in a multitude of orders, all at the same time and the quality of a product can suffer. I usually do not return food but I really wanted to serve the rolls at the BBQ so I went back to have the rolls replaced.   I arrived at the restaurant around 1:25 p.m and asked to speak with a manager (whose name I do not recall). To be fair, the manager came over apologized and he offered a replacement dozen of rolls fresh out of the oven and advised it would be about 6 minutes. That was nice; my concern lies in the statement the manager made after he took the dozen rolls I brought back. The manager asked if I had "touched the rolls" because if I had not touched the rolls they could be used to make "bread pudding". At that moment I wanted to leave the restaurant and I would have left had the replacement rolls not came fresh out of the oven. My concern lies in the area of food, health, and safety issues. Is taking returned food from guest and reusing it standard operating procedure for Golden Corral?   I am not an expert by any means in the area of food preparation. However, I do realize that food safety is a scientific discipline and the proper handling, preparation, and storage of food is the only way to prevent foodborne illness. Food can transmit disease from person to person and standard precautions should always be adhered to. When you are a guest at any food establishment your thought is; the food ought to be safe, and the preparation of the food should be such as to avoid potentially severe health hazards, such as taking returned food from a guest and reusing that product.   I am not sure if I will ever revisit Golden Coral again but I know without a doubt that I will never go back to your Avondale location. The thought of reusing food that a guest returned is enough to keep me from coming back to that location.   Thanks  Dxxxx Gxxxxxxx  1xxxx W Xxxxxxxxx Ave  Xxxxxxxx, Arizona  xxx-xxx-xxxx

Good food for a buffet chain. Extensive salad and dessert section. Kids love love love the chocolate fountain and cotton candy.  Okay fine, you got me - even I love the chocolate fountain and cotton candy, happy? Best part of the place.  But need to bring up a few cons: - Dear GC... WASH YOUR SHIZ. ALL OF IT. I MEAN IT. plates, silverware, cups - everything, gross gross GROSS, all the time. I usually have to go through 3 or 4 plate selections before I find one without a speck of old food on it. get Kanye and his golddigger to roll up their sleeves and do the dishes in the back... they'd probably be better than who you have now.  - the whole 'get your drink before you pay' thing is so annoying. it slows the (always endless) line down, makes it hard for people to hold a drink while digging through their purses for money, and makes it hard for the waiters to have to refill the drinks FOR you during your meal.   Tips: - if you want to go for dinner and not have to wait a half hour or more: aim for 6 - 6:30pm. Any later, and you might as well end up in the line for Space Mountain at Disneyland.

Had seen GC adverts on TV for about three years and was bummed out that there was no GC in the area.   These ads were on some of the channels on Direct TV and was wondering why show these if no one can go to GC?  I figured one day they'll open one up locally and they are only showing commercials getting us ready to go when they open.  Driving on the 60 freeway to Fry's Electronics I could not believe my eyes, saw a GC billboard saying they are open in Industry.  Instantly I knew I had to go. Oh yeah I have a friend in Miami who goes to GC all the time.  So he said how good it was and when they opened here it was another reason to go.  Don't have to go to Miami for this!   We tried to go one evening but there was a line about 40 people deep out the door so we skipped.  Well today we got to go for lunch.  Line about 30 people deep out the door but we said let's go any way.   Took about 30 mins to get to the register then we sat down.    Was it all I expected?  Yes, I loved it so did my friend.   I saw some negative reviews, I didn't read them but from the lack of stars it's obvious some people didn't like the place.  Well the price was right and the food was great.  The employees there were very nice and helpful.  I can't see why I would not go again.  It's worth the wait in line in my opinion.   There is a good variety of food and deserts.  The fried chicken is perfect.  Golden crispy on the outside and really juicy inside.   I could go on and on about the different dishes.  I suggest you guys just go and try it out.  It's way better than Home Town Buffet.  What HTB has on them is they have an Icee Machine but so what, I love Icee but you know what the GC is far superior so I'll stick to GC.  HTB used to be really good though but over the years it started to become of less quality as it was years ago.  I hope HTB does well, don't get me wrong but GC is the place for me to be.

This is the first one in the entire state of Nevada, I've been told, and although I have been to these places before, this is clearly the best one I have ever patronized.  The food is terrific and the staff is superb.  Two of the very BEST servers are SHAVON & LASHUN; they are PERFECT!.  Overall, this was a wonderful experience for me and one I would heartily recommend to others.  My ONLY complaint is that their breakfasts are only served on Saturday and Sunday.  I wish they served breakfast, seven days a week.  Perhaps eventually, they will.
The food was decent for the price you pay, but the chocolate fountain and the dessert in general is amazing :D
It's ok there I just feel like if I could cook it at home better why go out and pay for it.I'm not a fan at all but my kids love it there for some reason

Came here for the first time with my mom and my aunt, I was warned about a line outside the door almost always so I wasnt surprised about that, we eventually got in and the food was pretty good! talk about food coma! the only reason why I didnt give it 5 stars was because I wasn't happy with where they seated us, we sat near the desert area which may sound like a good thing if you have a sweet tooth! i think not! there was a line in front of my table the entire time! some children would even rest their plates on our table, it was pretty annoying i felt like people were watching us eating, other then that everything else went well :)

My husband and I went here today for my free birthday meal...The meal was #awesome...A delicious variety of food! I love the fact, that I got a free birthday meal for joining the Golden Corral eclub...I think that's what it's called...Anyway, it was #awesome & our waitress, Lawanda, is very nice... It's the regular meal price that is ridiculously expensive...$8.99/meal...I remember about 10 years ago...A meal was only about $6.45...That was a better price...Is there a way to lower the price again?

I have been wanting to try this place for some time because I have tried other locations out of state. I went during lunch, which happened to be 15 minutes before the price changed to reflect dinner prices. It also happen to be within the time frame of the Senior discount, so there were people everywhere. The food is a hit or miss. The employees could definitely do a better job keeping the floors clear. There was trash under the tables and the behind the food area did not look too clean. Overall, all you can eat for $10 isn't too shabby.

Drove by today, on a Monday, at around 11 am and saw that there was absolutely no line outside so we decided to come here for lunch. For those of you who have been here or live in the area, you know this is a miracle! The past few times I've driven by, the line was literally out the door and wrapped around the corner (over 50 people in line) and I've heard that you have to wait over 30 minutes just to get inside.   As far as the food goes, you get what you pay for, and you're paying less than $10 for a buffet, so it's A-OK. Compared to Hometown buffet, it's definitely better in quality. Everything tastes fresh and you can see the chefs cooking behind the counters.   The chocolate fountain and cotton candy are the icing on the cake and I also loved that they had butter pecan ice cream. As you can tell... I love desserts, and didn't care much for the food, but the cheesy biscuits were amazing! (Reminds me of the ones from Red Lobster.) Overall, a pretty good deal for the price.

I love buffets. But not this one. Its expensive. Its limited. Its crowded. And the food is subpar.  A group of friends and I decided on this place after another friend gave it a thumbs up. Ok, I thought. I love buffets.  First thing I noticed, more than five people standing in the front smoking. Like you have to shuffle passed them to get it. What if I had my baby with me? Or my family? Second, some woman was asking everyone to wash their car windows in exchange for diapers. SMH!!  So we go inside to a very crowded small one man register. I paid for two friends and myself. Plus three drinks??? $42.00 So letter me get this straight. This is a buffet but without self serving access to a beverage bar?? And I had to pay for it? Why am i here and not at old country buffet?   So we are seated. Not a bad atmosphere except for the large crowd. I went and collected my food. I got fried chicken and a side salad and bread roll to go with my iced tea. All crap, even the tea.  Worst chicken I've ever had. And its hard for me to not finish fried chicken down to the bone. Bit this fiscrace of a piece of crap just simply wasnt worthy for my stomache. Bland. Not that crispy. A little dry. Smelled funny. Bread was stale. Salad wasnt that fresh although it wasnt too bad. And tea was brisk which isn't tea.   In order to get refills I had to wait for waitress to come and do it for me cause im a baby who cant get his own drink? I didnt even try the dessert.   Overall not impressed. But I guess the dishes were clean and they had catfish off the grill. I didn't try it but it did smell good. If I were in a buffet mood, old country and home town are better selections. Also they are cheaper.

i do really like golden corral  fresh food if you like shrimp wow! they have jumbo size and if you like meat wow charbroiled steaks  and many other dishes not a bad deal at all. i give it a thumbs up!!!!!!!!!

This was our first visit to the Golden Corral in Las Vegas. We had went to another location in Arizona prior to our visit to this location. Here is our review.  The location/place: It is pretty large inside this location. As soon as you walk up to the door, you can smell the food from outside. When we arrived during lunch, the line was out the door, and it was packed inside. When trying to get your food, it is difficult to navigate due to the high amounts of people walking around. Overall, other than the crowd, it was clean, and the seating was pretty comfortable.  The food: The food is really good. Everything was fresh and tasted great. They have a salad bar, meat area, and dessert area with three fountains. They have a chocolate, white chocolate, and caramel fountain. They have strawberries, marshmallows, and other things that you can dip into the fountains. They also have ice cream and cotton candy. I like the great assortment of desserts rather just the same stuff that they have at the casinos.   The best foods that they have are the lasagna, rotisserie chicken, steak, roast beef, pizza, and the ham. Most of the food is good especially for the cheap prices.   I give this place 4 stars because it was worth the price they charge and I don't really have any complaints. Service was good, the waiters are really nice and they make sure you are properly taken care of.

Over $30 for my wife and I to eat here.  I would pay that for a buffet if the food was good, the place was clean, and the atmosphere was decent. Unfortunately none of this was the case.   When we arrived, the employee filling drinks announced she was going on break and just left and the people in line behind us had to wait an extended amount of time until the host actually went into the back and found someone else to pour drinks. A lot of the food was empty on the buffet and at one point there were 11 people standing waiting at least 20 minutes. for 4 or 5 items on one side of the buffet to get refilled.  They advertise "steak the way you want it" but all that was available was medium rare and the grill cook just kept yelling for the line to move and whatever you asked for, you got medium rare.  The food that was available was luke warm at best and the bourbon street chicken was cold.  The employees all seemed very angry and did not want bothered.  Did not see a manager anywhere.   Another issue was sorting through plates and silverware to find something clean.  There were food scraps and sauces left in the middle of the stack of plates and silverware.   Finally we decided to get yogurt for dessert, and the machine didn't even work correctly. It gave us soupy milk like yogurt which looked disgusting.   I've visited before and now after the "re grand opening" and can't tell if anything even changed. If anything it got worse.
This is my 3rd. visit to the golden corral in las vegas the food is good and the staff is really cool people I would recommend this place to my friends and family

I thank you all for your reviews.  After careful reading,  we have decided to go to a known restaurant for our celebration.  We wanted to try this, but after your reviews, I think we won't.  We will go to Austin's Steak house in Texas station for the best crab cakes and steaks you have ever eaten.  Also, try the oyster bar at Texas Station, the seafood there is the best ever and the price is great.  Try the huge peel and eat shrimp,  YUMMY.    This place is dead to me.  LOL

First start with the employees. All amazing, friendly, helpful. Atmosphere was perfect even the Guest where a delight. The food to my surprise (thought it would be like hometown buffet like in California.) But to my surprise the food was absolutely amazing. Never enjoyed myself so much at a restaurant. Ty Golden Corral
Ahh Sun City: population who cares...the place you live to die.  This food is for the dying soul.  so if you're ready to go....itadakimasu! (japanese for bon appetite)

Very unhappy with this buffet. They claim the "Best buffet in America". WOW, I certainly hope not.  Seafood spectacular was anything but.  4 items do make a spectacular, two of which were fried shrimp.  Up side: for $12 the food was tolerable.  DOWN SIDE: place was filthy. Food everywhere on floor, ground into the carpet - we were there for just over an hour and NO ONE cleaned the carpet even once.  Were they busy? Thursday about 6 pm, Steady business. Is this acceptable? NO. Having been in the business for over 25 yrs.- including  a busy buffet, I find this completly unacceptable. On the food line, at least 1/2 the items were empty the several times I walked the line.  All the cooks did seem to be enjoying  themselves rather than tending  to the line. The server was overwhelmed  by 28-4 tops that she was attempting to attend to by herself.  Staff training seemed to be non-existent as the busboy, when he finally showed up, seemed to have had no training at all. So: food - **; Service: Jenny- ****; Cleanliness - 0*.  I, personally will go hungry before considering this as a place to eat.

I'm beyond disgusted with the fact that the same servers who refilling our drinks are the same ppl fixing up the restroom without washing hands and coming out to the floor and refilling our drinks!!! I was ok until I witnessed that but our server is a true team player cus there is no way I would be doing all that work for under $5.00 tips or not she's not paid enough

Finally came here and I thought it was mediocre.  The service was great with out servers really doing a great job.  I thought that the selection wasn't super great but there were definitely some highlights.   The steaks they give could be bigger but having the chance to go unlimited times cancels that. The food tended to be VERY greasy. When you see that the white rice is dripping in grease... you know all their food will be like that.  The selection was the usual going from "Asian" to some Italian, Mexican, etc. The dessert section didn't have a great selection.   The food can be much better and should have more of a selection.  Service was top notch. Price was too high for what is served (in comparison to the Station Casinos).   I might return again but it's not my first pick.

Family loves to come here for brunch. I used to really love this place. I highly recommended it first when I had my first bite but as time goes the flavor and its "wow " factor is gone. Now its just an average restaurant, family still comes here once in awhile catching a brunch or a dinner. Their a high on price, but I think with the selection of food its expected.  I would like to state that the servers are great here. But sometimes when youre caught between breakfast and lunch they just take out the breakfast portion out of the way, sometimes just while iam waiting on the line to get a waffle or something on the breakfast menu, and there is no way to get it back on the selections of food.
Very nice service and the food will make you feel like your at home.  Watch out for dirty flatwear ands plates.
I always seen this buffet on the tv commercials now I finally got to eat here awesome good food.... Bread pudding is awesome

Yes this is basically a Home Town Buffet with a tad better food. I've been here twice so far on weekdays so I usually don't run into long wait times like others have said. The latest I've waited was 30 minutes. The second time I didn't wait at all. Service here is usually great and the waiters are pretty nice and attentive.   Anyway, for the price you're paying, the food here is decent enough. I actually like the steaks here since I can always ask for the part of the steak with the most fat on it. Yes I'm a fat-ass but damn it, a medium-rare steak with a lot of cooked fat is like heavenly to me in terms of flavor. Also, the fried popcorn shrimp and fried jumbo shrimp are pretty good. Especially covered with the tasty gravy meant for the mashed potatoes. Did I mention I was a fat-ass? I think there was a fried fish dish they had there that was pretty good as well.   I would avoid the Asian and Mexican style food since they're really really bland compared to the American style food. Honestly, that stuff is probably greasier than the fried chicken and shrimp they have. So eat American here.   Protip: As two of my friends found out, there's a good reason why cotton candy is suppose  to be all cotton like: when you crush cotton candy into a ball and eat it, you'll probably get diabetes from the massive influx of sugar into your system at once. Also, chocolate covered cotton candy isn't all that good either as my friend figured out.   My luck here has been good so far so I'm definitely coming back if I'm ever feeling like abusing my body.

Went there for dinner. Grilled food was great and staff there was attentive. Only discouraging what I saw with my own eyes.  Unattended kids all over the dessert area making it look unhealthy to even touch. So adults going there with your young ones. Go with them to the dessert area.

Place gave me fiery diaherea, but other than that its pretty bomb. Avoid the nachos, cheese sucks, the pizza taste like my pubes, you know what avoid everything except desserts and drinks. Alot of elderly migrate on sunday as well. Not sure why. Fun place.
awesome! My stomach isn't big enough for all the good food. waaaayyyy better than hometown buffet and that whole chain.

we waited for 11/2 hours to get in, two friends came in later, but we told the cashier and paid for the food already. friends showed up an hour later, we opened the exit door for them. a lady in pink asked my friend if they were paid. my friend said yes. then later as my friend was standing in line to get more food, the lady in pink pointed her finger to a waitress and asked if he paid for the two friends.  my friend could here what she said n felt very insulted.  the waitress came to our table, picked up our receipt and asked very nicely if it was our receipt, and told us that a lady wanted her to check if those two friends were paid. i asked the waitress if the lady in pink is a manager? she said no, maybe she was a customer. we were thinking: what the hell?? what kind of nosy lady is this?? then later the waitress came back and told us she was the owner's wife who comes once a while for a spot check.  not only she had a shit face, but a very nasty attitude. we thought the food was okay, for the price we could be a return customer, but we don't want to go back anymore.  NO RESPECT FOR THE CUSTOMERS FROM THE OWNER. We are not thefts!!!  the owner should learn from their waiter and waitress to provide better customer services!!!

I choose this particular one over the rest because it's friendly... Both customers and employees are nice.  That means a lot to me, in a world of selfish people.  I go the extra mile for everyone here when I go because I have a feeling lots of people here feel the same way.

I hadn't been here in years but used to be my favorite weekly place to go when I lived closer.  It seems they changed a few menu items like removing the fried chicken livers.  Oh well, those were so good.  They added a new item: Smoked Beef Brisket.  It is so good when I add in spicy bbq sauce.  It takes just as good if not better than high end smoked bbq places in Scottsdale.  And this was served during Saturday lunch  I have to try their new steak, which is only available for dinner.  Previously their steaks suck.  It totally lacked flavor and the cut wasn't very good.  The fried chicken here is some of the best in town.  Hot, fresh, juicy, and delicious.  You can tell it is made fresh.  Not sure about all the negative reviews.  If it was doing that bad, you'd think the place would be vacant.  Not so.  The place is packed to the bone and this place is huge.  All rooms were opened and most seats were taken.  For a place that people rate 3-stars, why is it doing so well?  Lol  The tartar sauce here is good and goes great with their baked tilapia or fried catfish.  Both are good.
Always crowded always a mess, kids playing in the food. Not like the other ones that I have been to.

Stopped by today about 2:30pm and surprisingly had a very fresh selection to chose from! They had my favorites like mashed potatoes, fried chicken, okra but new items like fried ravioli, sesame chicken, sliders and grilled cheese. So much food! Place was clean. First waitress was a bit rude because we moved two tables together for our party of 6, but other than that, service was great!
Let me start by saying i miss ponderosa...Im ashamed to call golden corral an american buffet The food quality is very bad..everything is cheaply made will not return

Ate here for lunch. You pay for what you get. The food quality is not that great. A lot of the foods were not replenished in a timely manner. Our server was Tammy. She fail to clear our dishes from our table as we went to get our different course meals. There were dirty cups and silverware on the other tables in our dining area where the people have already left the restaurant. One visit was enough.

Bitter disappointment, for the price, we could have gotten much better food.  I will say, our server "Tonya" was very good.    Much of the food on the buffet looked as if it had been there for many days (I'm not exaggerating). There were devil eggs with yellow crust on top.  They had marshmallows and strawberry's skewered for the chocolate fountain but didn't have the fountain going, they did have some chocolate you could dip in.  I grabbed one of the marshmallows and it crunched when I took a bite, I thought this must be what it's like to eat styrofoam.  The guy on the grill had about 6-8 people backed up, I would have been about number 5 in line but he wasn't even going to look my way or inquire as to what I needed until he got the group in front of me handled....I'm guessing they wanted triple charred, extra well done meat....I wanted medium rare steak and some ribs, which were ready to be put on my plate.  We prayed on the way home that we didn't get food poisoning.  Stay away, this place sucks.

Man this place is GHETTO!  First of all I come during the middle of a weekday (Tue) around 2pm and it is full of people! I guess nobody has a job to go to ? Plus it's not in the best neighborhood either.    After I sat down and went back for seconds, someone came and took all my silverware and took my receipt too. I was not done! WTF?  By that time I was losing my appetite due to the most disgusting people walking around in there. Looked like a freakshow!  2 extremely obese patrons walked by, and some of them looked like ex-cons. Yikes!  I come back to my table and they cleared everything again!!  Jeez!  And nobody ever came to offer me a drink refill.  I cant imagine how this place must be on weekends if a weekday was like this.  Food was just ok.  Salad choices were good. They have Chicken Ceasar Salad which was good. Mini burgers were ok. Desserts didn't impress me.

Sooo its Friday night, We were in the mood  for quick, easy and variety. We ended up here.  Not too bad,  they have been trying to improve the menu/buffet offerings. So far, so good!  I see the changes and I like themthe steaks are better cuts and grilled decently. The fried  chicken was good.  The veggie offerings are my favorite.. some good ole fashion southern inspired offerings. The beverages are not included with buffet,  THEY SHOULD BE!!!!  Overall decent!

There were some things that Golden Corral gets very right, and there are other things that they get very wrong.  I realize however, then when you try to crossbreed a southern buffet chain, with California-type restaurant quality standards....things can get a bit awkward.  Imagine Honey Boo-Boo shopping in Beverly Hills....you get the idea.   I would imagine that much of the food and atmosphere decisions come not from the owners of the specific franchise in the City of Industry, but from the Golden Corral corporate office, who makes decisions based on their own standards of what is acceptable to serve.  FOOD:  I don't know if I have seen such a juxtaposition in a buffet - usually I find buffet food to either be all great, all terrible, or all mediocre.  There were some GREAT choices here....Hush Puppies (rare to see at a buffet!), Texas Toast (which I could just eat all day long), sauteed mushrooms, Bourbon chicken, all different kinds of salad options, hand scooped ice cream (also very rare to find in a buffet!), the chocolate fountain (with surprisingly good tasting chocolate!), and even cotton candy (especially great for the kids).  Now the bad....all of the Chinese food options!  I am not one who has particularly high standards for Chinese food, but dear Lord!  Do you know the expression "chewing the fat"?  Well - now you can!  Just put some of their Chinese chicken options on your plate and start chewing!  The low quality of the Chinese options is surprising to me, especially since this buffet is located in a community heavily populated with Asian Americans.  This is what makes me think that food decisions are strictly made on a corporate level.  Avoid the Mexican options too.  We here in Cali know our Mexican food - and you can't call this Mexican food.  I don't know what kind of food you would call it....  ATMOSPHERE:  Of course because it is a buffet, we know the atmosphere is going to be (1) Crowded and (2) Loud.  So that is completely acceptable.  The buffet area got a little hectic when the steaks were coming out, and the people started lining up.  Even that was acceptable.  However, the booths had absolutely no cushion, so you are just sitting on hard plastic.  (Maybe this is to discourage you from staying too long?!)  Ouch!  SERVICE:  A+!!!!  The guys and gals that work here in such a stressful and busy environment sure have a great attitude!!  Everyone was so friendly and attentive, and service was given with a smile.  Our server was prompt refilling our drinks, and clearing our plates.  And not just our server, but every server in there had the friendliest dispositions!  I see so much potential in this place, but unless they can break away from their food quality products/standards set by their corporate office, they will just be mediocre.  SUGGESTIONS:  This place can be very crowded, with a line that can stretch out the door on the weekends.  Go early in the week (lunch if possible, but dinner is fine too) to avoid the crowds.  Oh yeah, be ghetto and bring your own bottle of either Tapatio or Sriracha chili sauce - you may need it, since much of the food lacked so much flavor!

Quality and variety of food is excellent. Staff and omelette chef are very friendly. Great value. Well managed. Everyone is helpful and will be happy to bring you a coffee or anything else you need. I don't get the negative reviews. Look at the line outside and you'll see this place is a hit! So glad to have a Golden Corral so close by!

Golden Corral is awesome for its variety of food but they are just always packed with not enough tables and not enough staff. They changed the meatloaf recipe bathrooms were dirty kids were biting jello tops and putting them back on shelf for other people to eat. This was the worst eating experience I've had this year!

On 2/17/13, I took my family here to eat. This would have been my first visit here. Upon our arrival, I knew there was going to be a long wait because it was Sunday afternoon. However, after 5 minutes of standing in line we were asked to leave without a valid reason. One worker said they were running out of food but another said their bathrooms were not working. When I was standing in line I noticed their soda machine was leaking all over the floor near the front of the line. There were paper towels covering it up. Also, for the little bit of time we were in line, the line barely moved. I wont' be going back to this location!

I came here for dinner, there were a lot of people but it didn't really feel packed. The cashier was very friendly and most helpful. Along with that, the server was great also, she always cleared the plates in a timely fashion and asked if we needed anything. But, what's really important is the food. Which was absolutely delicious! The rolls, meatloaf, and Sesame chicken tasted fantastic. And, don't even get me started on the brownies. The bottomless pit in my stomach is satisfied, for now.  So 10/10 I will absolutely be back to the corral of golden standards.

As long as you don't go to often the is pretty good for what all you get. The BBQ pork special they've got going was very good compared to many BBQ only places. My big complaint tonight was that the waitress while clearing plates and took my coke with her and never brought one back or didn't even see her after that. Also I asked for the Senior Discount, it does start at 60, and didn't get it. But just didn't notice till I got home. I'm still giving 3 stars instead on 2 as the BBQ and fried chicken was spot on.

I don't even know where to begin....  We went to Golden Corral because we somehow got a gift card. We decided to take my in laws and niece with us as well.  I learned a huge lesson - do NOT go on a Saturday night!  It was insane - a long line to get in, children running around everywhere, buffet was a mess.     I won't comment on the food that much. I obviously did not expect a Tremont dining experience. However, I will say that the baket potatoes were cooked well, mac n cheese was tasty enough, and I enjoyed the sweet potato fries. My family members enjoyed the chicken and chicken pot pie.  My niece loved the ample options for dessert.  This place is a child's dream - 2 chocolate fountains, cotton candy, and ice cream!   My main complaint was the service.  It was very busy, but it took a long time to get a refill on my water.  Our table was still a little dirty when we sat down. My husband got buttery corn juice spilled on him when the cook threw the corn on the cobs into the pan.  The cook apologized, but it was annoying. Guess who did a load of laundry right when we got home....  I would not go back unless given a gift card or was forced due to family obligation. I would prefer to spend the same amount of money at my local Mexican restaurant.  However, for people who likes buffets and traditional American cooking, get ready to pack on the pounds.
They serve 2 week expired yogurt. If they're willing to use expired products that have the label printed on them, imagine how old the food is they prepare.

We go here every now and again. There is always something enjoyable to find and eat. And the good thing is, if you don't like what you pick, you're not committed to it.   The breakfast is one of my favorite times to go, because I like to get eggs, pancakes, and french toast--but in small portions. I also, even though I shouldn't, try a little of their cinnamon bun...their mouth watering, icing drenched, artery clocking cinnamon bun. Sooo good.   I also love the new chocolate waterfall--even though a hate seeing all the little kids go up to it and stick their fingers in...Yuck!

I Called for prices because they are not posted on the website. I asked about prices and was put on hold. 8 minutes later, I'm still on hold. I decided to call from my other phone, I asked the same question. Got my answer right away. Then I asked why I'm still on hold for the same information, for over eight minutes. I got an "I'm sorry we had a rush" Good way to lose customers even before the step through your door.

Golden Corral often gets a bad rap, because some of their offerings are iffy. I agree and believe all would be better served if those were eliminated. When it comes to holiday roast turkey, however, I have to tell you that they do the best job of anyone else out there. It's tasty, and the potatoes, gravy, stuffing, sweet potatoes, and carrots that it comes with are all pretty damn good. Best of all is the lunch price. It simply can't be beat
-Update One  Many of the things were removed, moved, and/or decreased in quality since my first review. I am disappointed, but would still recommend it.

I've been here two times for lunch and I must say it's been good. yes, long lines, lots of people, but after you've gotten your food, the taste isn't bad at all. The mini cheeseburgers, liver and onions, enchiladas, Chinese food, etc. all have been at least par to better. I mean, they are not too greasy, breaded, or fake tasting. The salads are also fresh and they have a great variety. The deviled eggs are like homemade. And the desserts are just plain sweet and fattening. For a buffet, it's better than most, and for the price, it can't be beat. Lots of good stuff; amazingly, I ate less because for the variety I got, with smaller portions, I felt satisfied.

I've only been to Golden Corral twice, and both times, I was very pleased that to see that the selection of of food was so big. And although I've never tried the cookies, I here from a reliable source that they are one of a kind. There are only two complaints: First, its very crowded. When you plan to eat there, prepare for very long lines and tight spaces. Second, the asian rice tastes a little weird, so I would stay away from it.
Food wasn't as great as I expected. It was mediocre. The best part is the chocolate fountain. MMmmm. Add some chocolate covered strawberries to your ice cream and its perfect.

Food was great and is what you expect from Golden Corral. The price was great, $12 for adult dinner which included the all you can eat steak. My only negatives was the steak was WAY over cooked; quite surprising for how busy it was and it was difficult to maneuver through the rest of the herd. People were acting as if this was their final meal.
Food is okay, although the steak was outstanding. The service at the table sucks, nearly possible to get refills on drinks. Make it easier and let us self serve

Great price $16.00 for dinner, all you can eat steak as well as a very good selection of other meats and food. My server Janeisha was excellent always right there to make sure I had everything I needed.

You get to watch people but in line, take multiple heaping plates of the premium items....then drop it all over the floor. The food is just too salty, and has been every time we have ever gone. You get to hear the cooks open cans of food product behind the salad area for long periods of time, can after can.  The salad area is wonderful with many fresh choices. The wait help works their buts off.

I don't know what it is but all buffet food taste the same no matter where you are. I love Golden Corral. There is lot and lots of options for everyone in the family and the ROLLS are awesome. If you are a fan of Buffets you of course will love this place. But if you are a snoody prideful clown, don't even bother.

Birthday Lunch for two of my coworkers. They wanted to try this place.  Ten nurses lining up on a long a$$ line... this yelpette was not happy.  Now I know why.  Its affordable.  Its your new version of Hometown.  All good.  One of our boss who joined us said they have a Golden Corral in Arizona and for them white folks, its not all that. But overall, I think we were all satisified.  Anyway, food was fresh.  Lots to try.   I did not get to eat all that I wanted.  I am taking a better approach on foods I do eat nowadays.    Nonetheless, awesome time with my coworkers.  I will return only if there is no long lines.
Way too long of a line for fair food and the prices are too high for the quality. Also, watching children dip their hands into the "Wonder Fall" is just gross.

Well let me start by saying i agree with all of the reviews i have read already...but let me start with one obvious problem i have always had with buffet style restaurants...THE CARPET....UHHHHHH!!!!!! I mean if these establishment are going to have carpet in a public area with kids present and people generally eating like kids...then you must pay close attention to the CARPET!!!!. The CARPET had a horrible smell at this location...and you really have to be careful not to let it ruin your appetite.  Secondly for the $25 price tag...if your not going for some sort of special...like the all you can eat ribs....which no one else does...then it may not be worth your money. This evening...because my wife loves ribs...is why we even went to pay this establishment a visit.   Now don't get me wrong the food is very good...not great...but very good. I had a fabulous piece of rotisserie chicken breast with mashed potatoes and gravy...mac and cheese....and dinner rolls. My wife had the ribs of course.... along with various sides.  Now the dessert is not so great or very good for that matter. I had the lemon tart....brownie...and vanilla-chocolate swirl yogurt...and all of them were awful. My wife had the lemon cake and vanilla ice cream along with some fresh strawberries and she seemed to enjoy it.  Now in conclusion i don't have to go here again personally...but if a special deal comes to this establishment and you really like it you should definitely give it a shot....otherwise pay your $25 to eat somewhere else. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my friends!!!!

The Good:  Steak(Huge): choose the cut you want and top it off with mushrooms or onions.  Spinach: In the Salad Bar high quality spinach.  Sauteed Shrimp: get it from the Cook, plump and juicy and seasoned just right.  Pizza: pesto pizza thin crust.  Cherry Pie  Real Ice Cream: had cookies' in cream.  You will be full at the end TRUST me.  Price is reasonable.  The Bad:  Pasta sub par, linguine stuck together.  Chinese area didn't look good.  Crab salad could use some work.  The Ugly:  Went on a Monday @ 5:30 and there still was a long line.  Crowded & chaotic would sum it up.

Came to Golden Corral on Dysart with the family my grandson's birthday and all. And the service was very lousy if you want your table clean pick it up yourself you want to drink go to the bathroom get yourself a glass of water you get it faster. If you want some sugar make sure its fresh . Cuz it was pretty dry and hard didn't even have fresh sugar. Talk to the management management doesn't seem to care about their servers or their restaurant. I think they need to clean house I think they need new servers and a new management that cares about their business because the food was lousy and service was definitely lousy this will be the last place on Earth that I will come back to unless they clean house and train their servers. manager's name was Vicente. Servers like to hang out where the tea and drinks are they don't serve the tables they don't clean up the tables they're too busy having a party and conversating with one another. The Golden Corral on Thomas is much much better.
Ok so I am not going to say the Best Buffet in Vegas but they do decent food here and have a decent variety. I particularly am fond of the Fajita Chicken, buns with Honey Butter....

I don't know why everyone gives this place a bad review. This is the best bang for your Buck place for me and my family to eat (family of 7). It cost less that $60 and my family always leaves happy and satisfied. Their is a few things that is always good (steak/fried chicken/pot roast/shrimp). Then everything else is is decent. The staff is always friendly.
So first of all I hate the manager there.  His name is Eli, and he sucks at what he does.  Golden Corral should fire him. He's rude and always in a bad mood.  ZERO STARS
Favourite place to go on a Tuesday or a Thursday Tuesday because kid free Thursday is because me and my son love the grill steaks

Go around 1:30 nothing or 2 they have nothing on grill no spoon Carmel topper pump always mess up and employees talk about customer even the manager don't go here goto brook park or akron no star wood be more like it
Very family friendly place. Its always clean and neat. There is one 4 miles from me but We drive 11 miles to this one.

The food here is actually very good. But the same problem as the last time was the weird smell.. Like a resthome.. and I looked at the carpet and it is filthy.. Probably wont be back as i cant really get past the smell even with the food being good..

OMG Worst experience ever. The first thing we noticed when we walked in was that it looked like the carpet hadn't been cleaned in a while. Then after being seated it hit us, the the SMELL!!. It was so bad we couldn't even eat. The whole area where we were sitted smelled like urine. I closer look revealed that the whole place was just down right dirty.Needless to say we will never be back

I took my wife here. The man who was supposed to be cutting the prime rib n other meats had an attitude from Hell. We talked to the manager n got the run around   Yes he did say he was sorry. I got the impression I was not the first to tell him.  We will not be back!   Please change your TV ads.

Definitely one of the best buffets I've been to. The wait is long (about 50 mins) but other reviewers prepared us for that. The prime rib was better than some "sit down" restaurants I've been to. The fried shrimp was crisp and not greasy. All of the veggies at the salad bar were fresh. The top sirloin was over cooked for my taste but the desert choices were great. Cakes, pies, ice cream, bread pudding and even cotton candy!
The greatest place on this earth.  Fo sho! I'd wait hours ....hours!!! Wayyyy better than Hometown.  I'll never go to Hometown again.  Ever. @Sean R you are crazy

When we first went to Golden Corral, it was during their grand opening and everything was a very good. The food variety, selections, quality and service were extremely good. The only complaint I had was the wait time to be seated because the line was out the door.   What a difference a couple months make. Where to begin, well lets start with the outside of a restaurant where you can see homeless people sitting out front begging for change. I have never seen this at any other restaurant ever in my life until now. Next we go inside where the food variety and selections are still decent, but the quality and service have dipped a lot. The best thing this time around was the wait because there was none, but I can understand why.

The absolute worst buffet in the USA, or at least in Las Vegas. Those damn Jeff Foxworthy commercials made us make the trek and we should've just eaten the thirty bucks. The only reason they even deserve a star is for the yeast rolls. The food is questionable at best, the service and the patrons are horrible. I'm ashamed we even went. If you are thinking about going - DON'T.

Went here just to see what it was about. It's gross. Don't go. I thought the chocolate fountain was pretty cool until I saw a grubby kid just standing there sticking his finger in it over and over and over. Where his parents were, I don't know.

Great food. Staff is friendly and helpful. I went for dinner last nite only waited 20 mins to get in nt bad for only 2nd day open . Kudos to Jason(the owner) who I met last nite. Job well down. Come  on Las Vegas let's show our support so they open more afound the valley.

If you get in at the end of lunch early dinner you get the absolute best options. We love grabbing some food here. It's always calm and interesting atmosphere.  I always load up on meet first and then finish with some carbs and some fruits.  Drinks are unlimited and they have a nice wait staff to take care of all your needs.  We will be back. What that lack in sodium they make up for in options. Sprinkle a little salt and pep and your all set

I've come here 4 times in the past year :O. That's 4 more times than I should have been........... but the BF and I have concluded that this place serves the best American style breakfast in the area... if you know what to pick.   Here is our routine:   1. Download onto google excel the menu/nutrition facts from their website. Highlight what foods have more than 2g of transfat and avoid (which is basically the hash brown and the entire pastry section) 2. Go early (around 10am) and there isn't a wait.  3. After you pay, run into the omlette line and immediately get one. Get lots of spinach, onions, mushroom, bell pepper and some ham. Asked for EGG WHITE. Tip the guy making the omlettes. He works hard and is really nice.  4. Get some side food: melon and cantelope.... and limited amount of bacon and breakfast casserole thing.... get some chocolate and regular milk 5. Go back to the table and eat omlette. Get back in line and get a second omlette.  6. Eat omlette.   Wipe mouth and leave. To avoid a tummy ache, avoid all other sections of the restaurant and do not, I repeat, do not fall asleep after you eat.

Corral is right. You get herded in and fed in an overcrowded, messy and loud feeding area, just like animals.   So sad. I went once and never again.   Take a few steps away to the BJs or Chilis for a much more enjoyable dining experience.

We decided to take the drive down to this restaurant on Sunday afternoon. I was very impressed.  The front entrance was a bit cluttered near the registers and the drink area. The general manager was up front assisting guests and welcoming them.   I started my meal with a delicious salad. Everything tasted real fresh.  Next I moved on to the grill. You can order as many steaks as you want. They cook them to order!  The mashed potatoes were delicious but tasted a bit cold.  I wanted ham to be cut off the bone for me but there was nobody in the front counter. The roast chicken was delicious.  Service was good too.  I was constantly given free refills and old plates were taken off my table.  The dessert bar had so many choices.   We really had a good time here and will definitely return.  We even purchased a take out box and filled it with all sorts of goodies!

Visiting Mesa, AZ from Los Angeles. Was excited to visit as I had heard of it but never been.   The food was delicious.  The service was great; everyone was friendly served us coffee round the clock. Unlike other buffet places, the breakfast was delicious. There was a variety of food, desserts, fruit, salads,etc. too bad LA doesn't have a Golden Corral. I would visit regularly!

The wait and lines are ridiculous...luckily the times I've been here I didn't have to wait more than 30 mins.    Did someone say, All you can eat steak?!? Mainly the reason I come here...decent selection of other food items.  Chocolate fountain and Cotton Candy..Yum!    Be prepared to wait and have people standing in a line when in reality its a buffet, not a grade school cafeteria line.  Come when you are not hungry because if you get caught in a 2 hr wait you will be fainting in the hot sun.

Service is fairly good and the food is okay. I, however, was not satisfied with the sanitation. Of course I understand that it is a buffet, but many plates and silverware looked somewhat unclean. Children were unattended and stuck their hands IN the chocolate fountain. This upset me, since I have always thought Golden Corral was moderately clean. Not only this, but it was pricey, too- $30 for two people.

We went there today for breakfast. They provide a large selection of food items so it's easy to over do it.  These are items we tried; Their Omelets were made to order with fresh ingredients and excellent (left a tip).  Found the grits to be lumpy, cold, covered with a hard skin layer and disappointing, yuk!  The sausage links were good and the bacon was done from lightly cooked and all the way to crispy.  Not very greasy either. Their blueberry muffins tasted great.  Biscuits and gravy was OK. They also had Fried chicken. It was piping hot and surprisingly good with not to much batter/breading.  Fresh fruit was meh.  The service at our table was provide by Mr. N. and was outstanding.  Prices are not too bad. This place works for both hungry and picky eaters but don't expect superior quality food items.  After all it's not the Ritz!

So here goes... In my opinion, as I would like to say if I thought something was bad, it was 'AWESOME-  LY HORRIBLE!'  I wasn't impressed with the food QUALITY.  You ask for medium rare and you get well done.  One bite of the pot roast and I was over it.  The only thing I enjoyed was the corn on the cob which I was lucky enough to get one from a fresh batch.   Like any other low priced buffet, you get the basic American, Mexican & Asian selection.  I thought the dessert was going to compensate for the disappointment on the overall first Golden Corral experience in Las Vegas but I was even more so disappointed.  The carrot cake was dried.  My experience at the Golden Corral in Colorado was by better than this.  I guess for those who like the basic type of buffets that's convenient and cheep, you might just enjoy this place.    I don't think I'll ever be coming back.  For price and convenience give this place a try.  If you are looking for quality, I suggest you go else where and pay for quality food and selection. Just saying.  Happy eatings!

This is one of the best Golden Corrals that I have tasted in the United States. I have to admit the flavor of the food is really great. You do not have to add any seasoning. Rarely, do I find a place that cooks my steak correctly the first time and the flavor is so amazing. The variety of selections seems to cater to every taste bud. Being able to build your salad with fresh fruit, vegetables and toasted croutons, yes! At first, I thought the prices were really too high; but then the quality of flavor, variety of foods and presentation of the selections are worth every penny.

Not bad. Not bad at all. It's a definite upgrade from the other buffets in the area like Hometown and Souplantation. It's more roomier and has over 150+ selection of food! You can also see the hardworking chefs cook the food right in front of you. I went in during lunch time and lunch would run you about 8.50 without the beverage.   The food choices were nice. They section off the food into different areas. Chinese food on one side, seafood on the other, etc. I enjoyed their sliders alot. I also like their pork steaks as well. After only taking two trips to the buffet, I had to tap out and head over to the dessert bar. They have so many whimsical choices like the cotton candy and the chocolate fountain. I dropped a couple of strawberries into the chocolate fountain though :( If anybody finds them tell I said sorry. They even have their own mini ice cream parlor!   All in all, it's a great buffet to head out to. The line can get a bit crazy later in the day so try to head over here for lunch. I arrived at 11:30 and only waited for 15-20 minutes. My friends said they waited an hour+ during the dinner service. Yikes.

Since they closed their locations in Stow and Montrose, we've been coming here. Food is always great ! ! ! Service is good. We did find out that unless you like crowds don't go Saturday evenings. (G) It is packed ! But that is a sign of a good place to eat.

If you are hungry or don't know what you want to eat, this is the place to go!  If you have a large group- this is a great place for a large gathering!  They have a large private room. The dessert spread looks heavenly!

What to say, what to say... this was a fairly average Golden Corral experience but something that I can't quite put my finger on seemed "off". We like Golden Corral and have been to several across the country, but for some reason this visit just didn't seem "up" in any way.   The food was reasonably fresh by GC standards. The service was flat, minimally attentive, and mechanical - perhaps attributing to the overall feel of the place.   The "premium" butterfly shrimp was definitely the best of the shrimp feature. As usual, the steak was very good but getting it at your cooking preference could be a challenge unlike at other locations. Again, a service thing.

I've eaten at this Golden Coral pretty regularly since they opened several years ago. I figured it was time to leave a review.   Now, I'm not a "try it all" sorta buffet patron. I zero in on those things I like and tend to stick with it. So, no, I haven't tried everything they have. But I have had quite a bit. The short version of this review is "If you like buffets, then you're going to like the Gastonia Golden Corral on E. Franklin Blvd."   My staples are the popcorn shrimp, who's breading is heavy, but not so much that you're not exactly sure whether there was a shrimp in that bite or not. As mentioned in another review, the pot roast is really good. The fried chicken is always crispy and the seasoning is just the way I like it. The meat loaf is also very good. Let's not forget the grill, where you will get a steak cooked pretty close to the way you like it. Now, let me remind you.  You're in a buffet restaurant, not a steakhouse, so don't judge with your steakhouse glasses on. :) I like my steaks medium rare and the cook is happy to show you the cut before serving so you can choose. When I choose to get steak, I'm always happy with how it tastes. The Bourbon Chicken never fails to call me back for seconds.   As for sides, I suppose all the usuals are present. All are good with the exception of one. The collard greens are just terrible. Now, it's their recipe, not an off night or disgruntled cook. For me, collard greens need to be cooked in fatback with perhaps a pepper or two in there for some bite.  Then cooked long and low.  No where, did I make mention of sugar. The collard greens here have sugar in the recipe. I've tried them on three occasions just to see if it was a bad night in the kitchen or not.  They were as bad the second time as the first.  The third time was accidental.  They just look so good! I forgot.  But yes, they were just as bad again. But if you like sugar in your collards then Bon Apetite!  I don't spend a lot of time at the salad bar, but my wife does. She's never commented to me about how awful anything was. Everything I've ever had from there has been crisp and fresh.   So I'll say it again.  If you like buffets, then I think you'll like this one. I give it 4 stars because I am a fan of this Golden Corral. They serve fresh food that is seasoned nicely at a fair price.
Best food. Great  setup. Better than Hometown Buffet. They're very  fast on refilling food.

With so few locations in California we were happy to have to run an errand that put us in within a few miles of this Golden Corral. My friends who ate at the Nampa, Id location jumped at the chance to go with me and we had two other people.with us who had never been to one.  We went on a Sunday and only had to wait about 40 minutes.  The food was good,fresh,and plentiful. We ate until we were ready to explode.  I am looking forward to going back there next month!
The only decent buffet in town when you want to eat a little more than usual. Everything seemed very fresh.

Used to be awesome when it was ten bucks. They raised the price to about 17 with tax per person and about 6 bucks a kid. The food quality has become terrible, the service is sub par (because the prices are high, not many tip, according to servers I talked to), the only saving grace, is their extensive salad and dessert bar. Unmatched. Ruby Tuesday has got nothin on g.c's fresh bar. I would go for lunch at $7. You can fill up for cheap if you don't care about steak or shrimps so much.

Came out to Vegas from California  and as a large family we thought golden corral would be awesome to go to and boy what an experience from ants all over our table while eating to having to stand up every few minutes while eating so other parties can get more food... extremely annoying did i mention the hair in my sons dressing? the servers were kind and did what they can but the manager told me there was nothing he can do about it and thanked me for being so kind  not to mention it took over 30 minutes for the manager Mr charlie to even come ... he  said he thought he took care of the ant situation but thanks for letting him know he will work on it. .. ruined appetite for me.  I only gave the 2 stars because of the servers samantha and her co worker winter  attempt to make things better they did what they could ... but charlie yuck not cool at all   ... however me nor my family which it was a party of 16 will never return to this location... by far the worst I ever had to deal with ...

Just BAD. Greasy food that has been picked over and the staff is slow on cleaning the areas. Piles of dirty dishes, and trays in the middle of the seating area. I will not be back. Even if someone else is paying I would not come back. YUCK!
Definitely Best buffet in Las Vegas! Huge choice for reasonable price! The service was spectacular
Service was great, but place was dirty, food salty and people putting hand in chocolate fountain. Lady had dog in purse and was petting dog, then touching food. My wife and I will never return.

I'm really not a fan of this buffet restaurant.  Honestly the area the restaurant is located in is not that great.  I was dying to try this golden coral because I had eaten at two other golden corals in 3 different states and they were super awesome.   They were so awesome I had to pinch myself to make sure I hadn't died and gone to heaven.    This golden coral I was disappointed in.  Number one it's the type of restaurant where you have to wait for your drinks.  They were crazy busy and it took forever for refills.  I hate it when restaurants understaff.  To me the food was bland.  The only think I really like was the steak.  The salad bar was ok.  It took me several weeks to go because it always looked packed.  Eventually I decided to go with my girlfriend during the busy hours.  Big mistake!    Other customers there were like packs of animals and when the staff set out new food they would load up their plates until they had to put out a whole new batch.  To me the franchise here in Vegas has just lost some of its flavor.

Don't be fooled. This place blows. Never had good meal at any Golden Corral locations. Expect dry steak, bland country gravy, bland soups, poor salad, and super salty sausage and bacon.  This place is, however, great for trolling your friends who offer to buy you a birthday meal anywhere you want. I always pick this place because they hate it.  The chicken strips that they never have are the tits. But good luck finding them though.  Two stars for lolz, not quality.

We don't visit here often but it has gone down hill! There was not a very good selection of food and the poor selection that was there did not look nor taste appetizing at all. I will not be going back at all. Especially after what we paid for 5 people to eat there 3 of which were children. You know it's bad when there were people getting sick in the bathroom.

The food is not bad, every time we go there it is just chaos. Waiters take forever for drinks & picking up plates.  My favorite thing was the fried ravioli and it wasn't there last time we went.  Its always the same food not really a variety. Would go back but its not my first choice.

I pass by this place everyday driving down Cooper/Stapley and decided on a whim to go for dinner one night with my boyfriend. It was very crowded when we arrived but the line wasn't long (thank God) but paid almost $30 for 2. Everything was categorized by stations so we started with the salad bar, which was closest to the booth in which we were seated. Everything looked fresh and dove right in, bringing back some Clam Chowder soup as well. No complaints with the salad bar, just needed to add some salt and pepper to the soup. Next we went around to the rest of the stations, where there were options of chicken, steak, ham, pizza, taco bar and assorted sides. Food looked like it had been sitting out for a long time and there were hardly any healthy options to choose from. When I came back and started eating, everything I ate was horrible. The chicken was extremely dry, the ham that was sliced to order was not moist and had this overly sweet and hard glaze to it. My boyfriend got a steak and he said for the cut of meat it was, which wasn't good, was cooked well and at least edible. We also tried the popcorn "shrimp" when we realized it wasn't actual shrimp. The taco "meat" was truly a mystery as well. Nothing had flavor and everything was so dry. Gross.  As for sides, the mashed potatoes were awful and the mac and cheese was mediocre at best. I didn't touch the pizza, as it looked nasty. My boyfriend and I did not finish our plates and debated just grabbing dessert and leaving. We walked to the dessert bar, where the options were a plenty but not too appetizing. The chocolate fountain with strawberries was the best thing I ate. The apple cobbler and peach cobbler were giant blobs of canned fruit disasters. We were still hungry so we went to grab more salad but when we walked back to the salad bar, everything was taken away and being cleaned with bleach. I wondered why they were bleach cleaning during the middle of rush hour dinner service...the smell permeated the entire area, which made wanting to eat even more unappealing. So, we scratched that idea.    Golden Corral, we tried to like you but you just make it very tough with your step below "cafeteria" style food. It was also very dirty inside and dcor is very outdated, which makes the place seem even more dirty. Our server was also annoyingly loud and was singing to every song being played on the radio. Really, people don't want to hear your squealing during dinner. I couldn't wait to leave.

I have been to this location several times and the food is very good for what it is! Most of the food is surprisingly fresh and flavorful. The salad bar is sufficient as well. The great thing is the selection of food offerings. Some of the things that I find consistently good are the Yankee pot roast, ham, grilled chicken and fried chicken. The vegetables are usually quite good too. The turnup greens were vibrant and very tasty, however, they didn't have any apple cider or pepper vinegar to go along with them - bummer! Like I said - overall pretty good for what it is.

Good for a full course dinner!  Especially when there is shrimp and steak.  Not good for lunch, where selection isn't really that great..  You know where there's a lot of food but nothing to really eat?  Like opening your fridge, seeing all the food, but shutting it anyway.  That's what lunch felt like.  Also, I definitely don't think it's worth waiting in line.    Recommended for: No lines + dinner [without high expectations] + lots and lots of hungry guys/girls + affordable price.

American food variety in unlimited quantities, as a child I recall relatives going to an American buffet after church every so often. I recall the curiosity as a kid. Some buffets seem to have lost their touch, this one, reminds me of the buffets I ate at as a child.  I came during the lunch hour, which, judging past reviews seems like the best time to come here. My wait was 10 minutes or so, the food was fresh and hot, as good as it can be for its style and genre, since it is not Wolfgang Puck.  I saw most or all of the foods depicted on their website.  Highlights: --Cotton candy machine --ice cream cone area --Chocolate Fondue machine --Areas labeled as Italy and Asia, a huge fruit and veggie salad bar. --I enjoyed the chicken skin on the fried chicken, pork chops and brownies  Silly me, I did not see the fries, I also was too full to try the chocolate strawberries and the Mexican food.  Place looked clean, service was efficient and no issues today.  This is modern Americana in unlimited portions, nothing fancy, no foie grass, valet service, plate presentation or all of that. For what this is, a modern American buffet, I rate this pretty high. If I come back in the evening and the wait or quality is lower, my rating will go lower too.  I like to eat American, so I will be back.   Rick Derringer 1985 song "Real American" http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FIVf7eTqmpE  I like to eat American, pie for the plate of every one I like to eat American, give me a slice, give me some fries!  When it has greasy fat and it goes with fries After a juicy steak, give me apple pie If you heard my friends, they say super-size They want chicken wings, give me juicy thighs  I like to eat American, pie for the plate of every one I like to eat American, give me a slice, give me some fries!  Flavor is strong so I write this song Line is feet long but not a furlong Buffets ring a bell inside of me Hunger is what keeps, all of us yelping  I like to eat American, pie for the plate of every one I like to eat American, give me a slice, give me some fries! If you heard my friends, they say super-size They want chicken wings, give me juicy thighs I like to eat American, pie for the plate of every one I like to eat American, give me a slice, give me some fries! I like to eat American, pie for the plate of every one I like to eat American, give me a slice, give me some fries!

My husband and I visited last week around an hour and half prior to closing.  Mind you I did not know it was somewhat close to their closing time.  The food was mostly old and not fresh (outside of the salad).  I understand what time it was, but if they are going to be welcoming new guests, they should ensure the food is up to standard, especially when paying $12 per person.  It was very slow but the server only checked on us once to bring my husband a refill but left the plates on the table.  After about 15 minutes, I called her over to ask for a refill (cup sate empty for a while) and that is when she took the plates.w  I called the next day and spoke to a shift manager to discuss these concerns.
