It isn't the best, I mean we are not in Vegas here.  But not bad, and a good enough variety.  Came during lunch but wish we came around 330pm so that we could be around for the dinner menu. In my opinion it is better than Home Town Buffet.  Luckily I came when there was no line but place was still pretty pack.  My niece especially love the cotton candy, in her mind it is the best buffet around just because it has that.  Definitely will be coming back.

First off, Ignore the low ratings by some of these "buffet haters"  These people just don't like buffets and if you're one of them, please don't go. Why do you guys even waist your time posting reviews from buffets you so clearly don't care for?       That said to all of us that love buffets, this is the best buffet second to "Rio" in Vegas.( That one is the "Holy Grail" )  Golden Corral offers Great steaks and a whole slew of different stye chicken wings.  tasty pizza and it goes on and on.  Just come, that's all I need to say.!!     Cons.  Restaurant  should be bigger IMO.

I am a proud Golden Corral aficionado and I don't care who knows it. I grew up in the South so I'm partial to Southern style cooking, and Golden Corral is THE place in town that can get me my fix when I'm craving old fashioned pot roast, fried chicken, boiled cabbage and green beans. They prepare and season their veggies in the true Southern style and they are pretty darn close to the ones my grandmama used to make for Sunday supper. That's why this place brings back warm memories for me and that's why I love it.   I've dined at Golden Corrals all over the country, and the one here in Vegas is one of the good ones. The food is always tasty, fresh, and the restaurant is clean (especially for a lower end buffet). As long as you don't come here with unrealistic expectations about fancy food and five star service, you won't be disappointed. Are you going to get James Beard Award quality steak? Food Network worthy desserts? No, of COURSE not! But you ARE going to get down home country cookin' that will warm your belly.   It can get crowded at peak mealtimes but the line tends to move quickly. Prices are higher on the weekends and at dinner time (when they bring out the "fancy" offerings like steak and fried shrimp) and they do have a senior discount for old timers. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner, all buffet style. Unlike casino buffets in town, drinks cost extra but you get free refills.

Absolutely Thee best golden corral i have been to!! Everything was seasoned great!! Everything was fresh the broccoli and cheese i absolutely couldn't get enough of...not to mention my steak..cooked to perfection!! Definitly made this Cali girl wanting more!!
Some good food!  Everything hot and most items fresh.  Aunt B's chicken is best.  Salad bad was great.  Had dozens of items.  Service was good

Food is well decent but the service is TERRIBLE it is not that hard to be courteous to customers. It is not okay to ignore people and give so much attitude. My family and I understand how the restaurant business works and were by no means rude or even needy but after being bumped into by a server (by the name of Destiny in an uncrowded area)  I don't think we will be back to this location and I hope for the business they get it together.

My husband wanted to go here after attending the Pittsburgh ComiCon.  We don't have them up in New York, and he likes to try different buffets.  We'd actually been here once before and it was incredibly busy, but I acquiesced because it was my husband's choice.  Anyways. It was still incredibly busy, but the service this time was much speedier.  Our waitress was super-polite, made sure our drinks were NEVER empty, and she never let dirty plates sit too long.  The food for dinner really wasn't that great.   I love to have big salads, but I felt like the choices were limited.  (Though the lettuce was decent.)  The main courses were mostly overdone.  My husband saw a little kid dipping his hand into a container of pineapple.  The Rolls were dry.    Only thing that redeemed this review from getting 1 star - the chocolate fountain!
Would like to say went to this location 2 first time was ok 2 one was awesome . we had the best server thomas. Good job Thomas !

I will start off by saying that the food was much better than I was expecting. If this review was only about the food I would give the Golden Corral 5 stars. But alas, there were problems that have prevented that from happening.  This was the first visit for all of us. We were a party of 5, and arrived early because people told us the line was long and we should plan on waiting a while before being seated. We walked in the door with a big sticker that said "We're glad you're here" and there was not a single person ahead of us. Walking up to the register I would have expected a greeting along the lines of "Welcome to Golden Corral". Instead the cashier snapped "You have to get your drinks first".   I understand that some buffets do not include the drinks, and I am OK with this. But I do not appreciate being misled. I also don't find this to be a friendly greeting. We paid and stood by a sign that said "Please wait to be seated". After waiting for some time the rude cashier finally told us we could take any seat we wanted. (Note to other diners: Signs here don't mean that much)  On the way to find I table I couldn't help look over the food, and was happy to see hand scooped chocolate chip mint ice cream and hot fudge. ... Let the dinner begin ... Again I will mention that the food was good. The service, however, was terrible. Drinks were never refilled, plates were never cleared. I was wondering if we picked a table without a server assigned to it, but there was ample staff working.   Looking at the employees I noticed that nobody smiled. Not a single employee seemed to enjoy their job. This was a terrible place to work. Waiters and waitresses pushed their way through customers. Customers are nothing more than an inconvenience to the staff.  OK, time for Ice Cream!!! I stood at the counter, but the single employee behind that counter was rolling some balls of dough. Her back was to us and we could not get her attention. Yes, once again, customers are nothing more than an inconvenience to the staff. I gave up on the Ice Cream and went to the chocolate fountain. There was a single green strawberry and the chocolate was foaming. (I'll pass on that).  The cookies were good. A second trip to the ice cream bar was a waste of time, as there was more bread dough to roll.  Of the 5 of us, two people said they would come back despite the poor service. Myself and my date felt differently. We agreed never again. The 5th person was indifferent, saying "I could take it or leave it". Seeing how 60% of the Golden Corral's new customers have no plans on returning, I now understand why there was no line at the front.  In the restroom there is a sign that states: "Employees must wash their hands before returning to work". This scared me, as we already determined that "Signs here don't mean that much".

Second time in a row we had a problem. First off they were out of Vanilla soft serve ice cream for most of the visit. There was no hard scooped ice cream available because they said freezer was broken and the cotton candy machine wouldn't work. My family consists of 4  adults and 3 kids all of which were very let down given the deserts were not available. When I went to the manager, she seemed like I was a thorn in her backend and was Very Unpleasant!  Also, we told our server there was little ants or bugs crawling on the walls ( I have pictures)  and she said the manager would come over to reseat us but never did.  After spending over 87.00 and being let down for the second visit in a row, we decided to leave abruptly.  Probably won't go back and will definitely let others know about the bugs etc..

Pitiful weekend. Loud noisy screaming kids everywhere. Place was trashed. Bakery closed at 6:45 because out of everything!!  Help tries but families just let kids run wild.   Then the only "dessert" was pure sugar on a stick....cotton candy!!  Imagine 11 pm and kids still on sugar high!  Wonder if they told people before they paid how many things they were out of.....provably not!

As a rule I like the Golden Corral, this one was pretty clean, but the food could've been hotter, informed our server, they rectified the situation but was to late for us, food still had good flavor, pot roast is always some of the best, as well as the bourbon chicken, but it was cold normally if they're clean they're 4 stars but I was a little disappointed cause it wasn't as hot as normal

Went here today with a friend of my. We both been shitting since we left, I couldn't even make it home had 2 find a gas station to poop at. Now I'm at work feeling like shit, running to the bathroom every five minutes, so embarrassing! Will never eat there again, if you don't want your butt to hurt you shouldn't either Called the store this morning, the "manager" didnt care we got sick trying to say we got sick somewhere else but that's the only place we eat yesterday. He said we can't have a refund we can come for a free meal, why would I want to eat there again? I just paid 30$ to get sick, never again!

Food is great. Place is clean. The clam chowder is not bad but could be better. Great selection of food. Our server Sophia is amazing. She's very friendly and efficient. I will definitely come back here.

The first time I went I was rather excited that there was a new, upgraded buffet than the normal Hometown Buffet. After waiting in line, you walk in and pick up your drinks first - be warned: they cost extra - then you are directed to your table. The seating areas are rather cramped, so if you're a mommy who still carries around the carseat carrier, you might want to think twice about bringing it in with you.   The food here is good because they have a pretty large variety. The salad bar is way better than at Hometown. As for the main courses, they offer things from Chinese spring rolls to Italian lasagna. I was confused by the spinach dip near the pizza. It's there, but the chips you use to dip into it is on the other side of the buffet. They could need some more organization with their food placement. The dessert was ok. The ice cream isn't all that special. It's like regular ice cream. They have the chocolate fountain as advertised, and they even have a cotton candy machine. Overall, the dessert isn't anything to get too excited about.   The staff is nice and friendly. It gets pretty busy, so they run around trying to get everything guests ask for. They are also good about picking up the plates you're done with so you never have a pile of used dishes taking up space on your table.   Overall, Golden Corral is just the new "in" thing that everyone's jumping on the bandwagon to try. It's just like when BJ's first opened. Eventually people will get tired of it and it'll be just another restaurant to choose from for Saturday night dinners.

After seeing so many negative reviews, I decided to pay another visit and see if things had gotten bad.  I went a little before 4pm (Saturday), avoiding the dinner rush, and all I can say is I have nothing to complain about.  The only thing even slightly annoying was that they were apparently changing out the cash register drawers when I got there, and the registers were unattended for a couple of minutes, so I had to wait.  I didn't use the restroom; the rest of the facility was reasonably clean (especially for someplace so busy). Tables were being cleared constantly, and the floor was swept twice while I was there.  If the staff weren't overly friendly, at least they were courteous and competent. More than anything else, they looked tired. I'd guess anyone who works at GC works harder than at a similar-sized casino buffet.  Everything I had today was good.  Fried rice was better than last time. All the fried items I had were very good, especially the Southern fried fish.  The woody bottoms hadn't been trimmed off the asparagus, but other than that they were fine. I also had salad, fried chicken, mashed potatoes & gravy, hush puppies, BBQ ribs, mac & cheese, and a coconut creme tart. My table was cleared promptly, and my drink was refilled promptly.

Food was great. Employees were great. The neighborhood, not so great. I guess for the cost, and if you want a buffet, away from the strip, this is the place to go. I never felt in danger or anything but, it's not the "strip" atmosphere.

Took the family there last night. After reading all the reviews I was not expecting much. Got there about 6:30 PM. Was in line for only about 15 -20 min. Once we paid we found our table. Started to get our food. Not expecting much I was surprised. All the food was really good. Nothing we tried was cold or tasted like it had been sitting out forever. Our server was slow at first but I think she was the only one for our area. I asked for a medium rare steak and I got medium rare. Maybe it was the time we went but I didn't see any unruly kids or rude people. If it wasn't so far away I would be a regular.

My family came here for dinner on a Monday night and there was no wait!  I was pretty excited since it was my first time to Golden Corral.  With all the hype, I had high expectations.  I can't say I was disappointed, but this buffet definitely didn't meet all the hype that has been going around.  It's better than Hometown, but a pale comparison to many Vegas buffet like people claim.  The pot roast, shrimp dishes, and meatballs were good.  The rare piece of beef I asked for was actually well done side piece with a tad of red on the cut portion.  It was sort of dry and okay at best.  The desserts were too sweet, but I did enjoy the chocolate lava cake and the carrot cake with the frosting scraped off.  I heard that their food quality went down a lot as of late and it's pretty believable.  Dinner ~ $12 per person with drink ~ $2.50 per person   Okay.

The best service of any restaurant ever ask for Jesus!  Outside of Vegas this is The Buffet!  Assortment, decent quality, great price.  Dianne runs the joint like a machine!  Any time we are within 20 miles at meal time, you know where we will be!
To quote Arrest Development, "I've made a huge mistake."

After  years of seeing the commercials for Golden Corral, I was excited to hear that one was finally opening up in Las Vegas.  Gone would be the days of contemplating a drive to Kingman AZ or Hesperia CA to dine at what looks like a really great place.  Having now been twice within two weeks (against my better judgement), I can honeslty say I am let down.  I remember going to a Golden Corral as a kid.  It had the best baked potato bar around.  I can remember my family being so upset when they went out of business in SoCal.  This, however, is not the same Golden Corral I remember from back then.  It is just your average every day run of the mill over priced buffett with chceap food.  Not that it is all bad.  The salad bar is solid and seemed mostly fresh.  And the Ceasar dressing is on point.  The hot food though, hit and miss really.  The Bourbon Street chicken was perhaps my favorite dish of the night.  The orange pork was alright as was the sesame chicken but neither were anything worth writing home about.  The egg roll was small and chewy. The lo mein was made with the same noodles as the spaghetti.  That kind of threw me off.  Neither were the kind of noodles I think they strived to be. The meatloaf was smothered in ketchup the way my mom made it when I was a kid so that was nice.  The green bean casserol was good if for no other reason than it was covered with fried onions which happen to be one of my favorite snacks.  My dad and step-mom spent a few minutes discussing the sausage with bell pepper and onion trying to determie what kind of sausage it was.  The sign said it was Italian sausage.  If it takes two people immersed in conversation for five minutes and a third party to finally look at the sign to know for sure what it was, it was probably not the best representation of that food.  On to dessert, the bread pudding was awesome the first time I went while the cobler was not worth more than two bites.  The second visit had the bread pudding looking so horrible I just moved right past it and onto the pies. I got a slice of apple pie.  The apple filling was fine but the crust was not good.  It lacked flavor and the texture was dry and crumbly.  Not flakey likea good pie crust should be.  As for the chocolate fountain that seems to be like a signature of the chain, it seems very unsanitary.  You have this recirculation of liquid chocolate that sees children coating more than their desserts.  I saw hands going in there too.  Furthermore, these desserts are taken out of the restaurant leading to food sticks, food and stickiness all over the parking lot.  It was more sticky than a movie theatre floor.  My dad has said he will not be back and I have to agree.  In a town full of buffets, there are better quality options with better prices.
I love this place .If somethings not right the manager will take care of it.We always get wonderful customer service and the taste is consistent.

Food is always tasty and service is good. I really wish the dessert table had more options for the chocolate fountain. Marshmallows and pretzels are not enough! Where are the strawberries? Another complaint would be allow made to order steaks during lunch. I came for the sole purpose of eating a steak a few rolls and a salad. The guy told me they didn't make made to order steaks until 4:30! So lame!

My family and I tried the Golden Coral in Hesperia, CA a few years back. When we learned there was a Golden Coral here in Las Vegas, we had to try it out. The selection is good and food quality overall is pretty decent. I was impressed with the baked chicken. Usually, chicken can be dry at other restaurants, but the chicken here was juicy and very tender. My kids loved the selection and went back about 5 times to refill their plates. Prices are decent and they do give discounts to children under 12. Weekends are usually busy, so expect some wait times. Service is good as our waitress checked up on us frequently and cleared our table of finished plates. Worth a try if you live locally or are visiting from out of town.

I used to come here a couple years ago but I stopped coming because this place was too unrefined. I started going to the Robinson location because it was a bit more nicer.   After moving away from Pittsburgh, I was excited to come back this month and hit up my favorite all-you-can-eat buffet. Since the Golden Corral in Robinson was too long of a distance, we ended up coming here instead.   This Golden Corral has gotten worse since I last came here. The food lacks seasoning and is either under or overcooked. I remember years ago going to GC with friends and one of them said, "You gotta be a damn fool to come all the  way here just to eat a salad!" We laughed and nodded in agreement because we thought GC food was the diggity back then. But now? The best thing you can get here is a salad!   Oh yeah, I can't forget the dessert station! Messy with empty trays containing crumbs. The chocolate fountain was turned off and the small amount of chocolate that remained was dried up and appeared parched. It was like a chocolate desert. The chocolate ice cream looks like poo. The sugar free desserts were hardly touched. I saw many people had bypassed the dessert station and got fresh fruit instead.   If you want to come here and be entertained, then by all means come here. I find the food here to be mediocre but different strokes for different folks!

Surprise surprise! I love Golden Corral, yes I said it. There were a lot of obstacles in my way that could have changed my rating, but the quality of the food, the variety, the price and the wonderful service really came through for them.  The long wait before you can even enter the restaurant could be a big dealbreaker for a lot of people, we waited for about 25-30 mins before we got seated, not bad at all.  The crowds inside the restaurant itself could drive a person insane, you want personal space, not in here, there is no personal space at all, everyone is in your face and walking in front of you, back of you, side of you, stepping on you, it's a mad house in there.  If you can get over these issues, the food is really good and there is something for everyone, you cannot go wrong. So much to choose from, it was awesome, I loved it.  The service was excellent, we had Joanne from Texas with a sweet little accent and she was great, just a lovely lady. Very attentive, our drinks never ran empty, the plates never piled up, she had such a great attitude, she made the meal even more enjoyable.  Don't let the lines scare you, just be patient and you will be rewarded.

Delicious, warm, fresh just a few positives. my waiter was constant but nice. Never had a bad experience so far.   One note, I have read that the bathroom is dirty I have yet to find the men's bathroom dirty.

A few weeks ago was my very first visit to the Golden Corral buffet. The selection of the food was decent and the restaurant was clean. Some items were good, the southern cooking items: black eyed peas and greens. And, some items were not so good: the mac and cheese. I wanted some mac and cheese to go with my chicken and veggies, but I quickly noticed a pan of mac and cheese that so soupy it really should have been dumped in a double boiler pot and placed in the "soup" section of the buffet. I picked up the serving spoon, dipped into the water mac and cheese and tilted the spoon to really get a visual. The mac and cheese poured off the serving spoon with the exact consistency of water and pasta. The staff behind the glass asked, "may I help you?" I showed them the watery mess and said, "this is mac and cheese is soup." The kitchen manager then instructed the cook/helper to replace it with a fresh batch. I then saw the cook/helper take a very large, steaming hot, plastic bag that contained the macaroni and cheese they serve. So the "homemade" mac and cheese actually comes out of a heated plastic bag. She cut the bag open and poured the mixture in a tin pan. I instantly noticed THAT mac and cheese was just as soupy as the what she was replacing! Then she proceeding to replace one soupy pan of mac and cheese for another soupy pan of mac and cheese! The kitchen manager saw me see this. I said, "that pan is just as watery as THIS pan." Then the other kitchen manager explained, "we changed vendors and that's how the mac and cheese comes to us." Wow. I put some on a plate a took a photo of it. I've never seen anything like it. I can't imagine why they thought serving such slop was acceptable and that no one would notice. The food was nothing to rave about and certainly not good enough for me to become a regular diner there. The spaghetti and sauce was comparable to something you'd fine in a really bad cafeteria. Finally, if I do return (which I'm not sure I will), I certainly will steer clear of their prepacked, over cooked, watery mac and cheese.

Wow.  Never thought the day would come when I would review a Golden Corral.  However this past glorious Sunday my WT family, when told they could pick ANYWHERE they wanted to go for lunch, no need to worry about the tab, they picked the GC.   This was my first experience with this place. I've only done buffets in Vegas.   Currently my doctor has me on a strict Vegan diet, so I already knew I was in for it with selection food wise.   I was excited to see the spinach and green beans, and then disappointed when I saw they were loaded with ham or bacon. Wah wah.   I had some very water logged Brussels sprouts. Some steamed carrots. Pears and beets that for sure came out of a can. Some french fries and a wheat roll.   When Our waitress sat us, I asked her if any of the rolls were vegan. I got a blank stare and then the "I don't know what you are talking about" response. I explained to her what vegan was, she then pointed to the bakery area and told me I would have to flag down one of the bakers if I wanted to know what was in the rolls. So I did, and the baker was very friendly and pointed out to options I could have. Score!   Our waitress was really very friendly and came by the table often.   This was for sure not a place for me. Its all institutional food, boiled and over cooked beyond belief.

A glorified Hometown Buffet with surprisingly attentive service.  Things you can do here: -------------------------------- * Check out the choco fondue and cotton candy machine * Eat the larger fried shrimp nearer to the Salad bar, than the popcorn shrimp found with the rest of the seafood selection * Sit on the left side of the entrance if you have bladder problems * Stuff yourself so much you can't grab Half & Half afterwards * Celebrate your birdday here -- practically every table was doing it! * Marvel at how packed the large restaurant is, and question whether the economy really is in a recession currently  Things to skip here: -------------------------- * Haggle out of paying full priced $11.79 weekday dinners (+$0.20 on weekends) * The Sirloin steaks -- I thought I was gnawing on a thick slab of beef jerky with a smokey aroma * Expecting home-cooked, baked-from-scratch food -- The clam chowder tasted like it was heated straight out of a Campbell's can  Glad I got to try this buffet, but not a place I would particularly go out of my way for. The price is cheap, but I can better utilize $12 on the plenty of restaurants with better tasting food, made with higher-quality ingredients, with tummy room to breathe.

I would give this place zero stars if it were an option. This is the filthiest place I've ever been. The women's bathroom was disgusting, the toilet in the handicap stall wasn't even attached to the floor and made the entire restroom smell like raw sewage. The dishes were dirty, I had to go through 7 soup bowls before I found a clean one, same for the plates. The grill cooks don't know how to cook a steak, the gave my husband one that was completely raw, he asked for medium rare. When my husband bright the steak up to be remade, the guy behind the grill gave my husband attitude and started getting really nasty. At this point we spoke to the manager, she got rude with me when I told her what had happened and assumed we just wanted a free meal. I told her we hadn't even been there for 15 minutes. By then we were so disgusted, we didn't even want to eat there. She ended up refunding us and we left. I ended up playing it safe and cooking at home. Be warned, eat here at your own risk!

We ate here a couple years ago, and it was really good. However, in october, we stopped here to eat dinner on our way back home from Ohio. It was HORRIBLE.... It was dirty, the food wasn't good, and they were unable to keep up with restocking food on the buffet. It reminded me how the Ponderosa in Altoona was before it went out of business

Food was good until I found a bug crawling on the table. My appetite is gone. Talk to Monica(supervisor). She said nothing she can do about it because the kids were already eating desserts. Which I was still eating my food. She was very rude about it. And I would not be coming back!

I had Golden Corral for the first time today - my boyfriend was determined to have a buffet for new years eve before his new years resolution kicks in. It wasn't bad but it really wasn't great.  Good: 1. The bread rolls and honey spread were AMAZING. I dare say they're as good as the rolls at Olive Garden, even though the ones at Olive Garden taste like they're healthier. These rolls were oozing with butter but they tasted heavenly. 2. The price for a lunch buffet is really good. It was only $17 for the two of us for all you can eat. Drinks are extra, but we just got water. 3. I read some of the other reviews saying that there was bad service, but our waitress was really friendly and helpful.  Bad: The food is decidedly meh. There's a good selection, but it's not very good quality and didn't taste that good. The vegetables at the salad bar look like they were dumped out from a bad of defrosted frozen vegetables. All the fruit looked canned. Most of the meat dishes were overdone and dry. No wonder they can charge so little.  If you're not picky and want to just eat a lot for not a lot of money, then this is great for you. But if you're looking for a culinary experience...then neah.

Pointless. If you want a "Stations" casino buffet, come here. Old, watery food, dirty old plates. There were a lot of people there for dinner who all had similar facial expressions as mine. Not a good choice by any means, won't ever waste my money here again.

Ok guys, brace yourself. I did not have a good experience here! I know I'm shocked too. Here is the breakdown:  Positive: The cashier at the entrance was super nice and explained how this place worked. If I was rating them on her customer service it would have been 5 stars. Our server(?) was also great, a bit absent at times but no real problems!  Negative: Here we go, and btw I don't ever want to leave negative things but it is what it is. First, The other patrons were mean and down right nasty, apparently they were under the assumption when something is empty it will not be refilled. In case you don't know it's a buffet. Second: Once I was done letting all the OG's from the nursing home get there food, the food I got was tasteless, mislabeled, and to add insult to injury really not good at all. Third and lastly, I made it 2 hours before everything I ate came back up. Don't recommend, best of luck if you go there!

Had breakfast there this Sunday morning and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Arrived just after it opened, expecting a long line, but we got right in. Everything was clean and fresh.  The scrambled eggs were actually moist and delicious.  Every tray of food looked as fresh as if it had JUST been put out, although some were already half empty. The kitchen was working hard to keep the trays stocked as they got close to being empty.  The steam tables were sparkling clean, and the plates and silverware were, too. Our server was quite attentive...refilling our coffee even before we had a chance to finish the cup.  She noticed my milk was 2/3rds gone and asked if I wanted another.   My only "con" is that the recipes for a few of their items (i.e. chipped beef on toast, and gravy for biscuits) are rather tasteless, but there are enough other options available that it is not a problem to skip those few bland items.  I do wish these buffets would not water down their fruit juices so much. Really takes the enjoyment (and taste) out of having a glass of orange juice with breakfast.  Otherwise, I would recommend this location to anyone in the mood for a decent buffet meal.  Kudos for a shop well run.

We love Golden Coral.  We used to eat at the Surprise,AZ location all the time. After we moved, we decided to try a closer location - on W. Thomas. ZERO STARS HERE... Never again will we eat there.  The place was filthy. Food all over the carpet, sticky tables, stuck-on food all around the steam table trays,empty salt and pepper shakers,  and extremely rude employees. We stopped in around 7pm, so there was still plenty of time before they closed. The steam trays were almost empty - all of them -- and what was still there was over-cooked, dried-out, stuck-on globs of yuck.  Nobody seemed concerned about re-stocking (I guess because there was still a tablespoon or two of food permanently crusted onto the trays, so technically they were not yet empty). What little we managed to salvage to put on our plate was disgusting. How can anyone ruin canned corn?!?    To make matters worse, we had to look hard to find a clean plate - through several of them before we were successful.  The silverware was the same.  We pulled several of each utensil before finding one without food stuck to it. When we showed this to the server, she just shrugged her shoulders and walked away. She didn't even take the dirty plates/silver with her.    The table next to us had several people of various ages...one in a high-chair, twin toddlers in diapers,one young child, mom, and grandma.  There was food all over the place.  (Parents, if you take your children out to eat, PLEASE teach them some manners.  It is NOT appropriate to continually throw food on the floor, and it is DEFINITELY not cool to drop cotton candy on the floor, then pick it up and continue to eat it!!).  Anyway....after they left, the mess was huge.  The server removed the dishes, etc, then swept the chunks of food ONTO THE CARPET instead of onto one of the dirty dishes. After taking the dishes to the back, she returned, wiped off the chairs, and then WITH THE SAME CLOTH, wiped off the table.  EXCUSE ME.  You just had 2 toddlers in diapers (and no other bottoms)(and I can attest to the fact that at least one had a lumpy, dirty diaper!), sitting on that chair.  You wiped it with a dish cloth, and then used that same dish cloth to wipe off the surface of the table, where we put our silverware and food?!?  Are you insane?!?  If you don't have the sense to use two different cloths, at lease please wipe off the table with a clean cloth first, THEN the seats...and then GET A NEW CLEAN CLOTH before you wipe down the next table.  She never did return to clean the food off the floor. When we left we had to be careful not to step into any of it or we probably would have slipped and ended up sitting on the floor!  My recommendation - avoid this location unless you are starving and nothing else is open.  We still prefer the Surprise, AZ location, or the Northern Ave,PHX location. Both of them are clean, well stocked, and the people are extremely nice.

OMG i love this place!!!!!!!!!!!!! third times the charm!! we have been trying to come to this place for the past few weeks lol this was out third and final try! we came at lunch time on a friday afternoon. all together with drinks it came out to about $20. i absolutely love that you can see the cooks there doing their thing!! the mini steak burgers were amazing! the salad bar was full of fresh veggies! their fried chicken was ok..toooo moist for my taste(not that i like dry chicken lol) i didnt get a chance to try everything, obviously, who does at a buffet with so many items to choose from!  out "waitress" was super nice and very attentive! the desserts were amazing as well! i got soft served ice cream with brownies and peach cobbler lol. i left this place feeling full, but not over stuffed, suprisingly lol   i will definetly be back! but not on weekends cause the lines are waaay too long!

Hands down the best American buffet under $15-and I eat A LOT of buffets... from Korean bbq to Chinese buffet to Wynn in Vegas!  And no... im not fat.  Just watch for the lines-often, they are 30+ minutes long!

Logistics: Came around 11am on Sunday with a party of 7. The line was out the door and onto the asphalt of the parking lot. 50 minute wait. The line got even longer as we waited. Crowded, hectic and large restaurant. Clean bathrooms. Good for large parties. Didn't have problem with parking.  Food: Almost everything I had was below average. For example, the orange chicken at panda express is better than golden corral. The person cooking the steaks was an amateur. Salad and fruit wasn't as fresh as souplantation. The only decent things I had was the pot roast, chicken wings, wheat buns and cookies and cream ice cream. A lot of their foods have trans fat. That is unacceptable. I made a list from the nutrition facts on their website and avoided those foods.  Service: Good and frequent. There was always a few people asking us what we wanted to drink. I prefer if they just have the soda machines out and we can help ourselves.   Overall: I won't be coming back. Similar to home town and debatable which one has better quality. I'll stick with souplantation. We paid 13 per person and the value wasn't there. Don't understand why this place is so popular. The trans fat part really bothered me.
Food is good but the place is dirty it has this werid smell like a musty smell.and children are all over the place without an adult touching food.

Omg it was so dirty I did not eat.... chicken on floor people were crackheads there forks were dirty.... carpet filthy don't go here I refused to eat it was so nasty the worst and dirtiest restaurant I have ever been in!! Disgraced go to old country buffet 1000 times better and cleaner

I love just about every buffet known to man but you couldn't drag me back here even if the food was free. The restaurant is dirty and the food is lousy. I've never been to another Golden Corral (although I've been to this location 3x) to know if this is par for the course but this place is just plain nasty.

We came in to eat, picked up some fried shrimp and cocktail sauce. I ate a couple then I noticed a thin Brown hair covered in grease on the plate which obviously came from the fried shrimp. I waved down a waiter who I showed the hair to. She showed it to a cook who saw it, who handed it off to another cook. They took it to the manager who came out with the plate with the hair now removed from the plate after 4 people handling my food. She stated it must have flown off the plate because she couldn't see it anymore. They said they would remove the items from the buffet. They never did. After deciding to stay anyways and try to enjoy my meal, I went to the salad bar. When I went to get the ranch for my salad, there was a dead fly in the ranch. They never apologized, just removed the ranch and gave me a new container of ranch to dish from. I don't think I will be visiting this location again.

The food was good and very reasonably priced. However, it is not so good that it warrants a 1 hour wait. When the line stretches out the door and around the block, I go elsewhere.   Guess what?!!! There is a Souplantation about a block away!

This is located on the east side, near Charleston and Lamb, near the Home Depot, so you may see some day workers there. (Just a warning, maybe some of you have not seen that yet.) Large parking lot. You pay before entering the dining area. You sit where you choose. Lots of tables and booths too. We came for breakfast.  Ok, it was better than I expected, but because of reviews here (average 3 star rating) and what I had heard from many other people who've been before, I didn't have high expectations (although my in-laws like it, but they don't dine out a whole lot, either). I can best liken it to a typical casino buffet, except with a chocolate dipping fountain. We went for breakfast on sunday, and it was rather empty at the beginning, but I did notice many patrons were of the bigger set (sorry, I am being honest). Towards the end as we were leaving, there were more and more people.  I didn't eat the mexican food or salad bar (pretty decent selection) because I didn't feel like it that morning. I am pretty picky at these types of buffets anyway (asian buffets included). I had the biscuit and gravy (don't get the ones sitting on the trays, rather get the ones laying on top of other biscuits; I didn't eat the bottom layer because it was tough). I also had the hash, eggs, a third of my husband's made-to-order omelette (that was good, but tends to be a little greasy), and a fried egg that my MIL gave me (they also do fried eggs, that is neat!). Our son had the ham and banana nut french toast with strawberry syrup. I don't know why there was no regular syrup option; all I found was the sugar-free bottles of syrup. Hubby had the potatoes, said it was really good, but the omelette was the best thing there (except the onions and peppers were pre-cooked and greasy). There is a dessert station: bananas, box cereal- two choices, rice crispie treats- cubes, mini carrot cake muffins, and hand-dipped ice cream. At 10:30 am, the macaroons were taken out. (Certain items get released at certain times.)  Juice (clear cups) is included- Minute Maid Apple Juice, Orange, Passion Orange Guava (POG), and another one but can't recall it right now as I am writing up this review. Red cups are for water.   The service was really good. The empty plates were taken away pretty fast. The plates and utensils were filled up pretty good. The tables were clean and I noticed that the vacated tables were getting attention pretty quick.

Oh, Golden Corral. I used to eat at you when I was a kid and you were in Fresno. I loved your pizza and rolls.   The boyfriend and I went here last night... we toughed it out and waited for 45 minutes. It was well worth the wait, if you're looking for a buffet. The price is actually really decent, especially when it is 2 for $20. There are a lot of choices, from stir fry to steak (cooked to order) to pot roast (holy cow- to die for) to cotton candy to orange chicken to pasta... pretty much something for everyone. WAY better than any buffet I have ever been to. My favorites were the steak, ham and pot roast. Least favorites were the bourbon chicken and the peach cobbler.   The service is great too. Once seated, our waitress came and chatted with us a bit and was on top of refilling our drinks and taking our plates the entire night.   A lot of people have a problem with the setup of the place, especially the whole wait in line- get your drink- pay- get seated thing... it really wasn't that bad. Actually, with how attentive the wait staff was, not being able to refill your own drinks wasn't an issue at all. And the line, especially near the registers, IS hectic... but only because it's really crowded and busy right now. I'm assuming that will die down and it will be a lot easier to handle.   Hopefully the newness wears off and the line gets shorter- but hopefully the amazing service and food quality stays!

Super packed with kids running around without supervision... not the restaurants fault, but still affects my experience.  Besides that, every piece of food I tried was pretty good.  At buffets, I'm a one-scooper so I get to try everything I want.  The price was decent for a buffet selection like this, service was good, and I can't complain about anything else.

The selection of food was lacking Wednesday night. The only meat they had on the carving board was a huge ham and it looked dry. I didn't dare try it. There were no jumbo shrimp or any of the prime rib and hardly any other beef choices.It was all mainly chicken aside from one beef roast. I was very disappointed.For the price we paid I expected more. In retrospect the salad bar part of the buffet was extremely good and so was the dessert bar. The service was very slack hence the 2 and not 3 star rating.

This was my first time ever visiting Golden Corral, I kinda lost the meaning of buffet coming here. Not to mention the trips to the bathroom after eating here. Very upset this Golden Corral was so nasty! The poor over worked waiters I pray for you all. It was like eating in a filthy kitchen disgusting for $80.00. Had to leave early all five of us got sick and parents learn to fix your children food. Family restaurant was like an all you can eat at a welfare office only thing missing was security.

Good variety of foods and good service.Long lines and drinks are not self serve after the first time.Everything tasted good.I especially loved the rotissire chicken,wok area,and the ice cream that they offer.Definitely be back in the near future. I thing that bothered me was the glass that covered the food was so big its hard for tall people to grab the back food!

Gross, gross, gross, gross, gross!!!   Poor quality, though I thought it was really cool that they had a chocolate fountain and cotton candy. However, even those were really disgusting...   I didn't really like anything. Food quality is the same as home town. I really don't know how people are saying it's better... I could make better food at home..   Line is ridiculous. Please go during an weird hour if you really, really want to try this place (like I did..) because you will be extremely furious to have waited two hours to eat this mediocre crap.   The only thing that made me happy here was that there was a birthday and the guy leading the staff into singing happy birthday accidently announced it was home town buffet about three times before getting it right. LOLOL.

The wife and I came here for the first time this evening and I just say I was pleasantly  surprised ! My expectations were pretty low when we thought about coming here.   First off the wait staff is pretty amazing !  They kept that place pretty clean considering the mob of people's coming in !  The wait staff were all friendly and accommodating  !   You get three stars because  The bathrooms were absolutely disgusting !  The wait staff was amazing  The different areas to get food were all up kept very well!  The only area in disarray would be the desserts area to get dessert. but I am giving some leniency since there was like four or five birthday party's happening all around the area we were sitting !  All with young kids !   I probably would have only gave two stars but the waitstaff was just so amazing and exceeded my expectations ! Of all you can eat Buffett'!

the lunch buffet is very cheap! food quality is whatevers; you pay for what you get.  there are many selections and varieties. this place is very chaotic and busy,  service was pretty good; friendly staff members. i personally prefer golden corral  than hometown buffet mainly because of the price, and quality of food is also similar.

I love buffets, and I was excited for this one, but it was crap.  Cons -They don't have the bbq wings they're currently advertising, which was the whole reason we went there. We went during dinner hours, when the website says they have them, but they didn't. I asked if they were going to bring them out, and they said no.  -Girlfriend tried getting a well-done steak. The guy kept telling her to come back in 5 more minutes, which she did 5 times before we left without ever getting it.  -We had to wait in line for an hour and 20 minutes.  -The food was a slight step up from Hometown Buffet, but there wasn't much that you couldn't buy out of a box at Walmart.  -Total cost for both of us was $30 (2 buffets + 1 drink + tax) We should have just gone to Wingstop, where $30 would have bought us more than all we could eat, plus sides and dessert.   Pros -If you like steak (but not well-done) you might be able to get your money's worth here.

Endless seafood buffet!!!  That is all.  No really, why do I keep yelping up chains? Because they are very interesting to me, especially the ones that are packed to the brim like this one, and all for only $9.99! Everything you can imagine. There is so much food to try that you can't even get to the desserts.   Also, I am kind of surprised by the dummy down below who expects plates to be handed to him. Its a buffet asswipe, get a clue. However, the one thing I will mention that differed from the one i went to in Florida...you have to seat yourself. Ok, pretty easy right? No, not when its packed. It would be nice if they had peeps keeping tracking of where the open tables are at. Oh but one thing I did like was the self serve bread because there were like 10 different kinds to choose from.  Now, carry on.

Racist against white people. Wouldn't give us another piece of steak and just shook their heads. When the guys behind us got their second round, it wasn't a problem. Them being the same race couldn't be a coincidence. We were polite and everything. I will never give them another cent.

I always see their commercials on tv and always hear people raving about them...so we gave in, and decided to go with the crowd.  First of all pricing, is no great feat. at $11.99 + $1.99(Drink) you are looking at the same price as a buffet at one of the casinos... We knew this going in but people said that it was "Southern Comfort Food" so we should try it.   Everything that they have at this buffet, except the chocolate fountains, is found at any other buffet in Las Vegas... for a better price and quality as well.... Their food is typical of a regular buffet and besides their chocolate fountains, nothing stands out.   You seat yourself during the slow periods and then get seated during busy times. Alot of their items were out as well throughout the buffet including their deviled eggs and the pizza was empty every time we got up to get some.   At least at a casino buffet, they refill everything right away. And the service is way better. The waiters here are so overworked that they tend to ignore tables, not their fault though.  Will I come back? No, honestly, but they seemed VERY busy so obviously I may be missing something here....

TLDR: good food, good service, customers from hell. To me, Golden Corral is a miraculous place. I'm German so this buffet is a great opportunity for me to try some classic American dishes (my fiance says these dishes are of course not comparable to real home-cooked typical American dishes, but I think most of what I tried was pretty tasty). There are some things that I enjoy a lot (chicken noodle soup, collard greens, the entire dessert buffet) and some I wouldn't eat again if you'd pay me (marshmallow covered sweet potatoes, seriously people... that's an abomination!).  Overall, the selection and taste is definitely decent for the price.  What I don't enjoy too much about GC is these horribly colored plastic plates. Any food looks a lot less appealing when it sits on an ugly blue plate full of scratches. But that is a minor thing to me.  What really bothers me though are the other costumers. I won't take off a star for it because it's not GC's fault but I will rant:  If you take your kids to a buffet instruct them to keep their fingers out of the food. If they're not old or willing enough to fill their own plates without causing a huge mess then fill their plates for them.   Don't let your kids eat so much that they throw up right in the restaurant between other people eating. Happened twice under the eyes of my family, they were not amused, as well as the other costumers.  Dear old people, we all know you love hard candy for whatever reason, but stuffing your pockets with spoonfuls of hard candy from the dessert bar, come on....   The buffet is regularly stacked again, so there is no need to revive the good ol' days of the Great Depression and fight over the last pieces of fried chicken. Nobody will starve right here at Golden Corral, I promise.  You don't cough over the food while you spoon it onto your plate. Yes, that's not the kids who do that, it's the adults who apparently forget their manners while greedily grabbing as many bread rolls as they can possibly carry.  So, I'll come back again, and if it's just to judge the other customers with a smug look on my face while I enjoy my collard greens.

Saturday night at the Corral! YEAH! The only other one I've been to was in Missouri five years ago and I remember smuggling the honey buns back to Cali. It's worth the money and wait. It's the hometown buffet crowd with a cheaper version of a high end Vegas buffet. A buffet with steak and steak burgers is worth stopping at. Check it out if you're in the area because these are few and far between in Cali.

I came in here expecting very little and I was pleasantly surprised. If I had to choose between Sizzler and Golden Corral, I'd go with GC. The food is NOT top quality, but it's not really cheap either. The only thing that I can say I really don't like, is the line to get in. If you come at the wrong time, you feel like you're in line for Space Mountain. (You know where you hate waiting, but you know that when you get to the front of the line, you'll be happy you waited.)  Anyhow, they have your basic buffet set-up: Asian, Mexican, Seafood, Salads, Desserts, yadda yadda. The one thing that everyone seems to love, not moi, is that you can get cotton candy. I don't understand the fascination. Maybe it's because you only seem to get it when you're at a fair, or a ball game, so it makes it seem "special."  If you decide to go, remember that they switch to dinner pricing at 4pm. So, I would get there around 3:30 so that you can still gets lunch pricing, but be able to partake in their dinner buffet. That pretty much means steak!

Something tells me that if you don't speak Spanish you're not welcome here and it's interesting how the employees stare at you,  if you get any food from the buffet. I asked the manager why she had all the containers on the salad bar off of the salad bar and she said that that's what they normally do. I explained that I counted at least 10 containers out of chiller and it didn't seem to be a concern of hers. However she did advise me that they'll be closing down the salad bar and if I already had my plate. Maybe I misunderstanding the term buffet. I won't be coming here again.

Where to start?  Maybe it's because we went there for brunch. The place feels like the old buffets in Vegas, with drab decor and extra large and above clientele. There are a few edible items but most are just average or below. Even the fruit taste just okay. Not fresh and juicy. At least it's dirt cheap at less than $10 for adult sans the carbonated drinks.  I think the main draw is just the cheapness.

I came here on a Tuesday afternoon before a holiday at 4pm. There was no line outside of the building, but crowded inside. I would believe this is equivalent as Hometown Buffet. I left around 6pm, there were a lot less people eat and pretty much no line.   When I go up to get steak, I've always gotten a small piece with the fatty parts. One time I asked for medium rare, and gotten a piece that was straight up raw. I saw a lot of people going for the mac and cheese. I believed that it was going to be good, so I got myself a good serving, and a small portion of that was cold.  I'd probably come here again if there wasn't a line.
Food is disgusting and all tastes the same. Not clean but our server was very nice. We came on sunday at 11am. GO TO 711 INSTEAD! Save yourself 15 bucks
I love this Golden Corral it has great food and GREAT steak the people there are so nice and responsible. I definitely recommend this place to go eat. And I will totally come back!

This was only my second time visiting a Golden Corral and I must say, this time I was much more impressed so I am glad that I waited to do my review. The restaurant itself was very clean and the staff was attentive. The idea of Golden Corral is super simple; you walk in, pay, grab a drink. pick your own seat, and go to the buffet. Super easy! There is no hassle in between of waiting to be seated or waiting for a drink or paying after. When you are done eating, you leave which is nice. There is essentially no waiting on anybody and when you are starving like we were, that is soooo nice!  The buffet is pretty extensive. They have everything from seafood, to meats, to salad, to soup, to chicken/tuna salads, to mexican, to I think you get the idea! Pretty much anything you are in the mood for, you can find here. The food seemed to be very fresh and I saw the staff switching out food often to keep it that way. There was almost too much to choose from. That's always my problem when I go to buffets, I fill up so fast that I can't enjoy everything! Such a dilemma! haha The dessert bar was something to note!! Not only did they have ice cream (soft and hard) but they also had a chocolate fondue fountain!!!! It cant get better than that! There were soooo many more desserts as well: pie, cake, cookies, brownies, etc. Again, another problem I face when I go to buffets, I NEVER have enough room for all the dessert. It's making me want to go back there right now just for the dessert.   Cant wait to go back and fill my belly again!

For your own sake and your family's sake, please do not attempt to visit this Golden Corral Restaurant!  By far the absolute worst Golden Corral I've ever been to!  And to think I gave them my hard earned money to feed my family of four what amounted to table scraps that I'd be hesitant to give my begging dog!  The selection of food that was offered at the buffet was 20% full at best...and the 20% that was offered was dried out.  Several customers asked the manager (who was also grilling) if he would be filling up the buffet soon and he made some wise-ass remark about taking a while to complete the task.  He spoke to us as he was flipping 8 sliders on the grill for the 40+ customers in the building at the time.  When the sliders were done, two customers barged in and snagged them up!  That was it for the food for the day!  The manager provided us with one bucket of mashed potatoes to go along with our dried out chicken and okra!  Oh, I did see corn, dinner rolls and some pizza available.  We waited over an hour there and no new food provided! I had my greasy spoon and dirty fork ready, but the food never came out! What I did eat, exited my body very quickly after I left the building!  Don't even get me started about the men's bathroom!  Stall #1 was a biohazard!  FEMA should have been called in ASAP!  No toilet paper and water all over the floor (thus having to leave the building).  Behind the salad bar, one employee was pumping yellowish sludge out of what looked like a backed up washer.  The poor waitresses avoided eye contact for the most part because they knew what a dump the place is!  Golden Corral should just condemn their own place.

this is a great place to take young kids. Tues is family night and kids buffet is cheaper. Now this is exactly what you should expect, cafeteria food and lots of it. now the salad bar i love the new england clam chowder has always been good steaks are tasty but tough cuts of meats yeast rolls are the bomb fresh mac n cheese is ok mashed potatoes are real potates and i prefer the brown gravy on it what I like about this is you can just go get one bite of everything and then go back for what you like  the desserts are plentiful in options and supply. i dont like the ice milk instead of ice CREAM and that new chocolate fountain is entertaing but I found the choclate to be gritty like maybe made from a powder
Dis.gus.ting. I'm still sick to my stomach a day after.

The service was excellent thank you Big Te for taking such good care of us! The food was amazing and they had hot fudge!!!! The only issues we had were the first dinner rolls we had were hard on the bottom and the mashed potatoes were to thin other than that everything was amazing! The restaurant was clean even with the amount of customers and the managers were assisting with cleanup! Two thumbs up!!!!

Had a great courtesy meal due to Veteran's Day. The steak was excellent.   I've been here on other occasions too. And it is one of the better buffet restaurants in town. I like this place better than Old Country buffet.

To echo the previous reviewers, now I know that I was right to trust my instinct and have not been inside a Golden Coral Buffet until yesterday. At first when you walk in, you feel like you are in for a treat. Don't let the varieties fool you. The food is absolutely bland, tasteless and poorly prepared. Do you remember what your college cafeteria's buffet style food taste like? This is just like it. Out of all the options, there were only two things that I actually liked, their strawberry shortcake and their yeast rolls...even the yeast rolls are a bit strange, who wants honey on their rolls? If you are like me, looking for the butter, you won't find any, apparently it's a golden coral thing to have honey rolls.  If you try to get soup, they will all be so salty that you might as well have drank ocean water, other than that ocean water is poisonous but the soup here may as well be because you can't drink them anyway. The lasagna is so hard it is like a brick. To quote what my cousin literally said after he took a bite from his lasagna, "oh man this tastes like crap". My tortilla chips were pretty terrible, nothing but grease, no flavor no texture. Sautee mushroom too salty again and was cooked in pure fat.   Service-wise, pretty poor. You have to pay upfront before you eat, the lady at the cashier was quite rude. She is kind of slow and she gave us one less drinks than we paid for...We asked her for an extra drink, not only were she not apologetic, she even had an attitude. Way to go Golden Coral for putting someone like that as the first person your customers will encounter at your restaurant.   As  for the staffs who comes around to pick up your used buffet plates, they try. However, they need to be a bit more strategic. For the hour or so that I was dining at the restaurant, I heard at least 5 or 6 times where the staffs dropped plates or cups and spilled ice and drink on the floor. They also look like they are overwhelmed with plates by carrying way too many at a time.   The bathrooms needs extreme attention, it really smells bad in there. Maybe this is their way of making sure customers leave asap and not stick around for long.

Ichhhhh. Won't give it even one star. Steak - which came straight off the grill was COLD. Waaaaaay overpriced for the quality and the place is just dirty.  The waitress rocked.  Does that make it worth $33. for 2 seniors? I think not ever again...

I'd like to start this review with a disclaimer: I hate buffets! They usually cost as much, If not more, than a traditional restaurant and the food is usually nasty. With that said, this golden corral was pleasantly different. The food was actually really good. Does it compare to an outback or lone star? Not even close, but for a buffet it was the best I've had yet (I would still prefer going to outback if given the choice). My family and I went on a Sunday and it was very packed - good sign. The buffet was vast with a ton of options. Nice salad bar. An amazing side dish selection with a lot of vegetables and several meat choices. I recommend giving this one a try.

We decided on Golden Corral for Easter this year as there were only 3 of us and it made more sense financially. We've been here in the past on holidays and have always had a pleasant experience. Today we showed up around 1pm and walked into disorganized chaos! The line wasn't too crazy, but there were people coming in from every direction and blocking the walk ways for other patrons who were trying to leave. After about 20 minutes of standing in line, the manager came out and started yelling directions at patrons who were already crowded in the lobby to "form one line." Many of which, I'm sure, didn't budge because they didn't want to lose their place in line.The way she was shouting, no one was listening to her. Based on the fact that it was a holiday, perhaps she should've figured out a game plan BEFORE people started showing up as they've done in the past. This manager was no better when we were waiting for a table either. As the hostess was taking us to our booth, she pushed through and told her that we couldn't sit there because she was accommodating someone else. 5 minutes later, the manager let us sit there anyway. No one looked happy except for the woman getting drinks when you come in and the gentlemen cooking the steaks--which were tender and flavored well! After today, we may have to rethink where we go on our next holiday outing as we about lost our appetite before getting to our table thanks to the poor attitude of your manager on duty today. It takes a good leader to run a team, but she is not the type of leader I would want for myself.

Golden Corral has graced Las Vegas with its mediocre buffet in a city that is known for every casino, on just about every block, that has.... a buffet.  My husband and I decided to throw in the towel and try this place out. After months of seeing the parking lot full to the brim and lines out the door, we saw it wasn't TOO busy on a Saturday afternoon.  First impressions: You get your beverage before you pay, you are herded into the establishment like cattle, and lo and behold... you enter complete and utter MADNESS.  Pros - Selection is decent. Desserts are plentiful  Cons - Food is mediocre, the place is too small, and it is a mad-house.   Apparently the Golden Corral does not do a good job telling its guests to corral their CHILDREN. Although there are signs posted that say, "Children must be accompanied by adults at all times.", this suggestion is thrown out the window. Children run rampant in here without parental supervision, knocking into people, plowing their way into buffet lines. The adults here aren't any better. There's no rhyme or reason to how people get their food, there's no lines to speak of. It's an all-out brawl fest -- almost.  Cleanliness is an issue. My husband and I searched for a table and could not find a decently cleaned one, we had to wipe one down and remove dirty napkins just so we could have a place to eat. We also watched as a family with two small infants allows these children to sloppily plow through food and fling said food all over the floor - it was gross.  Overall - never again.

Food was ok. Waitresses were nice. The place is just dirty. Youngstown has an awesome one with more choices. But, this one needs attention. If you go, sit in Lois's section. She will take care of you!

As far as buffets are concerned, I really haven't done a lot of buffets out of Asian buffets, so I'm not sure how American buffets are.  They had a wide selection of foods, which I will give that a 4 star.  They should probably take down some signs that say there are certain types of foods, but aren't.  As for cleanliness of the restroom and the eating area, I would give it pretty much a 1 star.  If someone spills something, get someone to clean it up.  They did not look short staffed at all.  It seems that cleanliness is a huge problem as we would see spills throughout the restaurant.  We were at the far east end and the restrooms were in the far west end.  As I walked from one end to the other, it wasn't just one spill, but probably more than a half dozen.  Come on.  The bathroom was literally gross, but I had to go.  I've seen restrooms at gas stations or at rest areas much cleaner than this place.  Actually restrooms at most Asian places, which sometimes it's not so great, were much cleaner and better than at least the lady's restroom.  I'm guessing the men's would be worse.  And, as people ate and left their plates to be picked up, it wasn't just our tables, but all the surrounding tables, the waitress wouldn't pick up the plates or clean up tables of people that had already left.  To the east of us, those people left more than 15 minutes before we left and the waitress (Casandra) never cleaned up their table or no bus person to do it.  However, Casandra did come and ask us during our probably 1.5 hrs there (this included my mom and 4 families with spouses and kids, a party of 17.  We're not slobs.  I don't know how many times she asked how things were, but she never took action of picking up our plates in a timely manner or refilling our waters.  It's not like we were camels and sucking up the water.  Then, the table to the west of us that had maybe 6-8 people, they left for probably half hour and Casandra never picked up or cleaned their table.  So we were surrounded by empty tables of plates piled high with dirty stuff all around.    So, for the waitressing service, I give it a 1 star, but because the guy doing the steaks was good and friendly, I would give him a 4 star.  Hopefully the other wait staff is much better.  Casandra was friendly, but she wasn't doing anything much other than continually in an annoying frequency asking how we were doing.  My mom always leaves a great tip, but even my mom was annoyed at the lack of good waitressing service and took back a part of a tip.  Honestly, at the Asian buffets we go to, they may not be the friendliest, but at least they keep removing unwanted dishes, filling our waters, keeping the place clean so we can keep eating.    The food was okay, mainly American stuff or Gringo styled ethnic foods.  So, I would give this a 4 star.  I'm probably being generous in giving this place a 3 star, but the next time my family recommends this, we'll pass.  I'd rather just go to McDonald's.  And, what's the deal with having all the drinks at the cash register?  Why don't you just have a drink dispenser out with the rest of the stuff like Sweet Tomatoes has?

This place is so gross . I remember going to Golden Corral as a kid with the entire family and it used to be a good quality meal . Now everything seems like it's been sitting for hours , but what's really causing me to give this place a one star review is that I'm very convinced that there is something the restaurant puts in the food to make you feel fuller faster.  I had an upset stomach for hours after I ate here and felt extremely bloated ! I always eat pretty clean , and decided to go here because they have a variety of healthy choices so after feeling the way I do , this will be the last time I go here ! However if you're up for some low quality food and don't care about what you put in your body , this is a great place ;)
Great breakfast and what I liked about it the most is they had lunch stuff like fried chicken and pot roast and chili and our server was great his name is Joe

This location was awesome the first few years after it was open.  I'm sad to say, I will not be eating there again.  It was dirty, the food was not as good.  It attracts a seedy clientele and is just not kept up to the good standards it once had.  The barbecue chicken was awful.  I used to love their recipe!!  What happened, GC???  All the while, their prices are way higher.  Save your money and go elsewhere.

This is the best Golden Corral we have ever been to and we have lived and traveled all over the United States. The staff is extremely attentive and friendly and the manager always has a smile on his face. The food is always cooked to perfection and I have to give special attention to the guy that works on the grill and the lady that takes care of the salad bar. They are amazing at what they do. Love Love Love this location. Only thing I wish they offered that they don't is diet Dr. Pepper. Not enough Diet soda options.

I finally tried this place one evening. The line was long. I had high expectations for this place, but sadly was disappointed. The food didn't please my palate. Perhaps I've been spoiled by Asian buffets. Even though we were seated near the chocolate fountain, I didn't dare eat from it. There were just so many people. Just too many people for my comfort and I felt a bit dirty eating there. Both adults and kids are so messy dripping or dropping food on the floor. The staff were quick to clean up any messes. The quality of the food was ok, almost like hometown.  I liked the strawberries because they were very sweet and I ate them by itself. Most of the stuff I tried was ok. Perhaps I would give this place a try again in the future, but at lunch time. Going there for dinner is expensive.

Since there is only one here in Las Vegas, you have to plan ahead to dine here. The lines to dine here are usually long but the food makes it worth while waiting.  The staff that work here are very assertive and friendly.  Server named Irene is a joy to be reckoned with, her killer smile and professionalism makes me want to come back.  I recommend anyone to come dine here, just plan ahead before coming

It's cheap boring buffet food.  If you are looking for Las Vegas style presentation, you are not going to find it here.  Good deal for breakfast.  I mean how wrong can you go with eggs and potatoes right?  Lunch and dinner is mediocre.  Most of the food they serve are tasteless commercially produced food.  It's like one or two steps above Hometown Buffet.  Save your money and go across the street to Chili's for better food.  Even better idea, just go to Costco down the street and grab few hot dogs and a large pizza for a total bargain.
Like every other one. But this one has a great friendly staff.  That makes you want to come back sit down at the table again and again and again.

DISGUSTING!  After waiting for an hour, we finally arrived near the end of the line where I can grab my strawberry soda. After paying my cheap admission price of ~$12, I was eager to start my dinner with hopes it would be decent given all the hype.   10 minutes later, I ate raw canned corn which were half cooked, a piece of steak that was rock solid when suppose to be medium rare, chow mein which tastes far from even mein, and lukewarm broccoli. It made me really appreciate the other bad buffets I have been too. This is by far the worst buffet I have been to.   The floor was grossly dirty. Pieces of bread and meat lingered all over. Parents were letting their kids roam free, dropping ice cream and strawberries. I even saw a kid pick his booger out before using the same hand to grab a corn on the cob. Needless to say, I lost my hungry appetite FAST.   The salad bar was not any better. The lettuce was not in cold temperature. The dessert section was mediocre with plain peach cobblers. Not worth the drive. Now worth the wait. Not worth the price. Just not worth it at all.
Went for breakfast today. It's a buffet- Some things are excellent, so not so good. Banana Bread french toast =Delish. Took the nephews, everyone gets what they want....Staff were great, Thanks

This place is a disgrace I can not believe the health inspector has not shut them down for how disgusting this place is. There was food crusted onto the "clean" plates and silverware. Food was left on several tables, smashed into the floors, and all over the seats.  The cottage cheese was warm and sour. Do not come here for your on well being. It is not worth your time or money. $18 for this amount is disgust.
Would you believe that after sending the negative review to the location manager as well as corporate not one reply!  Go to Sizzler instead

Food good, everything hot.Person behind the food buffet lines were pretty nice ,Offered the fresh food when you stood there.  Have not had an offer for a refill since I got here. My daughter has been offered twice. They did not clear or offer to clear the table up for 45 minutes after we sat down. Not typical of this place. They usually are on top of everything.   We always tip pretty well here afraid not this time because literally there is nobody to tip.   Ready to leave no offer of refill. Demoting 1 star.   My wife was here with me today, food cold and very disappointing. Service was ok but they never had the manager come over. All food cold.   Update: Sunday prices shoot up 10 bucks regardless of the time. They go from breakfast right to dinner and the food is the same exact food like the day before. It's like a spike in price just because a day goes by.   Saturday the food seemed fresher (weird) than Sunday.    This place is hot or miss today it is total miss and they don't have buttered noodles. Real hard to make.
Awesome service and very clean for the amount of people. If you leave here hungry, you have a serious issue!!!! The steak is better then outback or Logan's!!!!!

I went for lunch and overall most of the food was good . The only problem I had was when i ate the tuna fish usually when I eat tuna fish I feel fine but, whatever was in that tuna destroyed my stomach.I will NEVER eat the tuna fish there ever again.People for the sake of your digestive system DO NOT EAT THE TUNA FISH.(especially with crackers)

Why is there always a line out the door? Because it's about 9 dollars for AYCE lunch...and this is 'merica, so if you're coming here expecting pristine food, go somewhere else. If you want to get full and bloated, come right in.  It's 2 steps up from Hometown Buffet and the Chinese buffets around the area. What I liked is the variety. Salad, Chinese food, BBQ, Mexican, dessert and bread section...I'm missing something...Italian!   I think it was called the bourbon street chicken? Get that.   Poke a bunch of strawberries/marshmallows/whatever on a stick before you lather it in chocolate. People are waiting to get at that chocolate fountain.

I'm not sure how we got here, but wow what a WASTE in calories.  What's interesting is this place has three types of rice (Mexican Rice, Rice Pilaf, and Fried Rice), what's funny is all the rices taste the same and was way too soggy.   Whats even more funny is that the mac and cheese tastes just like the rice. Whats ridiculous is that the green beans have no taste at all. To put it over the top, the meatloaf and salad bar is horrible.   This place looks busy, but really it's just not, it's much smaller in space than Hometown Buffet and the clientele seems to be a lot bigger than Hometown's. I think I saw a good amount of people that are being paid by SDI for being too obese to work.   I'd rather go to hometown and I really hate that place!    I will not visit again..

I hesitated about a week after coming to write a review on this place to let my thoughts kind of process. In conclusion, I feel my experience here wasn't anything that wow-ed me, to be honest. I heard about this place when it opened, but steered clear for the entire time because I heard horror stories about how atrocious the waits and lines were.  I came here last Sunday for lunch around 11 something and there was a line that snaked outside the door, ending just outside of the shaded covering. The wait continued inside to the registers and I would say in total...the wait was about 45 mins or so.  I had heard raves about how Golden Corral was comparable to a Vegas buffet and how it kicked Hometown Buffet's ass, etc, etc. And I felt that with the crazy lines this place had brought out when it first opened (and still, even a few months in with its opening), that this place had to have some sort of majestic charm.  To be honest though, I felt the fare offered here was alright. Definitely not on the level of a "Vegas buffet" as I had heard early on (although there are small things here and there to note). The interior design faintly mimics those of Paris Buffet and maybe even The Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood (you know, with the faux windows, awnings, and separate stations/buildings), but that's probably about it in terms of appearance. Now granted, the food wasn't bad or anything (there are even some small things that make Golden Corral better than Hometown, such as the corn here, which is plump and juicy) - overall the food is by far better than the quality Hometown Buffet serves up, but it's nothing that'll blow you away. However, I do like that there are some special things here, such as the machine cotton candy and coconut macaroons, and also the steaks, which are cooked right in front of you by a team of chefs - all these small things bring that higher-end feel (or "Vegas feel") to Golden Corral.  It's hard to say whether I'll be coming back or not. I used to love buffets so much when I was a kid, but I think growing up, I've come to be quite indifferent about them. Even with this review, I feel like something's missing - I'm not disappointed, but I'm not too impressed either.  I just don't know. I guess I'm just not the kind of person who'll want to wait in a long line for food anymore. Again, nothing particularly bad about this place, but again - nothing particularly special.

Came here on the soft opening. It wasn't too crowded. The food was good and there were many option to choose from. Only downside was that people took too long in line for the food. I recommend going here.
