Not to mention they crammed us in a corner by a family of 4 who did nothing but fart and belch the entire meal. I'm not one to complain, but my goodness this was a pile of poop. If you like pizza and Mac n cheese, by all means this is your place, ate one plate. We then thought okay, maybe dessert is better, NOPE. There was a child sticking his fingers  in the chocolate fountain and then licking them. Safe to say we booked it after that. Place is a poopshoot
Well.... came back for round two, food is not bad it's usually fresh due to it always being busy..The service has not been bad this time ..
I really enjoyed my birthday dinner today. The food was mostly good. Some of the veggies were over cooked but for the most part everything was excellent. Great chicken livers!! Great desserts!!

I've been to this restaurant in Mississippi a few years back. This restaurant / buffet is great in my opinion. Even better then Hometown Buffet. The variety of food is amazing as well as the quality. The interior was clean and the staff was good.

I have attended three Golden Corral's and each one has been very good. In my opinion, I believe that GC's (Golden Corral) are better than Home Town Buffet. The food is good and fresh every time I attend. The only thing I do not like about the GC's is the large crowd. The GC's are always packed and I do not know if it because of the low price per person or the quality of the food. GC is a  great place to eat and I love attending when I have a chance.

Restaurant is not staffed or equipped to handle volume. Staff are most likely x felons. Lines are long inside and outside the buffet. They pack you in like sardines and the place is filthy attracting a like minded clientele. The food quality is average. Save your money and time!!!

I'm in Sun City visiting my mom, and apparently this is a favorite of she and her husband. I'm absolutely stunned, as they usually have decent taste. Thus place was truly terrible.  The only redeeming quality was that it was relatively clean.

2 weeks ago, I had a hankering for Golden Corral Rolls. Being pregnant, I crave really weird stuff, and that just happened to be what I wanted that day. While I was there, I decided to go ahead and just get a to-go box for lunch... since I try to eat relatively well, I figure a little Mac n Cheese wouldn't hurt with my chicken, carrots, green beans, broccoli, and fruit. Like, seriously, why did I even look twice at the Mac n Cheese? That's because I have always had a very love relationship with GC Mac N Cheese! I mean, for heaven's sake, my mom took me to GC for my 9th birthday, where they spilled a TRAY OF DRINKS all over me and didn't apologize. (I'm pregnant and straying from what I'm trying to say ).  What I'm trying to say is, I was READY for Mac N Cheese. I get home 10 minutes after I leave GC, and open my box. My rule: healthy food first because, well, I'm pregnant. I can't eat that much anyway and I'd rather fill up on fruits and veggies.  I get 1 bite into the Mac n Cheese, and I'm thinking "Woah, this does not taste like I remember." I take  another bite and as I am chewing, I see a FREAKING GREEN SPOT IN THE NOODLE!! Like... IN THE NOODLE! It tastes like mold to me because there was mold in the freaking noodle!!  So, what do I do? I call the location I went to. The woman at the register remembered me. I asked for the manager, and was told he went out to get some copy paper from Sam's Club. OKAY, no big deal. I've worked at places where we've run out of something before our reorder.   When I don't hear back for 3 hours (I assume it doesn't take 3 hours to get copy paper from a store that is literally 4 minutes away), I call again. I explain the situation to the manager, get a bullsh*t excuse from the manager as to why I wasn't called back right away, and he says to come get a refund.  Well, it's a Friday, and I was about to leave for work, and I work late on Fridays. So, after work, I called, and he says "Don't worry, come on Monday, and I can give you a gift card." Do I look like I want a gift card? I want my money back!! When I was 9, and the lady spilled 6+ drinks all over me on my birthday, it took me 10 YEARS to go back. What am I going to do? Hope that Golden Corral is still open in 10 years?! I told him I wanted a refund, and he tells me I can only get a refund within an hour of the purchase time. I called before that hour was up.  Not only that, but how was he going to give me a refund in the first place?! Why can't I get my money?! He then says VERY AGGRESSIVELY "Are you never going to eat here again? Your Mac n Cheese sits next to the green beams. It was probably a piece of green beans! I will give it to you from my pocket, then!" I end it there because I don't like losing my cool, crying, or anything like that. I hang up, and move on with my night (aka this thing called sleep). I HATE being interrupted when I'm tying to talk. I HATE being yelled at by grown BOYS who think they know what I'm talking about.  I then emailed customer service, and I'm still waiting for a response... 2 weeks later. Yes, I've checked my junk mail. So, instead, here is what we get-- a beautiful picture of my molded Mac n Cheese.  Enjoy eating at Golden Corral, where you don't know how old your food is when they put it out! & Jose, just know, it's not a fucking green bean. It's mold.  PS if another manager sees this, please note that Jose told me not to talk to other managers because then he would have to be called on his day off and talk about the situation. So, have fun with that!!

Ok this is a buffet and somethings are not up to most people's standards but let me tell you the breakfast is by far the best value for your money. The omelet section is a favorite and you choose what you want in it and put in a bowl and hand over. Love this you can put in what you want and how much and it is perfect. Sliced ham, chicken fried steak, hash fried potatoes oh my as a senior $8.49 for breakfast including your drink is really good. The dinner service could stand to have a little more attention to the hotness of the food but still a great value for the price. Try the breakfast and see what you think. I go at least twice to three times a month.

Came here a few times with coworkers for lunch, and it's not a bad place.  Not a big fan of buffet food but I'll eat it.  Only live once and we live to eat.  The place is always packed, and the cleanliness of the place is not very good probably due to all the people out and about and all around.  If you need to do a two, you better off doing it at the tree outside, I wouldn't sit on the toilet here if I were you, might catch something.. Some of the clean plates still had food stuck to them... The workers are very friendly and attentive, they would always come and see how we are doing and see if we need more coffee or soda or water.  Very friendly and professional staff they have.   The food, they have a huge variety of foods!  Their meatloaf pretty good!  Love the ketchup on it, honey ham was fresh out of the oven when I got my slice and it was juicy and tasty.  The steak a little tough for my taste, they had potatoes of many kinds.  Many types of vegetables, from corn to green beans, carrots and lettuce and Brussels sprouts.  The bun and the apple pie thing was awesome.  Chocolate fountain thing for strawberries very cool indeed.  They have both soft serve ice cream, and the kind you scoop out of buckets, for that you need to ask a worker to do for you.  Wise, I would go over board if I did it on my own, and too much ice cream can be a bad thing for me.     Overall a good place to hang out and stuff yourself.  I'm not a fan of buffets but this place will serve its purpose if you want to try a variety of foods for a single price.  You definitely get what you pay for here, good value.

So much food to pick from...When I want to pack on the pounds and feast on good ole meat and potato's this is on top of my list.  When I go out with the guys its almost a competition of who can eat the most plates.   The rolls are excellent, the selection is great, yes you can pound down fresh salad and fruit if you are on a diet.  Or go all out and eat sweet potato mash with marshmallows and turkey and gravy....Thanksgiving everyday :)  Great tip: Arrive before 11, I would go at 1030 eat some bacon and eggs and then after 11 they serve lunch items.  Great breakfast items also.....Enjoy :)

I'm not a buffet's in general but my boyfriend and his daughter wanted to eat here so I sucked it up. Every plate was dirty, I pulled a spoon out of the bucket and it had dried up gravy all over it...like it had never been washed. Kids were sticking their hands in the chocolate fountain and everything was bland and gross. 2 out of 3 of us got sick from it.

Don't arrive here on an empty stomach or hungry! The lines are ridiculous and it seems that they are always giving free 65in TVs due to long lines and might take up to as long as 11/2-2hr (so I heard) to get inside to the cashier. Once past the door and know were you are going to be seated it's time to strap on the feed bag! I'm not much of a buffet fan as I prefer quality over quantity  but it is one of the better buffets I have been too (yes, better than hometown). they constantly have the serving trays full so you can literally try everything and its always fresh and not much time under those crummy heat lamps. They are grilling, cooking and baking in from of you so you can keep an eye out on the dessert section and get it while its fresh out the oven. it's a good place to try and once you get past that long line of people in front of you.

It's surprising, but not all the outlets of this chain are alike. This one avoids the problem of overcooking items like pork and beef, and our server was remarkably attentive. The place was clean and they keep things were well stocked.   I like the salad bar. The main thing for a good salad bar is having lots of fresh ingredients. Keeping it fresh requires lots of traffic, and this place has that. Salads are easy to make, but having a dozen or more fresh ingredients at home would take a lot of effort.  Like most buffets of this type it's crowded and noisy at peak times, and the food is tasty, but without much spice. If you want stately silence and dedicated personal service, you should be somewhere else.  Golden Corral is a good deal, and this outlet is well run. The weekend breakfasts are the best deals, unbeatable.

Met my parents at Golden Corral for lunch on Sunday. They were super busy! We were seated all the way in the back where private parties are held. Getting up to the buffet was a challenge. I waited in line for several minutes just for some mashed potatoes and a yeast roll. I was disappointed to see their meatloaf had the gravy on top instead of the ketchup topping I like, so I didn't bother to try any. Other items I enjoyed were the mac & cheese, pot roast, bourbon chicken, steak fries, a pancake & french toast (love the breakfast all day, and they were freshly made!), sweet corn pudding, and a chocolate dipped star cookie & coconut macaroon for dessert. Yum! Things that could've been better besides the meatloaf- I didn't see any breakfast potatoes and the breakfast burritos were only in sausage. But overall, good eats! Just a lot of people to deal with.

Went to Golden Corral on Easter. Waited in line for about 15 minutes or so. There were plenty of tables available when we were seated. Everything was pretty good as usual, but they ran out of sweet corn pudding and it was never replaced, so I couldn't get any. That is one of the items I always look forward to at GC, so it was very disappointing. Also, the chocolate fountain only had strawberries and marshmallows for dipping. No cookies or rice krispy treats or anything. What a letdown! I wanted my $13.99 back.

I love Golden Corral and usually go to the location on Dysart but decided to give this one a try. What a mistake! I was expecting a large population of Hispanics, considering the area, but I was not expecting the mass of people coming to eat here Sunday afternoon in their church attire. The place was packed. There weren't even that many people at Dysart Golden Corral on Thanksgiving Day! I immediately felt my anxiety rise. Once seated, my friend and I had to take a moment to mentally prepare before attempting to navigate the buffet... It was so crowded. I got meatloaf, mashed potatoes, steak fries, pot roast, and a yeast roll. The meatloaf is one of my new favorite things at GC, but I noticed it looked different. It had a gravy on top instead of the ketchup I'm used to. And when I tried it, it was cold and gross. Definitely a different recipe. I couldn't eat it. And I did not get the mac & cheese I usually love because it looked like it was still frozen... my friend said it was cold. What a disappointment! The dessert bar was a nightmare to navigate. I couldn't get anywhere near the chocolate fountain. People just crowd around there and cut in line. It's awful. The dessert bar was also slim pickins... there wasn't as much selection as there normally is and what they did have was running low. The workers couldn't seem to restock quickly enough. Speaking of workers, they kept blocking the aisles and we couldn't get to & from our table easily. This location sucks and I don't ever need to come here again.

So I think I paid $11 USD to dine here. There was lots of food to choose from since it was a buffet and I didn't get sick, so that was a huge plus. This place is slightly out of the way from the Strip and from Downtown so it would be inconvenient to come if you didn't drive.

Popped into this place to grab a quick lunch between errands.  Located at the top of Litchfield Road after Walmart, at the 4-way stop, and cannot be missed.  Lots of available parking space.  Staff were friendly and welcoming as we entered.  Restaurant was very clean, little to no noise, and very spacious!  Lot of different areas/sections to eat.  Tables are cleared away promptly and staff did check on us from time to time.  As I mentioned the restaurant was very clean as I noticed spillages from the food stations were addressed immediately.  Lunch buffet price - $9.79 + soda ($2.50).  Only areas they lose -- limited variety in food (-1) - didn't notice seafood options or maybe I came on the wrong day; and food was very tasteless (-1).  I probably will not return!

Picture, if you will, this scenario.  You're hungry.  So you drive to a buffet.  Instead of walking in and eating, you decide to stand around for 2 hours and 20 minutes before chowing down on very mediocre, incredibly salty food.    I'm not sure what possessed us to do this.  Maybe the long line inspired some mysterious image of deliciousness waiting to reward our patience.  Sadly this was not to be.    To add insult to injury we had to wait another 20 minutes after walking in the door all the while enduring a gauntlet of sodas, iced teas, and juices BEFORE finding out at the cashier that it's extra.  And to throw some salt on that wound it's Pepsi.    Once inside you would imagine being grateful to get off your feet but the harsh lighting and the crowded spaces has all the ambiance of a maximum security prison cafeteria.  Don't make any sudden moves.    As others have stated the rice is mushy.  All the fish related stations were way too salty.  Tartar sauce was the standout.  Steak was actually ok but it is SO GREASY.  It's sitting in a pool of grease and then it's flanked with big blobs of fat to boot.    The way the food is arranged creates the illusion that there is more variety than the other behemoth buffet chain but it turns out they string out the food so only one side is accessible meaning more people have to crowd around and wait and there is actually probably around the same variety.  Bottom line: don't let the long lines fool you.  You're better off going elsewhere.   Seriously.
I've been there a couple of times. The service is good...the food is marginal...but what turned me off is when I saw this old guy drooling as he walked toward the food. I'll never be back!

Having trouble on what to have for dinner and have a big appetite, Check out this place The desserts are great and so is the fresh food. I love coming here and trying different types of food every time I go here.

Took the kids to Golden Corral because the wife was out with friends.  My wife refuses to eat here.  The food was the same as before.  The steak was pretty tasty and so were the mashed potatoes.  I usually just stick with the classics.  My daughter had a salad and some chicken, which she enjoyed.    The service and atmosphere were pretty bad.  They definitely could improve in that area.  I guess I don't blame my wife for not eating here.  It's loud.  It's dirty.  There are kids running everywhere.  It's chaotic.  I would eat here more often if it wasn't so chaotic and the workers and managers tried really hard to keep the buffets and dining room clean.

What to say about the corral? I love to put on my best gravy-stained NASCAR shirt and waddle on over. Plenty of open space so I can maneuver my electric scooter about and pile on the planks of salty grease. My only wish is that they would provide a blender and funnel at the table so I could pack more meat down my gullet quickly.
My mother, sister and niece got so sick yesterday 9/26/14. Throwing up and diarrhea ALL NIGHT!
Dirty. Servers are terrible at there job. Good is below average. Went here once and will never go back. Until they change there ways and the people they hire.

Went to Golden Corral tonight at the recently opened location in Las Vegas.  I had never been to a Golden Corral before and didn't know what to expect, although I had done some research before hand.  My wife and I wanted lunch as to avoid what we figured would be a large dinner crowd, so we arrived about 2:30.  It was quite busy, with a line at the cashier stand, however the line moved quickly.  The major bottleneck is the beverage station, it slows forward progress as diners fill their glasses.  As long as you're going to have servers that re-fill your drinks, you might as well have them serve the initial drink to avoid the delay at the front door.    The price was good, I'm used to two-for-one deals at the casino buffets, so it was weird paying for both lunches, but the pricing was reasonable.  We were able to find a table with no difficulty, as it was seat yourself at that time.  The restaurant was clean, and tables were bussed frequently, with no piles of dirty plates or napkins cluttering the tables.    The food was very good, some items were a little bland for my taste, such as the mexican dishes weren't as spicy as I would have liked.  The meatloaf was a hit for me and my wife, which we consider the best meatloaf of any buffet.  The steakburger sliders were very good too.    We were very pleased with how often the food is rotated, I didn't see any old or dried out food on the buffet line.  We had to be careful when eating because the food was very hot, which is a plus!  I also like how you can watch the food preparation as you're eating.  It's nice to watch them cooking as your eating so you know the food is being handled well, and prepared fresh.  The desert area was very good as well.  Although it's hard to get to the fountains because of the volume of people trying to use them, it's almost always wall-to-wall people at the desert counter.  I can highly recommend the hand scooped ice cream too.  Lastly, everyone, even the other diners, were very friendly.  Everyone was observing proper line etiquette, and excusing themselves.  Not jumping in line, waiting patiently.  Such a nice change from buffets where the norm is the "entitled" elite who think they run the world and you must allow them to cut in front of you and in general ignore you.  It's nice to be seen and to be acknowledged and to use the people skills our parents taught us.  Oh, and there were a lot of servers, buss persons, and staff keeping everything running very smoothly.  As long as things stay the same at this location I'm quite sure it'll remain our favorite buffet in Las Vegas.
I will never go to golden coral again the place was dirty looking had a urine smell in the back the food was cold & old service sucked there was flys landing on the food

We frequent this one Golden Corral a lot. Others not so much, they don't compare to this one. This specific one is always clean, people are always super friendly, and most important the food is always fresh. In our 7+ years eating here, we have never had a bad experience.    Last night was no exception. We had our Sons 15th birthday dinner here, and had about 25 people in our party. We had two guys taking care of us, and the whole staff was funny when they totally embarrassed our Son singing to him. This was an important night as some of our guests came over 1.000 miles for this dinner. I just feel the staff here needs a thumbs up, and pat on the back. Everyone in our party had a great time.    Now the downfall, we wanted to add an additional tip to our cc when paying. The register only gave the lady two options to choose from, and it was only %'s. So she could only choose a prechosen percentage for the tip. Corporate should consider adding a way for us to add an additional amount in for the tip, or a specific amount. On large parties it automatically adds a 15% tip. So when we felt that wasn't enough we were disappointed that we couldn't add more. Had I known early I would have brought enough cash to cover the extra.    Otherwise, another great meal. Thank you Golden Corral, and thank you to the people who helped us! The lady cashier was great too, with her patience. (We had quite a few little kids) So again, thanks a bunch!

Please don't go here. It was the absolute worst eating experience I've had in the last 10 years. It starts as soon as you walk in the door. You pay a ridiculous amount of money. My total was over $13 for lunch and a drink. (Instead you can have the much healthier, local-sourced ENP soup and salad buffet as an add-on to multiple $10 entrees plus a drink while your kids eat off the bar for free.) You get a dirty tray that's wet--they say they just washed it; don't believe them. I took a napkin to wipe it down just so it wouldn't be wet, and it made the napkin all dirty.  The disgusting food is laid out in several sections. Gross salad with fattening, wilted toppings, fried things, sauce-covered things, etc. There are 3 vegetables, but you have to have a secret password to eat anything that might be good for you. Items are not exactly "pure", e.g., my salsa had a glop of butter dropped into it. Yummy! (All jokes aside: The rotisserie chicken was really good. If you can get $13 worth of that, go for it!) About 1/3 of the items are in the dessert section. There is a chocolate fountain, but that is only to cover the crapiness of the items you dip in it. I tried to eat one of the rice krispie treats without the chocolate, and I nearly choked. Also, the chocolate is luke-warm.   EMT crews are available for heart attacks.  Anyway, thank God I brought "Data Analysis Using Regression and Multilevel/Hierarchical Models" by Gelman & Hill because at least it gave me something positive to say about  my experience today: "I love how Gelman sees problems from multiple angles and builds flexibility into the models. I can't remember the time I enjoyed reading a textbook!"   It was this food that made possible for me to finally enjoy a statistics textbook!!!

Golden Corral has once again disappointed. Went there fir dinner sftrr a year hiatus sadly it got worse. Flies under glass on food. Food gas also slipped steak was hard and dry. They no longer serve the yeast rolls at the bakery but are now with the entree. My dinner roll was dried out and crispy not what i wanted I suggest somewhere else.

The name sounds soooo "blech"  but I have to say, this place is ggoooodd!  They make home made mashed taters, they grill various steaks to your liking and offer lots of yummy veggie options.  The salad bar section has "real" lettuce, not just iceberg and romain - but spinach, radicchio, etc...Great place for all!

First of all this is a rip off for $12, not including the drink. The place is filthy, there's food all over the floor under the tables, they are understaffed, and the food is not all that great to begin with.  It takes forever to get a drink or to get your table cleared of food. This is pissing me off because you go to the casino and get world class service, all the food you can eat, including the drink for 8 bucks!  If you like to get pissed off and frustrated, then eat here but if not, go somewhere else where they  have better service and better food. $12 my ass!  Dam!

Came here for the first time and loved it! For a lunch price of around $9, it was definitely worth it. Downsides include the semi-long wait and the crowded walkways with kids frantically running around. But hey, it adds to the buffet environment! With a chocolate fountain bar and a cotton candy machine, I would recommend anyone with a sweet tooth to stop by. Not to mention, there was a variety of food. Nothing fancy but nothing nasty either. For the price, why not give it a try?

Went with my family back awhile back hubby got food poisoning and was never back thought it was just a one time incident but after seeing the video leak on how another store had they stored their food... Just say ill never be back because I don't want to take the chance...

The management went out of her way to make this a great trip! We had a huge team of wrestlers in town for a tournament and they helped us right away and went out of their way to make it a great dinning experience!

It is just like every other buffet with more comfortable seats and good location. Last time I went in I probably spent an hour and a half discussing stuff, nobody bothered me I didn't notice how time fly by. Good food too.

Manager of this restaurant is one of the most disrespectful "leaders" I have ever had the displeasure of encountering. Twice I saw him disrespect his employees in front of customers. Once yelling at an employee after she had been working for four hours that he/she couldn't go on his/her 15 minute break because he/she had more work to do. Another time yelling at his cook to go get salmon because there were no customers in line for steak, then as soon as he left, three customers showed up. Then the manager proceeded to mock the cook by saying "Bueller" because the cook was in the back getting the salmon that the manager had asked for. Other than that the service was great but the manager needs to show more respect towards his employees. Leaders do, bosses order...

First, it is what it is. Strap your feedbag on and head for the buffet! The food is above average for a feeding trough place, and the cost is reasonable.   Like another Yelper talked about, the blue-hair's from the Sun Cities will bum rush, and walker check you to get to the buffet. It's also fun to watch them stack up at the front entrance just before 4PM, so they can get dinner for lunch pricing. Minutes later there is a geriatric scrum at the buffet when the dinner items are served. But given the choice, I'll take the old folks over screaming children.   Being a bit grossed out by many buffet's, with so many people handling the serving spoons, I was glad to see hand sanitizer dispensers.   The service was friendly and efficient, and the restaurant was clean.

"What's that smell?", my daughter asked as she wrinkled her nose. "That, my dear, is the scent of government assistance"  Hey, I'm no snob (but it's rumored that I'm a jackass), and Golden Corral really does offer unlimited ribs... but I don't see the benefit in having unlimited ribs when you don't care for the taste or consistency of them.  It's cheap food, and a lot of it, but I'm not a pig (although I do have my times), and I don't want to feed from a trough.

Just OK..... I prefer Hometown Buffet.  BAD - Line getting into the place ridiculous.   - Initial feeling was that i was being corraled into my seat.   - None of the employees were personable at all.   - Seating was very cramped.  Seating very close to each other.   - Flavors were muted.   Recipes just average.  - Selection of main dishes was sub par.   - Most of the time overcooked, dry and underseasoned. - Desserts were overcooked.  Cake and cookies dry/  - Carrot cake was tasteless and one of the worst carrot cakes I've ever had.    GOOD - Good variety - I thought the Greens, fried okra and tempura onions were good and not greasy. - Salad was good.  lettuce was fresh.
For a buffet this place has a good selection. Food was fresh and tasty. Excellent wait staff.

This place gets crazy packed and the lines are ridiculous! its out the door and when you finally get inside the door there is another line waiting! I had to wait almost 1- 1 1/2 hours just to eat here and it WAS ALL HYPE! because this is the first Golden Corral to open up down here so of course those enticing commercials we see time to time on TV makes people super excited for this one! But from my experience here this is what i have to say about this place.  - Long line & ridiculous wait - Overhyped - Drinks ARE NOT included with your meal - Understaffed and they couldn't handle all the customers pouring in - Area was not clean & dirty tables were left around - Waited 30 minutes one time to just get to the grilled steaks - People would be eating in the lines BARBARICALLY or kids will be running around with food in their hands - People are RUDE, but hey when you're hungry you tend to get grumpy - Food is WAYYYYY too salty!!! - Desserts were tasteless and stale   The only good thing was their steaks, the chef cooked it to a perfect medium rare, but  after everything i had to go through to get the steaks. NO THANKS!

Great selection, and average buffet prices (and have not been successful in finding coupons!).  LOVE the sweet potato cassarole, and I can make my own chili cheese fries which are absolutely delicious!  Their steaks are decent enough, and they have many meat dishes for the meat-eaters.  In my opinion, the desserts leave something to be desired so I usually get more chili cheese fries.  However, they do have numerous desserts to choose from so you shouldn't be disappointed.  The rolls brought to your table are outstanding! *By the way, this is for the Surprise locaion*

This is an older location of Golden Corral that has tried to convert to the newest Golden Corral concept.  The main problem is that they didn't remodel the business to the new and easier customer flow that the newest concept offers.  This location has new signage over the older food stations (salad, desserts, main items) and attempted to offer the new asian/italian/hispanic/seafood/etc foods without having the space for it.  This results in a very limited food selection as compared to a newer Golden Corral/  The employee carving at the grill area that also cuts the ham or other meat offerings for the customers was very polite, as was my server.

We went there as a second visit since opening ,went there to our surprise no waiter, they told us to sit anywhere we wanted  find our own table. So we find one then the bus boy tells us of sorry,this table is for a bigger party to find another table, so we go looking all the ones that was available were still dirty we didn't want to sit there . So they finally clean one and we go to fix food. Why I pull out a dirty spoon with dried up food still on it in the clean spoon bin?? Then food all over the floors so not clean very ghetto, and after paying for the if you ask me too much for the dinner plate for nerve to charge separate for the drinks, we not going back there, food may taste good but its too ghetto

5 stars for our server Junior,  great service. He was on top of it and we were really impressed.  It was prime rib Saturday and that was good. They could work on that horseradish sauce, it's like water and ruins the meat. Teriyaki glazed sirloin was yummy but mainly wrote this review to commend good service.

I normally don't do Buffets but my 13 year old  niece wanted to go so I took her since I was in town to visit her last Saturday evening . She had a question about a steak on how it was cooked, so she went to ask a cook named Marcus(my niece read his name tag) about a steak,he basically ignored her and a few other customers with questions.So she went to ask Kevin and he was courteous, knowledgeable and professional and sincerely apologize for his co workers unprofessionalismn. Aside from that Kevin made it a least bit enjoyable. I will file a complaint on Marcus however. Myself dealing with customer service for over a dedcade,this is unacceptable in my eyes. Thank you.

I can't believe how dirty this restaurant was. I Would highly recommend they employees and Managers take a ServSafe class and get certified. There were 6 of us eating here and none of us finished our meals.

Yup, it's a buffet alright. A bit pricey, but I would return, not offten, but I would return. The Fried Chicken was my favorite. I am not sure what they put in thier breading, but it was delicious. If you like your steak RARE ( tell them to make it moo and bloody) otherwise thay are brown through and through. We didn't use the "Woderfalls". They have these little dessert cups that were just delicious even for someone like myself who dosen't care for sweets. OOOOOH they also had a "Bourbon Chicken" that was fabulous over rice. I took away 1 star just because of how awfully packed it was and how people let thier children do anything they want and  run rampant. We came around 3pm to miss the dinner rush and it worked fine even though we had to park in the "lower 40" it was very fast and we were able to get right it. I want to give a shout out to our server "KEN" he is awesome, busts his butt and litteraly went out of his way to make sure everyone in his station was well served! THANK YOU KEN !!!

I was wondering what all the hype was because every time I passed by on the 60 fwy, I always see a line to the parking lot.  Well, a good explanation is that this place just opened up. Luckily, we went yesterday, on a Tuesday, during lunch, so our wait time wasn't bad.  I could only imagine how it would be during dinner time.  Wow, it's like a "Vegas" experience for local buffets.  I'm totally impressed with what this place had to offer in choice of food, desserts, and service.  There is literally something for everyone.  I think my eyes had food overload, I didn't even eat as much as I would have wanted...I think that's kind of weird saying that.  I just ended my meal by hyjacking one of those cotton candy out the restaurant.  I would definitely go back, and an overwhelming response from my other picky family members would go back as well.

I remember growing up in Brownsville, TX how my family considered this our luxury dining affairs. The Golden Corral... it's like a kids' paradise with all the shit you can grab and then just throw away. Parents don't give a care cuz they can freely experiment random crap to try to give their kids in hopes that they'll shove something other than pizza down their throats since one price covers all the food you can eat. That's how I do with my kids and my parents before me.  On the other side the food is pretty bad and the buffet now ranges in the double digits. So, not quite the deal it used to be. The place is usually packed and sometimes the patrons aren't the most well-mannered individuals who, oh i don't know... cover their mouths when they sneeze, or patiently wait in line for their turn, or maybe grab food with their hands and then put it back... you know... disgusting shit.  Staff is nice... I've never had a problem. The staff behind the food is all Hispanic and don't really speak English.  They do have a great variety of food. Lately they've introduced some different things like a Chinese food cart, seafood area and steak areas.  I guess the problem is that it has a bit of a reputation of being kinda "hood" and sometimes they live up to it.  I don't know... go check it out. I probably won't be going back to any of them any time soon. There's just to much here to review and it's mostly negative. haha

I son't know if I will be back here. The wait staff was very nice and on top of things. Always has clean tables and full cups. The food was actually pretty good. We went for dinner, fresh steaks right off the grill however you like them. Rare. Medium rare. Medium etc etc. The other food was good as well. What I have mentioned so far was well worth the price. About $17 with a drink, tax and tip.   Why I may not be back, the people. The wait to get in was an hour. (we had a party of 10 mind you) Once inside there were so many ghetto, nasty, dirty people. All races. A million kids running wild. So crowded. You've got to walk through people to get anywhere. So ridiculous. Go to Woodgrill instead. It's in Norwalk. It is further away but still less time than waiting for this place.  I think I will have to go back at least once to decide if this place is on my "No Fly" list. Maybe not on a weekend right at dinner lol.

I love this place! Used to go all the time when I lived in Oklahoma. However, I did not appreciate the guy who came in with his family and their family dog! This dog was not a special needs dog!!! They could not control him on the leash! I was ready to go complain. The staff were so professional about it so as not to cause a scene and to have them come in ever so discreetly; my family did not notice the dog until I pointed it out! I hated that it had to walk by the food to the room where they hold large parties and you could see the dog while you were eating. And, they were feeding it and it was jumping around! REALLY??!! I do not recall any special needs dogs that my friends have that act like that! I am sorry, at a buffet, no pets should be allowed period. Let me tell you that after that, I walked by this table and this lady had a teacup terrier in her purse and was feeding it! I'm like What the H...! Not Cool, People! Leave your pets at home or order delivery and light candles on your patio, Fido will not know the difference, trust!!

The food is fresh and the place is clean.  I love that you can try a little bit of anything and everything without committing to an entire portion of anything.  I have been here several times and it is quite consistent.  Very small senior discount though.
Services were good food was good overall 5 stars. This was the best golden corral that i have been to service is what earned the 5 stars

This was the third time we've been to this one in years.  Now I know why we prefer the one n Mesa.  The wet dog smell when you walk in about makes you sick.  Then to the bar.  Still had 15 minutes of breakfast time left.  Waited 10 minutes for hash browns, scrambled eggs, and bacon before deciding to try the omelette instead.  Should have just tried lunch.  The omelette was Brown, no taste, burned bacon w a funky taste, smashed hash browns, a waitress by the name of Virgina was the rudest person.  Grabbed my receipt, asked if everything was good and didn't like us giving her the truth. Can't get over the horrible treatment from any restaurant.   The lunch food wasn't any better as that's what my husband ate.  Definitely an experience I'll share on Facebook. Only chose one star as they didn't have a spot for no star.

I've been eating here a few years and when you don't know what you want to eat this is the place to go ! The food is good quality and my understanding this is now a franchise which many cases means improvement . They have a nice variety of entrees to choose from ! The staff is super nice and helpful , I had a lady named Lois today she's great !!!! So when your appetite is big you know where to go!!! Eat your soul away!!!! Lol

Pretty crowded and unending cooking ... it has a factory feel because people line up in unison with predictable behaviors that creates a constant flow of gluttonous and unabashed hoarders of food ... plates piled high with a melange of meats and carbs;  after my first plate ... I rebelled -- to the horror of dining mates --- against the tyrannical orgy of carnivores....nevertheless, for those who can take it, this dining site is an oasis....

Tried to have lunch here today at 12:07. Went for their signature sirloin burgers. Guess what? They were all out and weren't making any more for awhile. It was lunchtime folks and you were just open for 1 1/2 hr. WOW. Very disappointed and besides that there were many empty trays. What's going on. Don't think we'll be back anytime soon. Oh yeah, they lowered the price for general public but not for seniors. Who ever heard of just a dime lower for seniors? Outrageous!

Not sure why everyone keeps raving about this place....  After much insistence, I gave up and went to see what all the hoopla was about.  Going during the dinner rush, I was immediately crushed both in front and back with families of 6 to 8.  No one ever brought bread to our table even though all the tables around us were served at least two or three times.  We requested bread four times and had to ask for our drinks to be refilled.  Still no bread, and I ran out of water so consistently that I had to swallow the food dry.  The roast was cut with the grain, making it inedible.  Veggies were overcooked.  The famous steaks people are always talking about were nowhere to be seen since they closed the grill.  As we left, the manager must have seen the unhappy look on our faces and asked if there was anything he could do.  We explained what happened to which he apologized and said that if we sat back down, he would make sure bread came to us.  Yeah, cuz the bread is SO good we want to go sit back down and wait for possibly forever again.  GUH!  Thanks, but no thanks...ever again.
They did a great service...the food was so good... Mmm
This place is actually pretty good for a buffet. The selection is HUGE and so is the line to get in. Food is constantly coming out so it's always fresh. Service is decent. Nothing amazing though.

We go here maybe once every other month. It's hit or miss. The food is usually good, but we've had experiences of getting sick after we eat there as well: That may be because we already have tricky tummies, and not necessarily because of the food itself.  The waiters and waitresses are usually good, but can become overwhelmed.   This is a place where what you find usually depends on --when-- you go. You go on say... Easter? Expect chaos. You go mid-week lunch hour? Much better.  Another thing Yelp reviewers must admit --- the cleanliness of the dining area, and sometimes the buffet often depends a lot on the attentiveness of parents and their willingness to supervise and accompany their children as they should. Emphasize the word "Supervise". I've seen big family parties where the adults are so busy laughing and gorging themselves that the kids are running wild. That said, the employees and managers have a duty to say something to the parents. But........ in the way the world is today, that might be construed as racist or prejudice in some manner.   It's just a point to remember next time you go to GC for some food and people watching.

The food here is disgusting. Everything has way too much salt. I tried a little bit of almost every thing the have here, and none of it tasted good. Let me take that back. The salad was mediocre,  and note really worth remembering whether for the fact it was the best thing that have to eat here. Their desert section looks good, and I'm hoping that they don't salt that too.  The wait staff is great, which is the only reason I didn't give this place one star.   The waiter I had here is far below where he should be in the service industry. It's rare that I get great service in almost any restaurant much less a buffet. Jason my waiter here was phenomenal,  and I wish that could get service as good at his at other restaurants

My motto at a buffet: Take almost embarrassingly small portions of each dish so that you can try everything.   There was no line at 8:30 in the AM. Price was only $9 for all-you-can-eat buffet. Everything was pretty good.   Here's what I ate and I'm proud of it: Fresh waffle fried chicken (there's two kinds, get the one with the smoother looking batter) smoky sausage  grits with brown sugar and butter oatmeal eggs fresh fruit slice of boysenberry pie coffee  Does not mean I took fat ass portions of each like some patrons were doing then wasting the food to go up and get other items. That's just disgusting and irresponsible eating practice. I think etiquette and portion control is out-of-control. The amount of wasted food is incredible at buffets.   This place was decent for the price. It was probably a better experience since my grandparents are in town and my brother was here telling interesting stories. My family rocks! For example: In reference to a wedding we're attending this afternoon my 80 year old grandpa just said "Open bar, I can drink a lot of beer in 5 hours hahah."  Parking: Large private lot. Can fill up during peak hours, but spaces are pretty large.

The place was so unorganized, and to be 'politically correct'....It's GHETTO! The employees, the food, the clientele...GHETTO! We were afraid just the parking lot alone, why they do not hire security! But, if you love your fried ochra, fried chicken, corn bread and ice tea....this might be "your joint"!....just don't for get to wear the bullet proof vest!.....

Food was pretty good for a buffet for the masses. Went for lunch within the first week of grand opening. Tried to get dinner a couple of times during evening but line was out the door. $8.50 for lunch $11.50 for dinner and then add fountain drinks for additonal $1.99. One of friendliest staffs you will come across. Won't be a regular for me, too many other places to eat at in Vegas. Food is well prepared and displayed. Easy to over do it here and you will be surrounded by by those on a mission to get their money's worth. Seating is a little ackward and cramed together. It has an industrial or chow hall feel but the creew keeps it neat and clean. Worth checking out at least once. I am sure there will be life long regulars here.

HOMETOWN BUFFET IS DEAD TO ME!!!   I HATE buffets so much!!! I only go to one when we have our "family dinners" at one. I dread going to HTB because the food sucks...it seems like it's been sitting out all night and day...my mom yells at me when we would go to HTB and I would just make a salad. LoL.  Anywho....we went to GC and I liked it. So much more to choose from and food is actually hot!!! The fondue is to die for...I limited myself to 2 chocolate dipped strawberries!!! I had to or otherwise I would be like Homer Simpson and stick my whole face under it!   I was confused about the drinks at the entrance (before you pay)...not sure why they do it that way but it seemed ok. The servers kept coming to our table, my drink was never empty...and they actually have DR. PEPPER!!! SCORE!!!!   The only thing I didn't like was their "chinese food." The chicken was way too hard!!! And their management sucks...and so do their "rules." Your whole party has to be in line to get a table. If you're missing one person from your party, they will not seat you, or they will seat you but not give you a spot for the person(s) missing from your party. And you cannot "pre-pay" for other people in your party. Ugh! This sucks for huge Mexican families who are never on time...like mine! LoL.   Bottom line...I would go back to this buffet joint. Nice....veddy nice....
Worst service, stood in front food waiting to have someone serve like the steak, beef ribs. No one came. So got my refund and walked out. I don't see Golden Corral being around very much longer.

By far THE WORST BUFFET RESTAURANT I've ever been!! Place is dirty AF even the dishes are dirty!! food is salty and dry! Food selection is very little(mostly chicken) Dont waste your money here!!  Go to fortune star instead!

I am not a big fan of Golden Corral. I am not a big fan of any buffet for that matter, it might just be me LoL. My kids love this place so the only time I come is if they ask. They have a big variety and I am sure something for everyone. Everything from salad, chicken, bbq, sweets you name it. In my opinion it's just as clean as any other place. The food is average or what you would expect. This trip I do want to highlight our waitress, his name was Joey and he was very friendly and aim to please. It's also in a good location and the parking lot is very very well lit.

It's a buffet so you kinda know what to expect. This is like Hometown buffets more mature sister or something. The food is a step up but you still got the buffet atmosphere and crowds.  The Good: The selection is great lots of meat, It's affordable. I've never seen them let a food dish run empty.  The Bad: The carpet is kinda gross with the stains, spills and occasional smell. The server must refill your drinks and many times these guys disappear so you may have an empty drink for a good 20 min. The crowd. OMG this place got so packed one time that after we payed my family couldn't even find a seat for awile. They shouldn't let you in if you can't sit down.

I had to see what the hype is all about, with the line out the door every single night since it opened up a couple of weeks ago.  Going in, I didn't think the Corral would live up to my expectations.  Coming out, I decided it didn't, and I will not be returning.  And to be honest, if I had to choose, I'd much rather take my money over to Hometown now that it will be less crowded OR starve.   We arrived five minutes to 6, and the line was already out the door.  We waited a good 20 minutes before we made it to the cash register.  We were able to take advantage of the 2 for $20 special.  The promotion starts after 4 pm, Monday thru Thursday.  The third person had to pay the regular price, eh, no big deal.  We were seated fairly quickly after we paid.    Food was just okay, maybe slightly better than HTB, but not by much.  That cotton candy machine brings a nice touch to the dessert station, but it is super sticky that I did not bother with it.  Everything else was overly sweet.    Service was just okay as well.  Our server forgot to refill my brother's soda, and she never bothered to ask if I needed refill with my water.  I think the drink station should be made accessible to make things easier for all of us.    I can't say I was too disappointed with this place as I didn't have high expectations to begin with.  So if you go in with that attitude, then you'll be alright.

Like many of the other reviews, we saw the commercials and heard great things about Golden Corral. So today we were committed to try it out. When you first pull up to the restaurant, there are day laborers relaxing under the trees because the Home Depot is right there. No big deal. The second you walk in, you are hit with the realization that you just walked into the lions den. Ghetto is the only word that comes to mind, and it's not even a fair understatement.  Ratchet people everywhere.  Then, for someone who hasn't been there before, you have the fountain drink station before you even talk to anybody. So we asked the cashier for instructions. She said to get either the disposable fast food type plastic cups with lids and a straw or use the reusable cloudy plastic cups... I went with the disposable solely because of the area and uneasiness I felt. So I end up paying $25 and some change for my wife and I. You seat yourself. Don't wait for someone to come and seat you to a table, you will be waiting for a long time. When I asked the cashier where the straws were, she told me that the waitress will give them to you when you sit down at a table... I'm sure this is to control people from walking in, grabbing a drink, and leaving without paying. Again, very ghetto. So we go and start looking at the food and to my pleasant surprise,  all of the food looked fresh and rather good. So we start filling up our plates with small portions of everything they had to offer. Everything my wife and I ate was actually very good. Surprisingly enough, the pizza was really good and I had extremely low expectations due to the quality of pizza being served at casino buffets. My wife really enjoyed the pot roast. We ended up having two plates of small portions each and everything except the chicken fajitas was awesome. Skip on the chicken fajitas... Trust me. Then we move on to the desert section, my favorite part. Everything looked extremely well plated and delicious. I had some of the soft serve ice cream, the banana pudding, and a piece of white cake with strawberry flavoring. Very good. All in all, the food is better than every casino buffet in my opinion. I am born and raised in Vegas and have eaten at most, if not all, of the casino buffets and they just don't compare. Why 3 stars? Solely because of the environment.  The cashiers are all ratchets, the cooks are ghetto and can be heard cussing and street talking behind the cook line. Very unprofessional.  If they could pick the entire building up, dump the people out of it, and transport it to say summerlin or even a little farther west, we would definitely go back. If you're a female,  I suggest not going by yourself or at night. Wish they would open another one in a much better area, they would have much better workers and guests. When your business is in the ghetto, you have ghetto guests.

Let me start with the silverware- they're not clean! Luckily they had packaged disposable forks, knives and spoons.  I usually don't eat steak because I like it dry and burnt, surprisingly it was cooked right to my liking, no pink baby. That's probably the highlight of my meal. That and the freshly baked yeast rolls. So yummy, you don't need the extra butter to mess it up. Green beans  were canned and overcooked. The fried chicken didn't have enough flavor. The shrimp had too much breading, and the fountain drinks seemed to be on their last leg. I now know why kids hate Brussel sprouts, they were horrible!  I almost forgot, the cheddar cheese biscuits were good. I love chocolate, but sadly their chocolate dessert offerings from cakes, pies and the famous chocolate fountain did not do it for me. Of course on the way out, who can resist the hand-scooped ice cream? I had the Butter Pecan, so creamy, I was so happy I left room for it.  And, no I will not talk about the restroom today. Someone's been calling me out on that =).

I'm not a Golden Corral kinda person- I was raised on "classier" (read: pricey) places, so I've been a bit of a restaurant snob. However, being a snob means you miss a lot of great places. Some are great for their atmosphere, others for the service, others for the food- or some combination of these. When I came to Vegas I was a bit disappointed in the places that get lots of stars and praise. Even my non-snobby partner has been sorely disappointed in the seafood and soul food places we've visited.   Today we tried the Golden Corral. I'd been to one in Ohio and don't have a lot of good memories- except for the fun company I was with. I expected low quality fare and general unpleasantness. I was pleasantly surprised.   Now, the atmosphere is nothing to write home about. The money here is not being spent on decor and dinnerware. Or bathroom maintenance. It was crowded as heck tonight, but this allowed a lot of people-watching, which is fun in a place that attracts such a wide range of humans. I like seeing people enjoying themselves. There were lots of young children, toddlers and some babies with parents and grandparents.   I've been to several buffets in town, on & off Strip. I'm usually disappointed in the local casino buffets. The food isn't well flavored and the desserts all seem to come from the same bland supplier. Little of the iconic fare, like Mac & cheese, taste anywhere close to authentic.   Golden Corral has them beat by a mile. The food tastes like your grandma invited the family for dinner, and then stuck her FOOT in it! (some of you will know what that means). Fried chicken the chefs weren't afraid to season properly. Buttery mashed potatoes with a few lumps instead of being perfectly pured to death by machine. Crispy hush puppies and fried shrimp. Whole catfish! Well, without the heads. Even the fried calamari tasted good.   Now, grandma does make some greasy food- but those hush puppies! Perfectly fried. I'm not into the slightly sweetened hush puppies but I forgave grandma and went for more. The fried okra was very good with no nasty okra-ness (it's okra, after all).   Parents seem to let their kids run around here- something I haven't seen at the casino buffets I've been to. I saw one young girl skipping through the crowd while innocently holding a steak knife, point-side up.   Dessert was more creative than other buffets. A chocolate fountain with humongous, sweet strawberries on sticks to wave underneath. Marshmallows and macaroons are also available.  They had the standard soft ice cream, cookies and cake slices, but they also had real ice cream, sherbet, and freshly made cotton candy. All the food was fresh, by the way.   Anyway, we hung out for over two hours because we had time to kill. Our server was excellent (hey, Nickie!) and we tipped her well to make up for the measly $2 tips she was getting from others and the time we spent. I can honestly say I was comfortable, had a good time, and actually enjoyed the food.

Last Sunday I went to eat.  I was pretty tired and not in a great mood and thought it would be fast and easy for me.  I have eaten here at least once per month since this place opened and always enjoyed it.  But... It had been awhile since we had been there.  Like I said when I went I was pretty dis-satisfied.  I am a tough person to dis-satisfy at a buffet as I am pretty versitle when it comes to eating.  First off I love their fried chicken.  Always fresh and crispy.  But I only like white meat.  They had two trays out and although one said white meat, all of the chicken was thighs and legs.  Now they have breakfast for lunch and dinner.  I do not eat breakfast food.  Ever.  Because they had to make room for breakfast food, that took some of the selection away from what they used to have.  I always like to drink chocolate milk when I eat there.  This time, when I asked the busser (or waitperson) told me I had to pay for it when I bought my meal.  I have never been charged before, and if they decided to begin charging extra for chocolate milk, they should tell you when you pay.  I made a taco.  With all of the taco fixings I took a plop of what I thought was sour cream and placed on top of my lettuce, salsa and meat.  Turned out it was whipped cream.  Ruined that taco.  The rest of the food was good as always, just don't think it will be worth it for me any longer.

Went again yesterday only because this is where the group I was with wanted to go.. This location needs help.  The one in Robinson is much nicer and cleaner.  This one seems to have a problem with staffing.  Our lady was really nice but we could tell she probably was stretched thin on the tables she served.  The plates were dirty,  you had to drink the ice cream with a straw it was so runny and the staff had a hard time keeping up with the dessert demand.  On a good note the salad bar was clean and fresh, they have lots of vegetable options and the food did not appear to be as salty.  Still if you have to do GC go to Robinson...

We've been wanting to try a Golden C. Restaurant for quite awhile.  I thought it unusual to get drinks before reaching the cash register.  After paying, we were directed to a table.  The entire area was filthy!  There was so many dirty tables nearby and the floor was simply a mess!  After finding the plate and silverware booth we could finally eat.  The food was pretty decent but many things were empty.  I had to go up more than once to find fresh offerings.  The staff just couldn't keep up.  There were never any spoons so they brought us plastic silverware for dessert.  The chocolate fountain was shut down because a child was double dipping... That area was a mess anyway.  All in all, a hugely disappointing experience.  We won't go back.

Fucking  disgusting their  prices are horrible they over charge you I spent almost $50.00 bucks on some nasty ass food and there was a dead roach in the women's restroom. Just disgusting would never eat there again.

I suppose it average. The food is decent and okay. Not much else. The BBQ meat is pretty good and i loved the breaded shrimp. Have plenty of choices but I don't go far and stay with the same things. Also, the big spoons to serve yourself with are really greasy and feel dirty. I'd suggest holding them with a napkin to keep your hands clean. Everyone touches it but that's what Buffet s are.  Also they have a small but good amount of desserts. I'd go again probably not something i'll go out of my way for.

Gonna give this place 4 stars because they were missing a couple things....  First let's start with the good... Me and two friends arrived about 10:30 or so on a Tuesday. It was just about $10 without drink and $12 and change with drink. Service was pretty decent, nothing to complain about there. My first plate had a sweet potato, a little bit of salad, and a couple deviled eggs, all which were pretty good.   Second plate had a piece of fried chicken and a piece of bbq chicken along with a mini corn dog and some cornbread with corn... or something along those lines. All of these were pretty good but the corn dog did seem a bit crunchy.   Third plate had some shrimp, some sweet potato casserole, some Bourbon chicken, and some meatloaf with mashed potatoes.   The sweet potato casserole was simply amazing, probably one of the best dishes I had for lunch, but the meatloaf was missing sauce..... it was still pretty good with some gravy from the mashed potatoes but I prefer the sauce that is supposed to come on meatloaf.   Desert plate: I was a bit disappointed because they usually have a chocolate lava cake and chocolate cream pie but I didn't see either. HOWEVER, the banana cream pie was amazing, and I did have a nice brownie with some soft serve ice cream, nuts, hot fudge, and whipped cream.  Overall I'd come back if I was in the area, but for the most part I'd probably stick to Old Country Buffet for similar food.

This place is an absolute zoo almost all of the time, but you can usually find just enough tasty food items to make it worth it. Staff service and be hit and miss. I've seen servers taking phone calls of their cell in the dinning room, but I'm sure they get peanuts for the work they do, so I don't hold it against them at all.

My 11yr old was clamoring for a buffet dinner and we were in S. Chandler... He'd never been to Golden Corral, so it was time, even though it was dinner rush on a Sunday night...  Sunday night is baby back rib night at GC.  We had to wait about 10 minutes to get through the line that started at the door.  Once inside, the food was simply edible.  I like their selection, they have more meat options than OCB, but nothing impressed me.  As usual, my kid spent more time with his ice cream cone with sprinkles, gummy bears, etc.  No complaints overall. It filled our tummies and fit the bill.

I dont know what the big whoop is about the place. The line is always insanely long. Prices are not that cheap and the food is bland and greasy. Compared to hometown buffet id rather eat at home town. Last night I was goung to try golden corral again until I saw the line was wrapped around the buildong going into the parkong lot. (Insane) I went to RedLobster instead and it was absolutely delicious. SKIP Golden Corral bland and not worth a wait.

Immediately upon entering the building, I was turned off by two things:  1. You have to go through a line with rails like an amusement park.  2.  As you approach the register..still in line.. you have to get your drink at the fountain.  It ends up the people drink what they initially filed up, then trying to go back you fill their cup again.  It was definitely annoying.  I was happy overall with the food.  A few highlights include the salad area & grill.  The salad area has tons of variety, and everything looked fresh.  I was also happy with the steak, as it was cooked to order on the grill.    My  only problem with the food was the catfish.  While the taste was okay, it was thin & bone-in.  So by the time I pulled the meat away from the bones, there wasn't much left. So I felt it could've been served better.    I agree with everyone on the cleanliness & service.   Getting refills on drinks and used plates cleared was a problem.  We could never seem to find out server; and other empty tables had plates stacked up for a while before they were cleared.  Food on the floor stayed there almost the entire time we were there, and the "clean" dishes & silverware had spots.  Sure, it's a buffet and I dint expect much, but for a place that is supposed to be a step up, I'd expect a step up.  Overall, I was happy & can see myself returning, but they can certainly improve on things.

I've come here twice, first time was probably all hype, cause the second time i came around it started to taste just like hometown buffet.  Basically thats all GC is , an improved upgraded version of hometown buffet. For around the same price, becareful at the door where they have beverages, they do charge for it.( a big more if you decide to grab the to-go cup as well)  Service is way above hometown buffet as they come by regularly , seem very sincere about serving and making your time there as pleasant as possible.  They do re-fill your drinks for you , unlike hometown which you do yourself.  The food there is pretty average-good the steak and salad bar are my favorites!  Go see for yourself and see what you guys think!
This place always one of my favorite neighbors restaurant. Always enjoyed coming here, I believe I had my 7 year birthday party here.  Need more food places like Golden Corral.

Your location is about 45-60 minutes away from or home.  When we arrived we were told that this super long  line would take about 1.5 hours.  We then proceeded to wait from 5:05 PM to 7:40 PM, over 2.5 hours.  As waited to be seated a 5 year old girl vomited on the carpet in front of the food in about 6 places and the staff reacted slowly to getting it up.  I am sure you can imagine how terrible it would be to wait that long on Father's Day and then be just 3 feet away from that.  Once we were seated it took 25 minutes to get a glass of water and the BBQ ribs we came to get were never available after 6 attempts to get them.   I told the manager and he brought a TOGO box with a few ribs as we left the location for us, but that was a waste as we were not headed home and the spoiled.   The location was super crowed and the plates, cups, forks and spoons came out wet and some of them still had food on them.  We had to wait in lines for 5-15 minutes to get any food items.  It was a terrible experience.

Usually not my kind of place but they have great veggie selection for my son.  Being from the south it's a plethora of southern style food and great dessert. This place is clean!!!! The nice waiter who waited on us yesterday that has "Prince in his name" was wonderful.  Always a smile and eager to help.  Ask my son, we will be back!!!

Never again will we go here or take or members here. The general manager was a rude as hell and disrespectful . The server there where also rude we where not done eating our food and the server took out plates when we where not done. They made it so uncomfortable for all of use to enjoy out lunch.  I five them please two thumbs down.

I dined here yesterday at noon, for the first time in quite a while. My experience was great in all respects. I tried several dishes and desserts: Steak medium rare with mushrooms and grilled onions/bell peppers, side salad w/Thousand Island, Salisbury Steak, Fried Chicken Breast (I ate Jalapeo Slices with it), Mashed Potatoes, Green Beans, Meatloaf, Fried Shrimp, Hush Puppies, Pizza. After all that (far more than I usually eat!) I had to wait a while before a few dessert indulgences that met expectations: Chocolate Cake, Banana Pudding, Peach Cobbler.  Lucy was my server, and she was friendly, attentive and kindly. I also had some interaction with Cat, and she seemed take care of her diners with friendliness and professionalism also. One of the other servers seemed a bit stressed and abrupt but oh well.  Given that it was a Sunday at noon, the place was very busy, and there were several queued up at the Chocolate Dip, yet everyone I interacted with was friendly and all too ready to lend a hand when I needed it (I'm disabled and use a powered wheelchair at places like this).  It's disappointing when other reviewers like Miss October 7th resort to such a scathing approach to try and knock down a well-established business. Don't let her dissuade you; it's a buffet, not a luxury five-star restaurant. If you like buffets, this one's very well run, and has several items to suit anyone's taste. I used to take my wife here fairly often while she was still alive, and we always enjoyed it. I'll be back.

I had seen several commercials for this place before I even knew it was being built in my area. SO I was hyped up about this place just by looking at the commercials. I went twice last week, not because I wanted to but I guess i had hyped it up beforehand too much haha. The first time I went on Tuesday at 1130am, I thought for sure there wouldn't be a line but yes there was a small 15 minute wait. The food was ok, much better than hometown that's for sure. Then we came on Saturday around 3pm, the line was about an hour and half. Luckily my brother-in-law was brave enough to wait for everyone. It was soo crazy busy, but some how the staff was still friendly and the managers made sure everything was running smoothly. The benefit of going for dinner is that they have made to order stations both steak and shrimp which was a nice surprise. I don't think I would go back for awhile until the lines are manageable and the buffet isn't as crowded.

I don't usually take time out of my day to make reviews but this has been one the worse meals I have ever over paid for!! Tea taste like cleaning solution, silverware nasty, carpet sour, hold building sour (even the glass over the food), table nasty, waiter slack. Really want my damn $15 back. Sick from the filth and over spending my damn hard earn money!! Don't go to Golden Corral S. Blvd Charlotte NC waste of $$ :(

i don't like writing bad reviews but this place just opened and you would think they would pay more attention to details like making sure the food was hot. it wasn't! everything was cold except for the milk which was warm. when you walk up they have a sign that says "breakfast with steak" total B.S. I asked where the steak was and they told me they only had steak with dinner! the sign said breakfast with steak. what are they trying to pull? do they think we are really that stupid? For the price you pay it is not worth it. the only cool part was that you can get cotton candy for breakfast. the plates are so small you cant get anything on it. maby that is their way of making us not eat as much. I was so pissed off by the end of breakfast I had to steal a bunch of fudge just to make myself feel better about getting ripped off by this place! believe me there are a lot of places in vegas with better quality and value. if you want a good breakfast, stay away from this place!

Damn... Where do I begin? To make this review "to the point", I love the food here...PERIOD. The only problem I have is the amusement park line to get inside the place! No bullshit, I waited in line outside in the heat for damn near 2hrs. Yes, the line actually starts in the parking lot. Once you get inside, you'll be dodging unattended children at the serving stations like orange cones on a obstacle course! Other than the crowd, this is a damn good place to get a meal. My guess is that they didn't anticipate this big of a rush. But honestly, for the amount of people they get, they have it pretty organized. Bottom line, I love the place. But at the end of the day you'll find yourself not being able to have the best experience possible due to the overwhelming traffic constantly walking by your table. I gave it 4 stars since I genuinely like the place. I just can't deal with the crowds and kids set free to roam at will. In conclusion, your choices are, "Do you want to wait? Or do you want to eat? (meaning going somewhere else where you can walk straight in... the choice is yours)."

The myriad of food and dessert options alone makes this place a favorite with my kids and for the prices they charge, can definitely not be beaten with a stick of any size. I know, I tried!  Yes, the food may not be stellar, but it's a buffet. The food is edible and satisfying. Enough said.  Now on to the people watching....YIKES! Never mind, I won't spoil it for you with any further comments on that. You need to see for yourself.  The service is always very pleasant, so remember to bring cash folks. You can't tip with your credit card here and these guys work hard and put up with, well, refer to the people watching above. Just because you get your own food here, doesn't mean you clean up your own mess or should avoid tipping AT LEAST 10-15%!

Had a bad experience before but my girlfriend wanted to visit it again. Gotta give them what they want Gave them another try, and oh boy I forgot how amazing a southern buffet is.  New management fixed this place up, but don't take my word for it, see it for yourself!! We'll be coming back   Try the mini cheeseburgers during lunch they are the best!!

No. Just no.  My family was visiting and wanted to go to the golden corral because we used to go to one in Florida that was really good. This one was soooooo unbelievably dirty and disgusting.  I saw some pretty unsanitary things coming from the workers and there was food all over the floor. I'll be contacting corporate.

I must say. When this first place opened, we were soooooooo happy. It was definitely our go to spot. As time past, it's gotten worse. Yesterday,  we were there, we didn't get a single plate removed from our table. We didn't even get a refill on our drinks!!!!! They ran out of silverware and the food tasted old. I don't think I'd be going there any time soon.

I went here with my boyfriend and his family for dinner. When we got there, there was a very long line. When we got in, I was very pleased with the food selections. The ones that stood out to me was the steak (I had it in medium rare, yum!).   Oh, and don't forget about dessert! There's a chocolate fountain! Marcus and I got to make our own chocolate dipped strawberries. Also there's cotton candy!   TIP: I would recommend coming in toward the end of lunch, since you can stay for dinner. In essence, you're paying the "lunch" price for dinner. Your wallet and tummy will thank you for that.   I would recommend this place for everyone. :)

I am being kind and giving 3 stars but I would really consider this more of a 2 1/2. Yes there is a lot of food and you can have as much as you want but the food is not very good. Every time we have been there we have to wait for a table to be cleared. I had family visiting who wanted to come here and probably won't return until they come back.

Prices are average for a buffet and there are some good choices. You get to seat yourself if it's not full. The last visit was the worst visit so far. Didn't like how two guy employees were standing by the drinks area gossiping in spanish. Annoying. Some of the food they were putting out was under cooked which is weird because it wasn't busy or full.

Lots of choices, really nice waiter staff, the staff behind the bar seem more not really caring about the customers on the other end they make it seem like it's a joke. Glad it's a fun atmosphere but I watch two guys not care what they say or how they act. Food 5stars, wait staff 5stars, cooks behind the counter 3 star.

Unfortunately my experience was less than pleasant. My sister bragged about the food at this place (not this location) so that is where we went. We tried a lot of different things and were all disappointed. Went on for dessert and yet again, disappointed. After siting and talking we went up to the front to complain. The manager came up and immediately had an attitude. Insisting that since we had been seated for an hour that he wouldn't refund the meal. Even though with proof of my receipt I can prove it was less than 45 mins.. I digress. I told him to ask his busser. We sent back pretty full plates of food each time. He then processed to get louder and louder and more and more irritated.. Arguing with me that I couldn't be unsatisfied because I sat for an hour and the food there is fantastic.. How much time I was seated is irrelevant. I sent back a ton of food because I was not satisfied. It was either under seasoned or over seasoned. He was very rude and tried to make a scene out of the situation. At the end of it all he said he couldn't refund my money that I would need to come back and talk to a different manager who had the authority. I am only driving through Vegas so I will be contacting corporate and will most definitely be contacting someone who has the authority to give me my money back!! I wouldn't make such a big deal about this had he not been so rude. I do not recommend this establishment. It is not worth it!!

I usually don't review chains, but I've been eager to try golden corral for years. Everytime I watch ESPN or Fox sports they constantly have commercials about Golden Corral. The first thing I tried were the ribs. To give them credit, the ribs are tender and fall off the bone. But the meat itself is so fatty, it's hard to finish eating them-just way to fatty. Basically all the food is as flawed as the ribs, there's an upside and a down side. I'm being generous by giving them a 3 star review. Truthfully, it should be a 2 star review. There's no reason to wait an hour to try their food. I look back, and I can't believe I had hope. Is it better than hometown buffet? Yes, but not by much.

I came to the Golden Corral with my family on a Thursday night to beat the out-the-door line. We still had about a 15 minute wait until we finally reached our table.  The Golden Corral offers tasty food for a very generous price. It's about $15 for all-you-can-eat dinner and a drink. For my drink, I got the sweet tea, which I thought was delicious.  I was really impressed with the quality of the food. For the price we paid, mostly everything tasted great! The fried chicken was really juicy, as was the steak (mine was ordered medium well). Everyone wants steak though, so be prepared to wait in line for it. They had a lot of variations of chicken, (fried, rotisserie, BBQ, teriyaki) but I only tried the fried chicken, which was crispy and fully of flavor. The BBQ pulled pork was pretty good, too. I also liked the mashed potatoes and gravy. For dessert, of course I got the cotton candy! So good and a very generous serving.   As for my dislikes, I didn't care too much for the Mac n cheese; it was undercooked. The corn was seasoned well, but slightly overcooked; it was rather mushy already. I tried the pot roast, and it was still really dry despite it being doused in gravy. The southern fried fish was much too salty.
